loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear and blankets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Delsi Avadesa

texts.es:
Delsi es una persona muy entusiasta y trabajadora, tiene 21 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su esposo y su hijo.
Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante es por eso que desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en una Tienda de Calzados como vendedora, es una excelente vendedora porque trabaja día a día con mucho empeño y porque atiende con mucha amabilidad y respeto. Su mayor motivación es su hijo por quien cada día lucha para brindarle un futuro mejor. Delsi está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda y realizar los trámites de posesión del terreno para que más adelante pueda cumplir su gran sueño: "Construir su casa de material noble y brindarle estudios superiores a su hijo".
texts.en:
Delsi is a hardworking and enthusiastic individual. She is 21 years old and lives in Ica with her husband and son. Delsi has tremendous drive to move forward. For this reason, she began working more than a year ago as a salesperson at a shoe store. She does an excellent job because she works every day with great effort and provides friendly and respectful service. Her greatest motivation is her son, so she strives each day to give him a better future.

Delsi is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they have provided. She will be able to remodel her home and file the paperwork for gaining possession of her land. Delsi presses on so that she can fulfill her greatest wish of building a house of solid materials and providing a superior education for her son.

loans.use: to remodel her home and file the paperwork for gaining possession of her land.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 30-years-old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala southern region of Uganda. She is married and has four children; two of them are currently in school. For the past five years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household items such as kettles and saucepans. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential household items such as kettles and saucepans, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to own other businesses in town. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential household items such as kettles and saucepans to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Cecilia  tiene 39 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de variedad de artículos de bazar como lanas, hilos, al por mayor y menor  en su  puesto de venta  que se encuentran ubicado  en la zona de Pacajes de la ciudad del Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Cecilia va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como variedad de telas al por mayor,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su puesto de venta ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda ya que por el fuerte frio muchas personas compra lana para realizar tejidos de chompas, la señora cecilia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas bazar, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén donde pueda ofrecer no solo lanas sino telas también  ya que este es uno deseos, se siente feliz y agradecida con kiva por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Cecilia is 39 years old and sells a variety of bazaar items, such as yarns and threads in large and small quantities, from her stall in the Pacajes area of El Alto.  This will be her first loan through the institution and she will use the money to buy merchandise, such as fabric in quantity, to stock her business.  She is asking for this loan because she needs to stock her stall because the high demand season is coming.  Because of the extreme cold, many people buy yarn to make sweaters.  Cecilia faces challenges such as competition because there are many shops in the area.  She is going to use the benefits to continue buying merchandise, increase her capital, and be able to have a shop where she can sell not only yarn, but also fabric.  She is happy and grateful to Kiva for giving her this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Yanet Guadalupe

texts.es: Yanet tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien hace todo lo que esta en sus manos para dar a su familia lo necesario. Yanet solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un corredor en su vivienda para proteger sus pertenencias de las lluvias. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Yanet is 38 years old and resides in her own home along with her husband and children. She is a hardworking woman who does everything she can within her power to provide what her family needs.

Yanet is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the construction of a corridor in her home to protect her belongings from the rain. The amount she requested will be used to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails in order to build a corridor in her home.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María, opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar ganado a buen precio, lo cuidara y venderá con un buen margen de ganancias, así su negocio se mantendrá funcionando y tendrá recursos económicos con los que cubrirá los gastos familiares y pagara su deuda.
La inversión anterior le dejo mejores ingresos con la venta del ganado, su familia se mantiene  en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
María decided to request a new loan in order to buy livestock at a good price. She will care for the animals and sell them at a good profit margin. This will keep her business functioning so that she can have income to cover her family expenses and repay her debt.

Her previous investment resulted in better earnings from the sale of livestock. Her family still lives in optimal conditions.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: José Ezequiel

texts.es:
José de 29 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a una escuela, como todo buen salvadoreño  luchador, aprendió por sus propios medios, con algunos mayores con los que sabían se reunían para que le enseñaran, también sus padres jugaban un papel importante en la enseñanza de su hijo, que por razones de no haber escuelas en la zona no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela. Se casó a la edad de los veinte y dos  años, a procreo 5  hijos con su pareja, los que van a la escuela son tres los otros por no tener la edad suficiente no están yendo, su esposa es ama de casa, ella es la que se encarga de las labores del hogar. 

Él es agricultor, tiene más de quince años de realizar la actividad, su padre desde pequeño lo indujo por el buen camino, siendo responsable. La parcela donde trabaja le queda retirado a un kilómetro, el recorrido lo hace a pie, también es albañil hace trabajos a las personas que lo buscan en la comunidad, también repara electrodomésticos, con lo que tiene un ingreso extra de dinero. Cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás para el consumo, nadie más se involucra en la actividad, el trabajo lo hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 md.


El préstamo será invertido en el pago de mano de obra de personas que le ayuden a trabajar, también comprara los insumos agrícolas (abono, herbicida, etc.) la mejora que el préstamo hara, es poder tener ya todo preparado para la siembra del cultivo del maíz.

Su deseo es seguir primero Dios trabajando, educar a sus hijos y que tengan lo necesario, la agricultura es el trabajo más realizado en la zona, por lo que de eso depende sus hijos, la ayuda que el préstamo ara es el poder iniciar sus trabajos, las ganancias de la venta del cultivo será para la manutención de su familia y el pago de la cuota.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old. He did not have the opportunity to go to school, but like all good Salvadoran fighters, he learned on his own. A few adults that he knew would meet in order to teach him, and his parents played an important role in teaching their son. Since there were no schools in the area, he did not have the opportunity to attend school. He got married when he was 22 years old, he has five children with his wife, three of them go to school and the others do not because they are not old enough. His wife is a stay at home mom, and she is the one who takes care of the housework.

He has been a farmer for more than 15 years, and his father encouraged him to be on the right track since he was young, like being responsible. The plot of land where he works is one kilometer away, and he walks there. He is also a construction worker, he does work for people who find him in the community. He also repairs electrical appliances, which gives him extra money. When he harvests the crops, he sells a portion and the rest is for personal consumption, nobody else is included in the work. He works from 6:00 am until 12:00 pm.

The loan will be spent on paying for the labor costs of the people who help him work, and also to buy agricultural supplies (manure, herbicide, etc.). The improvement from the loan, will allow everything to be ready to plant the corn crop.

His dream is to first follow God at work, to educate his children and to make sure they have the necessities. Farming is the most practiced job in the area, consequently his children depend on it. The loan will help by allowing him to start his work, and the profit from the sale of the crop will be to support his family and to pay dues.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs of the people who help him with work, and to buy farming supplies (manure, herbicide, etc.). The improvement from the loan, will allow everything to be ready to plant the corn crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala southern region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods such as sugar and salt for the business. The loan will help Aisha to generate greater profits and take good care of her family by providing enough to support their basic needs. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for her general store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computer equipment for starting a cybercafé.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Marta es una digna representante de la mujer trabajadora y verraca.
Es una mujer muy mayor pero tiene la energía de cualquier joven. En su vida ha podido recoger gran experiencia en el área agrícola gracias  a la ayuda de su esposo quien le enseño el oficio hace muchos años.
Ella tiene unos pequeños cultivos de plátano y adicionalmente trabaja en otras fincas como agricultora.
Solicita un préstamo para darle un impulso significativo a su actividad comprando algunos insumos agropecuarios como abonos y pesticidas para la preparación y mantenimiento de sus tierras.
Ella sueña con tener una casa propia y unos cultivos sanos que le permitan disfrutar de una vida estable.
texts.en:
Marta is a proud representative of the working woman, and brave. 

She is a woman of advanced years, but she has the energy of any young person. In her life she has been able to have great experience in the area of agriculture, helping her husband who taught her to farm many years ago.

She has some small plots of bananas and also works in other plantations as a farmer.

She is requesting a loan to give a significant boost to her business, buying some farming supplies such as fertilizer and pesticide to prepare and maintain her lands.

She dreams of having her own home and some healthy crops to enjoy a stable life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of fish. Her business goal is to be a supplier of fish within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for her retail shop.

loans.name: José Nicolas

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, gracias a sus padres aprendió lo necesario para leer y escribir, se casó a la edad de los 24 años cuando considero que podía tener una responsabilidad de un matrimonio, decidió dar ese paso, su pareja se dedica a los oficios de la casa cuida los niños y es la que está al pendiente de todo lo de la casa. Sus dos hijos son menores de edad por lo que solo en casa pasan.


Él se dedica a la agricultura, desde que era pequeño su papá le enseño a trabajar la tierra, con lo que fue creciendo en el gusto por la agricultura, él siembra maíz, maicillo y frijol, esto lo hace cada época de invierno, también es motorista, ya tiene quien lo busca cuando hay que hacer algún viaje, el trabajo de motorista lo aprendió de un amigo que le enseño y lo que hoy en día le está sirviendo y obtiene ingresos al hogar, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, la distancia donde cultiva le queda a un kilómetro de distancia, el recorrido lo hace a pie, nadie más se dedica a la actividad, su horario de trabajo es de las 5:30 am a 1:00 am.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para el pago del arrendamiento de la tierra y la compra de abono, herbicidas, pesticidas,  para la preparación de la siembra, también con esto paga personas que le ayuden a trabajar,  ya que por ser solo en la casa no tiene quien le ayude. La necesidad satisfecha es el poder dar inicio a lo que mejor sabe hacer, y poder tener el capital que necesita para iniciarlo.

Los sueños que tiene es ver crecer a sus hijos y darles lo que este a su alcance también que le vaya muy bien en la cosecha, ya que con esto asegura que su familia tenga lo necesario para pasarla. La ayuda del préstamo es el poder tener un dinero para iniciar, al sacar las cosechas una parte la vende y lo otro para cualquier necesidad lo va guardado, de lo que provendrá el pago de la cuota del crédito.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old, he studied up to 6th grade, thanks to his parents he learnt enough to read and write. He married at 24 years old when he felt he could take on the responsibility of marriage so he decided to take that step. His partner looks after the home and takes care of the children  and she is the one who takes care of things at home. His two children are grown up now, and so they just pop in to visit sometimes.

He works in farming, since he was young his father taught him to work the land, so he grew up liking farming. He grows corn, sorghum [grass used for fodder] and beans. He sows these every winter. He is also a driver, there is always someone asking for him when a trip needs to be taken. He learnt to be a driver from a friend and now it is helping to earn income for his family. He doesn't have any more jobs. His land is one kilometer from his home, he walks there. Nobody else works on the farm. He works from 5:30am to 1:00am.

He is asking for a loan to pay rent on his land and to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, get the land ready and pay people who help him work, as he is alone at home and doesn't have anyone who helps him. He needs to have the ability to start that which he knows best, and to have the capital he needs to start it.

The dreams he has are to see his children grow and give them what he can manage, to have a very good harvest, as that is what ensures his family will have what is necessary to get through. The help of the loan is to have some money to start with, to get harvests and sell part of them and the other part he will keep for any need the family has, he will give what comes to pay the loan installments.

loans.use: to pay for the rent on the land, buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, get the land ready and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Caspar

texts.es: Es un hombre luchador, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 45 años de edad, casado, tiene 6 hijos: 3 mayores de edad, uno que cursan su primer año de universidad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria.  Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace aproximadamente 8 años ha establecido una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: granos básicos, chiverías, detergentes, sopas instantáneas, leche en polvo entre otros productos. Su sueño es ahorrar y apoyar al desarrollo profesional y humano de sus hijos.
texts.en:
He is a hard-working man, originally from Puerto Cabezas. He is 45 years old, married, and has six children: three are adults, one in the first year of university and two teenagers who study in high school. With the goal of having his own source of income, he established a small convenience store in his home about eight years ago.

He is asking for funding to buy goods: staple grains, snacks, detergents, instant soups, powdered milk and other products. His dream is to save money and to support the professional and human development of his children.

loans.use: to buy goods: staple grains, snacks, detergent, instant soups, powdered milk and other products.

loans.name: Idalia

texts.es: Es una señora amable, tiene 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos: El mayor de 22 años cursa su segundo año de carrera universitaria en una universidad del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, el adolescente estudia su segundo año de secundaria y la menor estudia su tercer nivel de nivel de pre-escolar. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, es albañil. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos. Desde hace 14 años estableció en su vivienda una pequeña pulpería. Solicita  financiamiento, para comprar mercadería para su negocio. Su sueño es comprar un taxi, para tener otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
She is a friendly 36-year-old-woman, who is married, with three children. The oldest is 22 years old and studying in second year of university in the city of Puerto Cabezas, the teenager studies second year of high school and the youngest is in the third grade of elementary school. 

Her husband works informally in construction. With the goal of having her own source of income, she established a small convenience store in her home at the age of 14.

She is requesting funding to buy goods for her business. Her dream is to buy a taxi to have another source of income.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise: basic grains, eggs, Chiverías, soda pop, bread, instant noodles, laundry soap, and other products.

loans.name: Norman

texts.es: Es un hombre trabajador y luchador, originaria de Waspan, desde hace aproximadamente 5 años se trasladó a Puerto Cabezas por situaciones  familiares, tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y 4 de ellos  adolecentes y uno de 1 años, uno de ellos de 11 años cursa su tercer grado de primaria. Desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, vivía en una champa de plástico pero ahora actualmente ya está viviendo en casa de tambo de madera, en la cual habitan 9 personas. Con el objetivo de seguir con la construcción de su vivienda solicita este financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc clavos. Su sueño es terminar de construir poco a poco su casa y ayudar a sus hijos a que culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Norman is a hard-working, determined man, originally from Waspan. Approximately five years ago, he moved to Puerto Cabezas for family reasons. He is 52 years old with seven children. Two of them are adults, four are adolescents, and one is one year old. One of them, an 11-year-old, is in the third grade.
 
He was living in a plastic tent for about three years, but he is now living in a wooden stilt home with eight other people. With the goal of continuing to build his house, he is requesting this loan in order to buy construction materials, such as wood, zinc, and nails. His dream is to finish building his house little by little and to help his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as wood, zinc, and nails

loans.name: Cactulo Enrique

texts.es:
Todas las mañanas, Cactulo de 50 años, se levanta junto con su esposa y suegra para preparar los refrescos que venderán en el día, más la leche agria, las cuales desde hace 21 años, sirven como sustento en su hogar. Este comerciante y padre de cuatro hijos de 12, 21, 23 y 24, está a cargo de su esposa y uno de sus hijos que todavía va a la escuela. Cactulo solo pudo estudiar su primaria, pero con su dedicación y esfuerzo salió adelante. Fue asalariado, pero luego de haber sufrido un problema en su columna, tuvo que ser jubilado. Sin embargo, sus sueños no terminaron allí, pues invirtió en el negocio de su esposa y consiguió trabajo como guarda de seguridad nocturno.
Don Cactulo está necesitando en estos momentos un préstamo para comprar la leche agria, las frutas, los vasos y azúcar por quintal para ahorrar dinero, obtener más productos que ofrecer y por supuesto incrementar sus ingresos. Entre sus planes está invertir en su casa, pero sus metas actuales son entrar en el negocio de la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Every morning Cactulo, 50, gets up with his wife and mother-in-law to prepare soft drinks to be sold during the day, as well as yoghourt.  Since he was 21 years old, this has served to support the family. This businessman and father of four children aged 12, 21, 23 and 24, is responsible for his wife and one of his children who still goes to school.

Cactulo could only study through primary grades, but his dedication and effort went ahead. He was hired, but after suffering a problem in his back, he had to retire. But his dreams did not end there.  So he invested in the business with his wife and got a job as a night security guard.

Cactulo needs now is a loan to buy sour milk, fruits, and sugar per quintal, and glasses to save money, and to get more products to offer and of course increase his income. Among his plans is to invest in his home but his current goals are getting into the business of selling food.

loans.use: to buy the youghert, fruit, glasses and sugar per quintal.

loans.name: Polly

texts.en:
Polly is 44 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Polly has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock for more food for sale, and will help Polly to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy another plot of land. 

Polly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs similar to Polly who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock for more food for sale for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Asiat

texts.en:
Asiat is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children. For the past five years, Asiat has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities.

To help expand her business, Asiat has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business, and will help Asiat to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. Asiat hopes that in the future she will be able to improve more on her business.

Asiat is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Asiat who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to prepare the land for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Juana Jessenia

texts.es: Es una mujer amable, trabajadora y luchadora. Tiene 30 años de edad, casada, desde hace 7 años estableció su propio negocio con el objetivo de tener fuentes de ingreso y mejor la calidad de vida. Este es su primer crédito que está solicitando, está muy agradecida con Pana Pana, su negocio ha mejorado, está bien surtida y ofrece diferentes productos para el hogar, ha aumentado en venta y número de sus clientes. Solicita este crédito para comprar mercadería: sillas plásticos, platos/vasos de vidrio, tinas, juegos de plástico de 7 piezas para la cocina. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
She is a friendly woman who is a fighter and a hard worker. She is 30 years old and married. 

Seven years ago she established her own business with the goal of having a source of income and a better quality of life. This is the first loan she is requesting. She is very grateful for Pana Pana, because her business has improved. It is well-stocked and offers different household products. Sales and the number of customers have increased.

She is asking for this loan to buy goods: plastic chairs, plates/glasses, jars, and a 7-piece plastic kitchen set. Her dream is to improve her business and to offer a better service for her customers.

loans.use: to buy goods: plastic chairs, plates/glasses, jars, and a 7-piece plastic kitchen set.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Valentina se dedica al cultivo de productos agricolas en combinación con la cria de animales Valentina no tiene pareja y percibe sus ingresos de forma semanal Valentina necesita credito nuevamente para  invertir en la compra de semilla mejorada para mantener sus ingresos, ella es una mujer muy responsable y por eso se recomienda que le ayuden
texts.en: Valentina is dedicated to the cultivation of agricultural products in combination with raising animals. Valentina is not in a relationship and she earns her revenue weekly. Valentina needs the loan to invest in the purchase of improved seeds to maintain her income. She is a very responsible woman and for this reason she is requesting help.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of improved seeds.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia se dedica al cultivo de productos agricolas en la combinacion con la cria de animales o explotación mixta Julia necesita un credito para compra de semilla mejorada para su negocio Julia tiene ingresos semanales por lo que se recomienda otorgarle el credito Ademas, la region de Palomar donde ella vive es un sitio donde Julia esta trabajando muy bien por lo que no hay dificultades para ella
texts.en:
Julia is dedicated to the cultivation of agricultural products in combination with raising livestock or mixed farming.  Julia needs a loan to purchase improved seed for her business.

Julia has weekly income which recommends granting the loan.  In addition, the region of Palomar where she lives is a site where Julia is working very well so there are no difficulties for her.

loans.use: to purchase improved seed for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa  se dedica al cultivo de productos agricolas en combinacion  con la cria de animales o explotacion mixta Rosa es de las personas que recibe ingresos semanales por la venta de su produccion de productos agricolas Rosa quiere un credito porque la inversion en semilla mejorada es un gran negocio que le puede brindar muchas oportunidades a Rosa 

Rosa vive en Palomar y tiene buena salud por lo que se recomienda ayudarla
texts.en:
Rosa is dedicated to the cultivation of agricultural products in combination with animal husbandry or mixed farming.  Rosa is a person who is receiving weekly earnings from the sale of her production of agricultural products.

Rosa wants a loan for investment in improved seed.  It is big business that can provide many opportunities for Rosa.

Rosa lives in Palomar and in good health so it is recommended to help.

loans.use: to invest in improved seed.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Jamila has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes of different types, and will help her to generate greater profits and buy some basic needs for her family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Jamila is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jamila who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes of different types

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past six years, Wilson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts.

To help expand his business, Wilson has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts to sell, and will help him to generate greater profits, improve his family's standard of living and pay school tuition. Wilson hopes that in the future he will be able to start up another branch of the same business.



Wilson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes and also decorations. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items that are used for decorating events, and will help her to generate greater profits and take care of her children's basic needs. She hopes that in the future she will be able to own another branch of the same business. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Winnie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items that are used for decorating events

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 31 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 7 years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, he has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes of different types, and will help him to generate greater profits and provide for the basic needs of his family. He hopes that in the future he will be able to own another branch of the same business. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes of different types

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, who all go to school. She has no additional family members. Sarah sells charcoal at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for the last 18 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of
200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting charcoal from her village to the market for sale. She lives in her own house and her family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a married and has several dependents that she takes care of. She is a resilient woman whose life has been dedicated to educating her children and providing for all of their needs. She is grateful that the Kiva lenders are willing to help poor people like them. She will use the loan to buy baby cows, especially bulls because they are cheaper and they grow in a short amount of time. She thinks she will be able to increase her income and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy baby cows for fattening and later sale

loans.name: Ebennencer Group

texts.es:
En una cominudad del estado de Oaxaca, 6 mujeres trabajadoras formaron un grupo al cual han puesto el nombre de EBENNENCER, cada una de la integrantes se dedica a una actividad económica productiva diferente.
Graciela- Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo
Claudia -Venta De Perfumes
Celia -Venta De Omnilife
Eluteria Cria Y Venta De Cerdos 
Maria Del Rosario -Venta De Antojitos 

Doña Cidronia ha dedicado 25 años de su vida junto con su esposo al servicio de fletes y mudanzas, el poder ayudar a otras personas a mudarse de casa (transportar muebles) es la actividad que le genera ganancias favorables con las cuales solventas los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos para tener  una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo otorgado lo utilizará para la compra de dos lonas para cubrir los bienes de las personas que solicitan su servicio pues la temporada de lluvia se aproxima, de la misma manera llevará el carro al servicio.

Cidronia agradece el apoyo otorgado y seguirá trabajando arduamente por su familia.
texts.en:
In a community in the State of Oaxaca, there are six hardworking women who formed a group under the name “Ebennencer”. Each member is devoted to a different productive business activity.

• Graciela sells shoes through catalogs.
• Claudia sells perfumes.
• Celia sells Omnilife products.
• Eluteria raises and sells pigs.
• Maria Del Rosario sells street food.

Doña Cidronia has devoted 25 years of her life along with her husband in providing cargo and moving services. Her business helps other people move and transport household furniture. This business generates favorable income that allows her to take care of the household expenses and those of her children so that they can have a better quality of life. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy two tarps for covering the belongings of customers who request her service. The tarps will protect the cargo, as well as the service vehicle, during the upcoming rainy season.

Cidronia appreciates the assistance that has been offered and will continue to work hard on behalf of her family.

loans.use: to buy two tarps for her cargo transport business.

location.town: Localidad El Zapote, Municipio Acatlan Oaxaca

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy es un joven emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Tiene 30 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de Guadalupe con su familia.
Tiene un precioso hijo por quien trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para poder brindarle todas las comodidades. Estudió la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma en un Instituto de la Ciudad donde vive y actualmente ejerce su profesión una prestigiosa empresa en Guadalupe.
Percy está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar una cuna para su hijo, para que pueda tener mayor comodidad y pueda crecer sano y fuerte. De esta manera Percy seguirá esforzándose en su trabajo para mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Percy is a young entrepreneur who is determined to get ahead.  He is 30 years old and lives in the district of Guadalupe with his family.  He has a precious son and works very hard to give him all the comforts of life.  Percy studied Agronomy Engineering at the institute in the city where he lives and he now works in his profession at a prestigious company in Guadalupe.

Percy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support he will be able to buy a crib for his little boy, to make him more comfortable and help him grow strong and healthy.  This will allow Percy to continue to do well at his job to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy crib for his little boy.

loans.name: Pefa

texts.en: Pefa is a 46-year-old married woman with 15 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. Pefa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, sprayers, a new crowbar, a tiller and new gum boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Pefa hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, sprayers, a crowbar, a tiller and gum boots

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es casada tiene dos hijos, vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Mercedes se dedica a la joyeria y necesita el credito para comprar plata y poder trabajar con la piedra la bolivianita, de esa manera podrá fabricar más  joyas. Su marido la apoya economicamente, él también se dedica a hacer joyas con plata, aun así, la pareja tiene muchos gastos y necesita ayuda
texts.en: Mercedes is married and has two children.  She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house which she owns.  She makes jewlery and needs a loan to buy silver so she can work with bolivianite stones and make more jewelry.  Her husband helps out economically and also makes silver jewelry.  Even so, the couple has many expenses and is in need of help.

loans.use: To buy silver and be able to work with bolivianite stones.

loans.name: Luz De Vida Group

texts.en:
Santiago Atitlán lies on an inlet between the volcanoes of Tolimán and San Pedro on the shores of beautiful Lake Atitlán in Guatemala. It is the largest of the communities on the lake with great natural beauty, cultural riches and a strong indigenous identity. The population is around 46,000 and those who live here are called “Atitecos”. The vast majority are Tz'utujil Maya, and both men and women dress in the colorful and traditional manner.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Luz de Vida” or “Light of Life”, is located here and is made up of eleven women. As the town is a magnet for tourism, artesians including most of the ladies in the Trust Bank create and offer all kinds of traditional crafts like beaded items and textile treasures. This is the first loan cycle for the eleven women and they are most excited and anxious to add capital to their small businesses.

The President of the Trust Bank is 32-year-old Rosa who attended school until the 4th grade. She is very motivated and takes her job seriously. She is a textile artist and creates beautifully adorned traditional belts called “fajas” that are embelished with beads and other materials. Rosa works out of her home and her children assist her so it becomes a family affair. She is requesting a loan to purchase beads by the kilo in order to create new and unique designs with the goal of increasing sales. The motivation of this dedicated woman is to be able to take care of the needs of her family, including the education of her five school-age children.

Rosa speaks for the ten women of the Trust Bank when she emphasizes the importance of the educational components of the monthly meetings, presented by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. The ladies want to be successful in their small businesses and so they are eager to learn how to come up with a successful business plan and budget. They want to learn about customer service. In addition, they are anxious to learn how to empower themselves with knowledge about self-esteem and women’s rights. The members of the Trust Bank want to steer their children into a successful future and so they are happy to learn how to get them ready for school and how to support them with healthy nutritious meals and good hygienic practices.

Thank you, KIVA investors, for funding the loans for the “Luz de Vida” Trust Bank. Each of you is a strong beam of light in the lives of these women! You can look forward to reading about their progress in a future report.

loans.use: To purchase beads by the kilo and create new and unique designs

loans.name: Karina Marcela

texts.es:
Karina, es casada, vive con su esposo y un hijo de cuatro años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la carpintería, por su parte Karina para apoyar en los gastos del hogar se dedica a vender semilla de marañón procesada, es decir que la compra en crudo, la tuesta, luego la limpia y al final la empaca para venderla al detalle y por mayor. El oficio lo aprendió de su mamá a los 14 años de edad, ya cuenta con 6 años de trabajar de manera independiente.
Aprovechará la temporada de la fruta para abastecer  lo suficiente el negocio y tener materia prima para mantenerse trabajando, comprara semilla de marañón y bolsas, espera que sus ventas aumente y con ello tendrá mejores ganancias que serán de utilidad para resarcir la deuda y cubrir los gastos familiares.
Su sueño es mejorar su situación económica, ofrecer a su familia una buena  alimentación, educación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Karina is married and lives with her husband and their four-year-old son. Her husband is a carpenter. Karina contributes to the household expenses by selling processed cashews. In other words, she buys raw cashews, toasts them, cleans them, and finally packages them for individual or bulk sales. She learned this trade from her mother when she was 14 years old. Karina has been working independently for the past six years.

She will take advantage of the cashew season so that she can stock up on sufficient inventory for her business. As a result, she will have everything she needs to keep working. Karina will buy cashew nuts and bags. Karina expects her sales to increase so that she can generate better earnings. This will help her to repay her debt and cover her family’s expenses.

Her dream is to improve her financial situation, as well as provide a good level of food, education, clothing, and health care for her family.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes and in larger quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 15 años de edad. Modesto es agricultor principalmente de hortalizas  como ayote, ejotes y güisquiles. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar.  Modesto desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para encementar el piso interior de la vivienda. Con el monto comprará cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
Modesto is 41 years old and resides in his own home along with his 15-year-old son. He is farmer who grows primarily vegetables such as acorn squash, green beans, and chayote squash. This is how he earns a living and sustains his household.

Modesto wants to improve the conditions at home, so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will lay down a concrete floor inside his house. The amount requested will be used to buy cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel in order to lay down a concrete floor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an iron and fabric.

loans.name: Nidia Luz

texts.es:
Nidia, junto a su esposo ha podido formar una unidad familiar y productiva bastante fuerte, ya que no solo prima el amor si no también los deseos de salir adelante y progresar como familia.
Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos de levante, es una actividad aprendida de su esposo quien actualmente se dedica a esta actividad y ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos durante mucho tiempo.
Ella pide un auxilio económico para comprar algunos cerdos pequeños e irlos cuidando y criando para posteriormente venderlos.
Ella es una mujer soñadora y gran voluntad, tanto así que ya piensa en grande y desea tener una marranera con gran capacidad.
Tiene gran ilusión y expectativa con este proyecto y confía en el buen corazón de las personas.
texts.en:
Nidia and her husband form a quite strong family and productive unit, since love is not the only priority but also a desire to get ahead and prosper as a family.

She raises and sells pigs, a business she learned from her husband who is in this line of work and has earned a living this way for a long time.

Nidia is requesting economic help to buy small pigs to raise so she can later sell them.  She is a visionary with a strong, so she thinks big and is already planning to have a pig farm with great capacity.  She is very excited about the project and has faith in the goodness of people.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Celso Isaias

texts.es:
Celso tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado de nivel académico, está soltero ya que su pareja anterior se fue fuera del país y no pudo continuar su relación, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres y un hermano por lo tanto solo el papá y la mamá depende de él.

Celso es agricultor, aprendió el oficio desde que tenía 15 años de edad y se lo enseñó el abuelo ya que él era un joven que le gustaba mucho andar con el abuelo y fue así como aprendió dicha actividad, hoy en día don Celso le agradece al abuelo por haberle inculcado este oficio, además con mucho esfuerzo han comprado un terreno en el cual pretenden cultivar café, el trabajo agrícola lo hace en un horario de 6:00 AM a 1:00 PM.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para realizar la siembra de café y pagar a los mozos.

Sus sueños a futuro son tener bastante vida y fuerzas para seguir cultivando y poder tener una finca muy grande con mucho café, y si es posible sacar este producto al extranjero, sacar excelente cosechas y así tener ingresos para sus padres y demás sueña con formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Celso, 38, has a fourth grade education.  He is single because his ex-partner left the country so they were unable to continue the relationship.  He has no chlidren and lives with his parents and a brother, so only his parents are dependent on him.

Celso is a crop farmer and started learning the trade when he was 15.  His grandfather was the one who taught it to him since he used to enjoy working by his side.  This is why he went into the business.  Nowadays, Celso is grateful to his grandfather for having taught him about agriculture.  Through much effort he was able to buy land where he wants to grow coffee.  He works from 6:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. in his agriculture activity.

The loan he is requesting is to plant coffee and hire workers.  His dreams for the future are to live a long life and have enough strength to continue his work on a large plantation with abundant coffee.  If possible, he wants to produce excellent harvests and export his product so he can earn more income for his parents.  He also wants to form his own family.

loans.use: To plant coffee and hire workers.

loans.name: Juan Blas

texts.es:
El viento resopla, los rayos del sol atravesando por las nubes limpias del día y las hojas de los arboles nos saludan cuando entramos a la finca de Juan, un agricultor de 47 años, quien hace más de 27 años entró en el negocio de las siembra de maíz, de trigo y de frijol, sin haber tenido la oportunidad de pasar por alguna educación que le enseñara. Don Juan es padre de 3 hijos, quien trata de inculcarles el estudio debido a su experiencia y está a cargo de su pareja, quien lo apoya en la siembra.
Juan a un pequeño ahorro el cual le ayudo a comprar semilla de frijol y los materiales para la siembra de la temporada. Afortunadamente, con ese pequeño ahorro le fue muy bien y logro  crecer. Ahora necesita de un préstamo para compra de semilla de siembra de frijol y para todos los materiales como fertilizantes, aspersor de agua para utilizarse en este nuevo ciclo, que ha sido afectado por el fenómeno de “El Niño”, entre otras cosas. Esto le ayudará a cumplir con sus metas de seguir creciendo, hacer su huerta sin problema alguno, poder producir un buen producto y a salir adelante, como siempre lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
The wind huffs and puffs, rays of sunlight pierce the day's new clouds, and the leaves of the trees greet us as we arrive at Juan's farm. He is a 47-year-old farmer, who started in the business of growing maize, wheat and beans more than 27 years ago, without having had the opportunity of an education that would help him. He is father to three children, in whom he tries to instil the value of studying, due to his own experiences, and he is cared for by his partner, who helps him in his farming.

Juan had some small savings, which helped him to buy bean seed and materials for the season's planting. Fortunately, by using these small savings, things went very well for him and he was able to expand. He now needs a loan to buy more bean seed for planting, and all the necessary materials such as fertilizers and a water sprinkler, to use in this new planting cycle, which has been affected by the El Niño phenomenon, among other things. This will help him to achieve his goals of continuing to grow, cultivating his farm without any problems, and being able to produce a good product and to keep on advancing, as he always has done.

loans.use: to buy bean seed and materials such as fertilizers and a water sprinkler.

loans.name: Moanamarie

texts.en: Moanamarie is a 26-year-old woman who is single with one child. She has a small lawn mowing business to earn a living. She has had two years in this business. Moanamarie needs a loan to buy a new lawn mower, gloves, safety glasses, new overalls and gum boots. She will use her profits to pay for her child's education. Moanamarie joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower, gloves, safety glasses, new overalls and gum boots

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is a 27-year-old unwed woman with two children. She runs a small soft drink stand in her community and has been doing this for four years. Rachel has requested a loan to buy cartons of soft drinks, a large cooler, a chest freezer and a large outdoor umbrella. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Rachel will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, a cooler, a chest freezer and an umbrella

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is 31 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling snacks and soft drinks in her community and has been doing this for four years. Malia has requested a loan to buy soft drinks, sandwiches, donuts, pies, twisties, coffee, sugar and foam cups. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Malia hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sandwiches, donuts, pies, twisties, coffee, sugar and foam cups

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods to supply her beauty products business

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es: Pedro es un señor que vive en unión libre con una señora y tienen 3 hijos, Pedro comenta que vivía  en una ciudad grande y que ahí trabajaba de albañil pero el sueldo no le alcanzaba por que los gastos de vivienda, alimentación y otros gastos eran muy caros y así que hace 1 años decidió regresar a su ciudad natal a  San Gabriel que es un buen lugar donde hay  tranquilidad y los productos no son tan costosos ya que es un lugar productor,  el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de madera para incrementar su negocio, su aspiración es readecuar su negocio y cubrir los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pedro is a gentleman who is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his wife and their three children. Pedro says that he lived in a large city where he worked as a bricklayer, but his salary was not enough to cover the household expenses, food, and other costly incidentals. A year ago he decided to return to his birthplace of San Gabriel, which is a peaceful and dynamic place where products are not as expensive.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wood so that he can increase his business. His aspiration is to re-equip his business and cover his children’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy wood for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s school fees, uniform, and books

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 70 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres pensaban que estudiar era pérdida de tiempo y que solo debían trabajar en la agricultura para sobrevivir,  ahora él está acompañado y ha procreado 4 hijos que ya formaron sus propios hogares y por lo tanto solo su pareja depende de él.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15  años de edad, aprendió el trabajo ya que  su padre lo llevaba al campo y él se fijaba, esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene y trabaja en un horario de 6:00 a 11:00 AM.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar 6 sacos de abono ya que la milpa va en un desarrollo muy bueno y por lo tanto es el momento de echarle el abono para que el cultivo sea de muy buena calidad.

Sus metas y propósitos son poder tener una buena producción este año con la ayuda de Dios, pues desea ir ahorrando con las cosechas para ampliar su casa ya que donde vive actualmente es muy pequeño.
texts.en:
Juan, 70, was unable to get an education because his parents thought it was a waste of time, believing working in agriculture was the only way to survive.  Now he has common-law wife and four children who have established their own households, so only his wife depends on him.

Juan has worked in agriculture since the age of 15.  He learned the job by watching his father work in the field.  This is his ownly source of income and he works from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan he is requesting is to buy six bags of compost since the corn field is developing very well and it is a good time to fertilize the corn to produce a top quality crop.

His goals and objectives are to produce a good harvest this year with God's help.  He wants to save enough to expand the house where he lives currently because it is very small.

loans.use: To buy six bags of compost.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand her business of selling dried fish

loans.name: Armée Du Salut Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kibindu est une commerçante et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Armée du Salut», entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans, mariée  et mère de 3 enfants dont 1 scolarisé et 3 sont encore petits. La cliente est une vendeuse d’haricots et braise. Elle étale sa marchandise à domicile dans un quartier commercial de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de Hekima. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Il y a 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs d’haricots et 3 de braises.  Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler que certainess cliententes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
The client Kibindu is a merchant and member of the "Armée du Salut" business group. A 30-year-old entrepreneur, she is married with three small children, of whom one attends school.

The client sells beans and charcoal. She displays her goods at home in a commercial district of the city. She started her business with funds received from Hekima. Her spouse is also a merchant. She has been performing this activity for the past three years.

This new loan will serve to buy two bags of beans and three of charcoal. She would like to buy a plot, build a house, and educate, clothe and feed her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima considerably for empowering non-bankable women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time in the post-conflict region of the country. It should be noted that certain clients carry their babies.

loans.use: buy two bags of beans and three bags of charcoal

loans.name: Uwe Macho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zawadi est une commerçante depuis 5 ans, présidente et membre de la banque communautaire «Uwe macho», entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui  tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des poulets. Elle étale sa marchandise  à domicile dans l’avenue d’intenses mouvements de la ville et s’entraide avec son mari. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des aliments pour ces poulets (2 sacs de maïs, 1 sac de soja  etc.). Elle commença ses business  avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire un grand poulailler, scolariser et  nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs  non bancable.
texts.en:
The client Zawadi has been a merchant for the past five years. President and member of the "Uwe macho" community bank, she is a dynamic 38-year-old entrepreneur, mother of six children who all attend school.

She sells chickens and displays her goods from her home in one of the city's busy avenues. She and her husband help each other out. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her activities, and she will buy chicken feed (two bags of maize, one bag of soy, etc.).

She started her business with funds received from her husband. For the future, she wants to increase her working capital, build a large chicken coop, educate and feed her children. 

She thanks Hekima for the support it provides to non-bankable women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy chicken feed (two bags of maize, one bag of soy, etc.)

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe Lafia sont mariés uniquement dans des ménages monogamiques, elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates), friperies et restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme  assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (tomates). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 corbeilles de tomates en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila  en ambulant et à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Lafia group are married only in monogamous households. They are on average 32 years old with three children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the Mande district, part of the Kati circle, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in condiments (tomatoes), second-hand clothing and food preparations. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Mariam (the woman sitting in the second position from left to right in the photo) is a great seller of condiments (tomatoes). She intends to use her loan to buy wholesale five baskets of tomatoes at Medina. Retail sales are conducted as an itinerant vendor in Kanadjiguila to a clientele composed mostly of women.

With this loan Mrs. Mariam hopes to attain average monthly profits of 55,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan. She is 47 years old and has a child who is in college. She breeds and raises pigs to provide income for their everyday needs and expenditures.

She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 10,000 in sales every month.

Concepcion’s family is one of those affected by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what they lost. Concepcion is taking out a PHP 20,000 loan to buy additional hogs and feed. 

In the future, she hopes that she will have more piggies to raise and desires for her one and only child to finish school.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs

loans.name: Frances Tovia

texts.en: Frances is a 35-year-old woman who is married with two children. She has a taxi to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years. Frances needs a loan to buy new tires, new seat covers, engine oil and a new taxi sign. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. Frances joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, seat covers, engine oil and a taxi sign

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 37 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling pies, donuts and cakes in her community and has been doing this for six years. Maria has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, yeast, olive oil, sugar and a new oven. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maria will help pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, yeast, olive oil, sugar and a new oven

loans.name: Seyereye Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les cinq (05) membres du groupe Seyereye ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila.  Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, fruits (bananes),  produits cosmétiques, oignons, et pommes de terre. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nayouma (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est fortement sollicitée dans le marché de Kanadjiguila pour sa vente des fruits de qualité. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs d’ananas,  en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et à une clientèle mixtes. Madame Nayouma compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité afin d’augmenter son volume.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in polygamous families, the five members of the Seyereye group are on average 40 years old with five children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the Mande district, part of the Kati circle, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in fruit (bananas), cosmetics, onions and potatoes. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Nayouma (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) is very much sought after in the Kanadjiguila market for selling quality fruit. She intends to use her loan to buy wholesale ten bags of bananas in Medina. Retail sales are conducted in Kanadjiguila to a mixed clientele.

With this loan Mrs. Nayouma hopes to attain average monthly profits of 90,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: buy fruit (bananas)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe Siguidia sont mariés majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, poulets et du sucre. Dans le dessein d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nakan (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une vendeuse de poulets. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 500 poulets en gros dans les villages environnant  de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et  à une clientèle mixte. Madame Nakan compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Siguidia group are mostly married in monogamous households. They are on average 41 years old with four children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the Mande district, part of the Kati circle, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in chickens and sugar. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Nakan (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) sells chickens. She intends to use her loan to buy five hundred chickens wholesale from villages surrounding Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Kanadjiguila to a mixed clientele.

With this loan Mrs. Nakan hopes to attain average monthly profits of 120,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Bimala is the leader of a group who lives in BBC Pada of Bhawanipatna in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman who is 50 years old. She has a small family comprised of four members: her husband and two sons. The member standing second from left with her hand raised in the front line is Bimala. 

She has an electrical shop where her sons repair electrical equipment like coolers, refrigerators, and fans as well as motor binding of water pumps. They also sell small gas stoves. The shop was originally started by Bimala’s husband in 1995 and now her sons are running it successfully.
 
The family income is about Rs 9,700 per month but it is not at all sufficient to meet even the necessary expenses. So she formed a group of 10 members in her locality and applied for a loan from Mahashakti. It is their first cycle loan. Bimala will purchase solar lights, electrical fans, iron, bulbs and other electrical materials as well as small gas stoves for the growth of her business. She has a cherished dream of being a wholesaler of electrical equipment in her locality.

The other nine members are doing vegetable vending, running a hotel, tailoring, running a fancy shop, mobile repairing, a Tiffin stall, a Tea stall, and a grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase solar lights, electrical fans, iron, bulbs and other electrical materials as well as small gas stoves

loans.name: Jose Sebastian

texts.es:
Un constante rítmico ruido de  máquina de coser sale a diario de la casa de José Sebástian, un señor humilde y trabajador que confecciona ropa. Tiene 50 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres hijos todos mayores e independientes. Hace 14 años aprendió el arte de la costura, por lo que decidió especializarse en ello y así tener una fuente económica estable. En la actualidad son muchos los clientes satisfechos, anhela en ser mejor cada día para lograr brindarle a su esposa un futuro seguro y estable.
José solicita un crédito para incrementar la producción de su trabajo, requiere comprar variedad de telas, hilos, agujas, entre otros; todo esto para la elaboración de prendas de vestir, tanto para mujeres como hombres. Su meta es seguir creciendo, mejorar las condiciones de su hogar para tener un lugar más grande y cómodo para poder brindar una mejor atención.
texts.en:
The constant rhythmic noise of the sewing machine is heard every day from the home of José Sebastian, a humble and hard-working man who earns his living making clothes. He is 50 years old, is married and has three children, who are all grown up and independent. Fourteen years ago he learned the art of sewing, which made him decide to specialise in it and so have a stable source of income. He now has many satisfied customers. He aspires to be better every day, and so give his wife a secure and stable future.

José is seeking a loan in order to increase his production. He needs to buy a variety of fabrics, threads, and other materials. All this is for making items of clothing, for both men and women. His goal is to continue to grow, and to improve the conditions of his home and have a bigger and more comfortable working area in order to offer a better service.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics, threads, and other materials.

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
This is Arline, 31, a resident of Taguig, Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Eduard and together they manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Arline operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy products from wholesalers and sell them per item with a profit. Her products are bags, blankets, clothing and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many products that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Arline dreams of succeeding in her business and in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products like bags and clothing to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Norhaya

texts.en:
Norhaya is a resident of Taguig, Manila, Philippines. She is 44 years old and happily married to Emmahodin, who works as an electrician. They have two children and both of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other work for their family.

Norhaya owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price. Then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to earn a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 15,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Norhaya hopes to increase her profit and dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old and married with two children. 

She is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Judith has been in the pig fattening business for eight years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, nails, foam, etc. for her furniture-making business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from food vending.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, nails, foam, etc. for her business

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Doña Marta gracias a su primer financiamiento logro comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios con los que dio asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de granos básicos (Frijol). Gracias al apoyo financiero brindado por los inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL ella logro obtener una excelente cosecha la cual vendió a muy buen precio en el mercado y con algunos de los intermediarios pudiendo generar los ingresos para pagar su compromiso de pago a tiempo y de esa forma estar más complacida con su trabajo. Nuevamente ella desea ser apoyada por los inversionista en la plataforma KIVA ya que para esta nueva temporada ella quiere cultivar un producto diferente como lo es la papa comprando fertilizantes, abonos y semilla de primera calidad para cultivar de esa forma diversificar los ingresos en su hogar y no depender de la siembra de frijol para poder apoyar a sus hijos en lo necesario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Thanks to her first loan, Marta was able to buy the agricultural supplies necessary to care for and maintain her basic grain (bean) crops.  Thanks to the financial support that she received from KIVA lenders, in alliance with the cooperative COMIXMUL, she was able to generate an excellent harvest that sold for a very good price at the market and to some middlemen.  She was able to make enough profit to make her payments on time and be more satisfied with her work.  

She is asking for the support of KIVA lenders once again because she wants to grow a different crop like potatoes this season.  She needs to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds of the highest quality to plant and therefore diversify the income of her household and stop depending on bean crops to be able to support the needs of her children and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds of the highest quality to grow potatoes

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Lilibeth has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

Lilibeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Renaldo

texts.en: Maison de Restauration has built an admirable long term reputation for quality of services. Renaldo has gained greater insight to the opportunities. This business is the achievement of his longtime dream, a liquid soap business. With the market still new for many, he is making efforts to promote liquid soap production in Haiti.
