Your loan will help him purchase raw materials (chemical products) and equipment (gallons and buckets) to keep the business running efficiently.

loans.use: to  buy chemical products and containers in order to increase liquid soap production in Haiti.

loans.name: Guillaume

texts.en: Water purification has been a tremendous problem in Haiti for years. Consequently, several entrepreneurs have shared a passion to innovate the safe drinking water business sector in Haiti. ACPSF is considered the leading water purification business in the community because of its customer base and its services. Guillaume has thought for a long time on the best way to fight against diseases that are caused by unsafe drinking water in the community of Nazon. After several months of research and planning, he decided to open ACPSF water purification in June 2013. Since then, the business has served everyone in the community. This loan will help buy maintenance tools to better serve its current and future customers.

loans.use: To buy maintenance equipment for their water filtering system

loans.name: Alix

texts.en: ACFU is a shoe making business that came about three years ago when three brothers wanted to launch a shop. Alix, assisted by his two brothers, started giving training to young adults in their area after the earthquake since he did not have enough means to launch a business. Alix’s shop became operational in 2011. The business has made significant progress, but today lacks the investment in equipment needed to thrive. This loan will help with the sewing machines and materials.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines and bulk leathers to make sandals

loans.name: Morisson

texts.en: Due to the warm weather in Haiti, people are always in need for fresh drinking water and beverages. Consequently, Morisson understood the necessity to open the Frigo business to meet this need of the people. He started his business in 2006 by selling gallons of water from his artesian well. He sold more than 600 gallons per day. Today, His customer base and potential demands are remarkably increasing . The business has addressed the needs by increasing its production equipment, and by providing greater product differentiation by selling not only water, but natural juice and other beverages.  Finally, the business has to turn to a loan which will help serve its potential customers at the lowest price, highest quality, and fastest service.

loans.use: To buy water tanks and maintenance tools

loans.name: Societe Cooperative Pour Le Changement (So-Coo-C)

texts.en: Societe Cooperative pour le Changement (SO-COO-C)  is a Cooperation of farmers, founded in January 1992, located in Maniche. Being farmers in the majority, they understand the importance of soil, which is why they got involved with its conservation and reforestation in the community. Agriculture and Education are priorities of SO-COO-C. Nerjuste, leader of SO-COO-C entertained the idea to build a primary school in the community and accomplished this goal in their first year. He knows that education and food are basic needs of the people and he decided to start with a food provision store in 1997 from member’s contributions. In 2009, Nerjuste took the initiative to add grain and bean storage activity to meet farmer's demand in the community. SO-COO-C's leader is engaged in the social and economic sector of the Laplace community. This is why he is seeking a loan to increase the agricultural input supply of the cooperative.Pictured is Nerjuste and the committee that represents the cooperative.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Association Des Paysans Dévoués Pour Le Développem

texts.en: "Association des Paysans Dévoués pour le Développement de Montagne Terrible" or "APDDMT" launched July 5, 2005 under the manifestation of several farmers from Montagne Terrible. Kesnel, one of the farmers pictured with the other members of the association's comittee, was the inspired leader in the community. He has experience in the agricultural sector, and started structuring the organization by implementing a committee of which he then became the coordinator. With 9 years of experience, they carried out some activities in the community in order to keep the community alive. The first one was the rehabilitation and water extraction of the source of Pal in Carrel Grand Saut, which popularized the organization in Montagne Terrible. This loan will allow the organization to purchase a large quantity of bean seeds to store during harvesting season. Farmers will be able to cheaply buy seeds during planting season, when usually the prices tend to double. This will enable the organization to generate more revenue while developing the community of Montagne Terrible.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of bean seeds to store during harvesting season

borrowers.first_name: Association Des Paysans Dévoués Pour Le Développem

loans.name: Gwoup Fanm  Franchiz  (Gff)

texts.en:
Gwoup Fanm Franchiz(GFF) is a model corporation which proves that women have an important role in the economy of Haiti. This corporation has been working for the social and economic development of the Beraud/Torbeck region since 1993. Regarding local production of this community, Marie Minetha, leader of GFF, has started a local products processing unit inside the association to create jobs. To increase the value of local production, Minetha, pictured with the group's committee, has invested her money, time, and knowledge to make of GFF a progressive team. Her dynamism allowed the association to start with a storage activity in 2009 and to add a grains grinding service a year later. Thanks to Minetha's determination,GFF has been offering peanuts,cocoa, and vegetable grinding services to the community since 2013.
GFF’s leaders keep on working for the good will of the association and strongly want to create more employment for women and increase the means of the association through a loan.

loans.use: To offer a new service and reduce the cost of production to increase profit by at least 20% .

loans.name: Fritzner

texts.en: Fritzner is a Haitian entrepreneur who is dedicated to bringing support to the Haitian education system. As a result, he created a business called IZOFI Haiti in order to provide affordable school supplies such as books, notebooks, calendars, etc.to students and schools. The business has provided private training on entrepreneurship, leadership, marketing, and accounting to every college student living within the community. Because of lack of funds, the business is still not able to meet the high demand for school supplies. Izofi needs to increase its production.  Consequently, the business has turned to a loan which will help expand its production, and to serve its current and future customers.

loans.use: To buy paper and computer and industrial size printer ink

loans.name: Astrude

texts.en: Astrude's restaurant, Amical Bar Resto, is one of the oldest restaurants in the heart of Port-au-Prince. Under the leadership of Astrude, the business has financially supported its employees despite the rough period after the earthquake. A major part of the restaurant building collapsed during the earthquake of January 2010. As a trained cook, Astrude took the initiative to reopen the only restaurant in the community providing her own talent in the kitchen. However, the lack of equipment prevents the business from satisfying higher demand. A loan from Zafen will help Astrude to buy the equipment needed (Freezer, Oven, Generator, Chairs, Water Cooler and Fans) to attract and serve more customers.

loans.use: To buy a freezer, an oven, a generator and other equipment for the restaurant.

loans.name: Ketly

texts.en: Ketly has been doing herbal hair oil for ten years. Hair treatment is what she likes doing best. Ketly wants to raise her production by procuring raw materials (oils and jars). The development of this activity will encourage at least one young adult to get training in manufacturing homemade hair treatment products. After having seen how this activity has improved her life conditions, Ketly turns to making it possible with a loan!

loans.use: To buy oil, jars, and other ingredients for hair creams

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bales of clothes and dozens of slippers to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Faafuata

texts.en: Faafuata is a 37-year-old unwed woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Faafuata has applied for a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, a spade, a wheelbarrow, gloves and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. With her profits, Faafuata hopes to cover her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, a spade, a wheelbarrow, gloves and crops.

loans.name: Malopule

texts.en: Malopule is a 59-year-old single woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Malopule has applied for a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, gloves, a spade and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. With her profits, Malopule hopes to cover her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, gloves, a spade and new overalls.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is married and has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Lourdes applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. Lourdes has been in this business for 25 years, and she also earns additional income from selling bananas. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Comite Des Jeunes Progressistes Pour L’Avancement

texts.en: COJEPAB is a group of young and notable men from different localities in the community of Boucan Carre who joined together on March 5, 2005. The purpose of the request is to facilitate farmers in the community of Pajes to get access to seeds and products in the planting season. Michelet, the coordinator pictured with the other members, noted many problems in different sectors such as agriculture, health, and education. Then, with a group of farmers, he started working to find a solution for these issues. Together they executed some projects to each member's satisfaction and they built a community school, an agricultural input store, fixed a road, and an irrigation system. The loan from Zafen will enable the organization to purchase a large quantity of seeds to be sold to peasants in the community. This will allow farmers to acquire seeds at an affordable price when prices have a tendency to double during the planting season.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of seeds to be sold to peasants

borrowers.first_name: Comite Des Jeunes Progressistes Pour L’Avancement

loans.name: Solidarite Jeunesse Des Bayes (Sojeb) Group

texts.en: In 1994, some people from Bayes were concerned about community issues.  Among them there was a young woman, Ms. Mona, a fervent leader pictured with the committee, who decided to formalize the ideas of the group. After many meetings, she found it necessary to launch an organization in the community of Bayes to resolve some problems that people confronted. She launched the organization and called it “Solidarite Jeunesse des Bayes," or "SOJEB." SOJEB became the first organization in Des Bayes and Ms. Mona eventually became the first coordinator; she managed the organization for seven (7) years. In 2001, she had to leave Haiti for the USA; she organized an election to elect a new committee, then Dieuvais became the coordinator. They accomplished a lot of activities such as setting up a grinder machine, training in the agricultural sector, etc. The loan from Zafen will enable the organization to diversify their economic activity and generate more income. This will contribute in developing other programs in the agricultural sector for a better community of Bayes.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, millet and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the businesses purchasing power

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en: Gregory, as an entrepreneur, has always shared his interest to launch a business in Haiti. On June 2009, he borrowed money from friends and family to start a broiler chicken farm. After five years of operation, Gregory has dealt with many challenges due to the high demands from his customers and the lack of resources.  Willing to expand production by 25% while creating new job opportunities, Gregory applied for a loan. This will help feed more chicks during the 45 days for consumption with quality vet care. Your loan is desired to make Gregory’s business grow!

loans.use: to buy chicken feed, feeders and cage wires

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Haitian artisans show deep creativity and ingenuity in making furniture. Paul is one of them. He opened a workshop in the year 2000 with a partner. Ten years later, Paul’s hopes were dashed away in the earthquake. With courage and counsel from family and friends, he re-launched his business in 2011. Today, he needs to maintain its financial stability and offer quality home décor to the market. Therefore, your loan will help him buy tools and quality raw materials to serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy tools and quality raw materials

loans.name: Rony

texts.en: In 1994, Rony started breeding bees, which increased his management experience. The first project had five bee colonies, which helped him to generate a significant amount of income. Rony is now known in Hinche for selling honey, Cremas, and peanut butter to local markets. He currently has around 100 bee colonies throughout Hinche and Cerca-Carvajal. This was a big step in developing other products such as peanut butter, cremas, and wine. However, he has found it difficult to gain access to capital to reinforce its operation. The purpose of the loan request is to enable the business to increase its production capacity.

loans.use: To increase honey production capacity

loans.name: Mouvement Des Femmes En Action Pour Le Developpeme

texts.en: In March 1995, 10 women met to discuss their community issues. They then launched an association that they called “Mouvement des Femmes en Action pour le Développement du Grand Boucan," or "MOFADEG” in order to solve their problems. Marie, pictured with the 4 other committee leaders, an experienced woman of organization, became the coordinator. She helps MOFADEG participate in several projects in Mirebalais which allows the organization to reinforce its visibility and credibility in the community. At the beginning, they realized a lot of activities such as training for members, an agricultural savings program, and a literacy program. In 2007, they started doing economic activities which allowed them to install a grinder machine in the community of Grand Boucan. They then invested their profits into storing crops, which increased the economic activity of the organization and supported the women and their families. The loan is to allow the organization to purchase crops such as millet and corn to store during harvesting season. This will enable the organization to earn money and become more sustainable for a better community.

loans.use: to purchase crops such as millet and corn to store during harvesting season

borrowers.first_name: Mouvement Des Femmes En Action Pour Le Developpeme

loans.name: Asosyasyon Pou Devlopman Mibalè (Asodem) Group

texts.en: In 2008, Jean Claudion left Port-au-Prince to return to his hometown Mirebalais. He had some experiences in social work. Heading to Mirebalais, he wanted to support families in its neighborhoods. He gathered a few locals in the community of Denigon and discussed the problems that they had been coping with. They became conscious about the needs of community. After many meetings and discussions, in October 2009 they launched ASODEM which in Creole stands for “Asosyasyon pou Devlopman Mibalè”, pictured is the committee with Jean Claudion. The first activity was to allow 50 members of the organization to receive training in gardening. Since then, they've continued working to change the lives of people in Denigon. The goal of ASODEM is to reinforce the national production by implementing different projects in the agricultural sector such as production of corn, millet, vegetables, and livestock. A loan will allow the organization to increase their chicken production. This will contribute to food security and sustain jobs already created in rural Mirebalais.

loans.use: To increase the production by buying more chicks and food to feed them.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Cassava was one of the best-selling products in the community. However, it was very challenging for cassava vendors to go to a different location in order to buy mamba (peanut butter) which is a complement to cassava. Bernadette quickly discovered the importance of peanut butter for these vendors' businesses and decided to start making and selling peanut butter locally. Bernadette passion is to better its customers’ lives by providing the highest quality of products at the lowest prices. Because of a previous loan from Zafen, the business has bought a peanut grinding machine to increase its production. As production increased, the demand for goods and services increased. Which explains its need to increase production and create more jobs. A loan will help the business better satisfy its clientele.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, peanuts and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Silvia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Silvia actualmente se dedica a la preparación y venta de jugos de fruta en una chaza ubicada al frente de su casa en el municipio de El Bagre, Córdoba, tiene un nivel de ventas medio pero agradece mucho la ayuda de Interactuar al ayudarle a fortalecer su negocio. Pero todo no ha sencillo para esta guerreara mujer, en un principio trabajaba en una mina realizando pesados trabajos de excavación y al no tener estudios básicos no encontraba más alternativa que trabajar duramente.
Hoy en día es una microempresaria en proceso de crecimiento, y tiene unas expectativas muy grandes en cuanto a su negocio.
Ella desea un préstamo para comprar un congelador que le permita tener sus frutas en perfectas condiciones para la hora de realizar los jugos, adicional a esto desea comprar más variedad de fruta para vender y atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia works making and selling fruit juice. She has a stall on her front porch, in the municipality of El Bagre, Córdoba department. She does not sell a lot, but she appreciates the help that Interactuar has given her to strengthen her business. However, not everything has been easy for this hardworking woman. She used to work in a mine, performing tough drilling activities. Since she does not have a degree, she did not have another option.

Silvia is today a micro entrepreneur in the making and has high expectations regarding her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a freezer to keep the fruits in perfect conditions to make juice. She also wants to buy different fruits in order to attract more customers and sell more.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and different types of fruits.

loans.name: Norma Patricia

texts.es:
Norma tiene 30 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de los cuales solo dos de ellos estudian en la escuela y son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Norma se dedica al trabajo doméstico, trabaja cuidando unos niños en una casa, consiguió este trabajo ya que una amiga suya la recomendó pues una familia necesitaba a alguien que le cuidara los niños, ya tiene un año ejerciendo este trabajo por la necesidad ya que su pareja la abandonó con 4 hijos pero eso no la detiene para seguir luchando y sacarlos adelante, trabaja a una distancia de 30 minutos, viaja en bus y lo realiza de 6:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para pagar una pequeña deuda que el esposo dejó en una institución financiera y a ella le toca cubrir esa deuda, con el dinero que le sobre comprará una ternera para que su mamá se la cuide mientras ella trabaja con el objetivo de tener una fuente de ingreso extra.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante trabajando para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y si es posible brindarles la oportunidad de que saquen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Norma is 30 years old. She could not study and is now a single mother of four children. Two of them are in school age and are the only ones under her care. Norma works as a housekeeper and babysitter. She got this job thanks to a friend who recommended her to a family that needed someone to take care of their children. She has been doing this for a year. She had to find a job when her partner abandoned her and her four children. However, this is not an obstacle for her to continue fighting to raise them. It takes her 30 minutes by bus to go to work. She works from 06:00 am until 04:00 pm.

She is requesting a loan to pay off a debt her husband had with a financial institution. She is now responsible for paying it back. With the rest of the money she will buy a calf. Her mother will take care of it while she works. This will represent an additional source of income for her.

Her dream is to continue working hard so that her children can have everything they need and pay for their university studies, if possible.

loans.use: to pay off a debt her husband left her and buy a calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical appliances (a TV).

Milton trabaja de molinero y también en la agricultura, desde muy pequeño se dedicó a trabajar en compañía de su padre y hoy en día cultiva mas de una hectárea de maíz.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para comprar fertilizantes (abonos), lo cual necesita el crédito para poder darle la nutrición necesaria al maíz, ademas espera tener una mejor cosecha para mejorar sus ingresos .   

Su sueño a futuro es poder cultivar las 2 hectáreas de maíz  para poder tener una fuente de ingresos mayor y poder ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien.
texts.en:
Milton is 36 years old.  He is married and has two sons who are students.

Milton works as a miller and in agriculture.  Since he was small he's been dedicated to working with his father and today he cultivates more than 1 hectare of corn.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer which he needs to be able to give the corn the nutrition it needs and in addition he hopes to have a better harvest and improve his income. 

His dream for the future is to be able to cultivate 2 hectares of corn in order to have a better source of income and be able to help his sons who study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

Pastora is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Pastora is 55 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Pastora has a general store business in the Philippines. Pastora requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Pastora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Pastora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia works hard to support her family. Claudia is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Claudia requested a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Claudia has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Claudia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cutter and a sander.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing materials.  Alma is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish-vending business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, tomatoes, onions, fish, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy biscuits, sweets, books, pens, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy biscuits, milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, cheese, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jewelries, cosmetics, etc., wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy toothpastes, biscuits, cigarettes, soft drinks, provisions, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baskets full of dried fish to add to her current stock of fish for sale

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva is 50 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Nieva runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like coffee, snack foods, juice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Nieva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like coffee, snack foods, juice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 41 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are in school.

Teodora is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming corn for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending and a general store. Rosita is borrowing 7000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, rice, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, rice, fish, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 38 years old and has 10 children. Milagros is married and has seven children who are currently in school.

Milagros is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Milagros requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Milagros has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Marlina is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marlina has been in pig fattening for 18 years and also earns additional income from farming rice and food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Astul

texts.es:
Astul tiene 47 años de edad, no pudo estudiar pues en aquel entonces sus padres no le daban importancia al estudio ya que para ellos era mas importante la agricultura, vive con su madre y solamente ella depende de él.  

Astul trabaja desde muy pequeño en la agricultura, tiene mucha experiencia en los cultivos de granos básicos como lo es maíz, frijol y sorgo, esta es la actividad que él realiza a diario.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar los fertilizantes para el maíz ya que ha sembrado y necesita darle mantenimiento a las plantas de cultivo. 

Sus planes son sembrar tres hectáreas mas de maíz para su consumo, ademas vender para cubrir los gastos, y también le gustaría sembrar ajonjolí pues considera que es bastante rentable.
texts.en:
Astul is 47 years old. He could not study because back then, his parents did not think it was something important; agriculture was more important for them. He lives with his mother. No one else depends on him.

Astul has been working in agriculture since he was a little boy. He has great experience growing crops such as corn, bean and sorghum. This is his daily activity.

Astul is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for the corn he sowed. He needs to take good care of his plantation. He plans to plant three hectares more with corn for his own use. He will sell the rest to cover his expenses. He would also like to grow sesame because he believes it is a profitable choice.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his corn plantations.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a repeat customer applying for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings to pay tuition for her two children in high school.

Her major challenge is limited funds for supporting her family, especially school fees, which sometimes affects her business growth.

Agnes’ dream is to see all her children graduate from universities. She is a hardworking, generous and social woman. She appreciates the efforts of the Kiva lenders in trying to see the rural poor move out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her two children in high school

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Osama's Group $3,000 loan is to purchase an air-conditioner and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and clean cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more security cameras.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el Distrito de Guadalupe junto a su familia.
Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la Agricultura alquilando un terreno cerca a su casa. Todo loq ue sabe es gracias a su padre quien transmitió todos sus conocimientos a Fredy y ahora él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y arroz, ofreciendo al mercado productos de excelente calidad.
Fredy está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos para hacer el mantenimiento a los cultivos, comprará pesticidas y fertilizantes para que pueda obtener una buena cosecha y pueda venderlo a un buen precio
texts.en: Fredy is a 23 year old man with a lot of desire to get ahead. He is single and lives with his family in the district of Guadalupe. For 8 years he has been working in agriculture, renting land near his house. Everything he knows is from his father who passed on all his knowledge to Fredy who now grows corn and rice, offering an excellent product to the market. Fredy is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support he can buy inputs for the maintenance of his crops. He will buy pesticide and fertilizer so that he can obtain a good harvest and sell it at a good price.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is a 34-year-old married female who lives in Masindi. She is charged with a responsibility of taking care of five children who all attend school. 

She does cattle fattening at Masindi port. She started the business to cater to the family's needs. Jovia hopes to educate her children. However she faces a challenge of inadequate capital based on the fact that her business needs a lot of input in terms of feed and labor.
 
Jovia will use the loan to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Bonifacia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from Nipa roof making. Bonifacia is borrowing 4,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing  business.

Bonifacia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Zenaida is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 32 years old, married, and has two children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Melinda requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like detergent soap, cooking oil, shampoo, bath soap, fabric conditioner, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Melinda has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan.

Melinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like detergent soap, cooking oil, shampoo, bath soap, fabric conditioner, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Samwiri

texts.en:
Samwiri is a 43-year-old male. He practices farming and grows maize and beans in Masindi, Uganda. Samwiri sells charcoal as an additional income source. He started the businesses so as to improve his standard of living. 

Samwiri hopes to expand his business into new markets. However, he faces a challenge of weather changes. Samwiri is a hardworking man who needs a loan to pay workers for weeding his farm.

loans.use: to pay workers for weeding his farm.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 30-year-old man who has got the responsibility of taking care of three children. 

He practices farming and grows maize and beans in Masindi, Uganda. Khalid has a motorcycle transport business as a source of additional income. He started the businesses so as to get profits and support his family. 

Khalid dreams of educating his children. However he faces a challenge of unpredictable weather changes.

Khalid intends to use the loan to weed his maize field.

loans.use: to weed his maize field.

loans.name: Fredys

texts.es:
Fredys tiene 50 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado en la escuela, está acompañado y tienen 6 hijos, y solo 5 dependen de él.

Fredys tiene un negocio de elaboración de hoyas de cazolejas de aluminio en el mercado del pueblo en el cual le apoya su pareja y sus hijos en sus tiempos libres,  este trabajo lo aprendió en unas capacitaciones que dieron de parte de una ONG, él se levanta desde muy temprano para comenzar a trabajar y termina cuando comienza a anochecer. 

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar 12 láminas para reparar el techo de su vivienda, debido a que por el momento está en muy malas condiciones.

Sus sueños son darles a sus hijos vivienda, alimentación, educación y enseñarles a que sea personas trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Fredys is 50 years old and has a ninth-grade education. He is in a relationship and has six children; five of them depend on him.

Fredys makes pots out of metal sheets and sells them at the local marketplace. His partner and children help him when they are free. He learned this activity thanks to an NGO that offered him training. He wakes up very early and starts working. It is almost dark when he finishes.

He is requesting a loan to buy twelve metal sheets to repair the roof of his house, which is in bad conditions.

His dream is to be able to give his children shelter, food, education and teach them to work hard.

loans.use: to buy twelve metal sheets to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Jose Nahun

texts.es:
José tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltero y no tiene hijos, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, es tan emprendedor que también posee una tienda, José es una persona que se preocupa por el desarrollo de su comunidad por lo que siempre participa en comités. 

Ya tiene 3 años de poseer la tienda, y decidió ponerla debido a que no había otra cerca y los residentes del hogar tenían que ir muy lejos para comprar productos básicos.

El crédito lo necesita para invertir en la compra de productos para surtir más la tienda, como aceite, jabón, pan, azúcar entre otros. 

Sus planes a futuro son que de las ganancias de la tienda y del cultivo de maíz y frijol, cultivar un terreno de café, pues no quiere que falte nada para el hogar.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old, single and has no children. He finished high school and works growing corn and beans. José has an entrepreneurial spirit, so he also has a grocery store. He is a person who cares about the development of his community, which is why he is a member of different committees.

He has had the store for three years and decided to open it when he saw that locals had to travel long distances to buy the supplies they needed.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his store, such as vegetable oil, soap, bread and sugar. His plans for the future are to use the profits from the corn and beans plantations and from the store to grow coffee. This way, he will not lack anything at home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a la situación económica de su familia y también porque sus padres le decían que de nada servía estudiar, que solo había que trabajar para comer, pero ella sabe firmar y contar muy bien. 

Ella solo se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar,  de sus 3 hijos solo uno está estudiando, también vive un sobrino con ella a quien crio desde pequeño. 

El crédito lo necesita para prestárselo a una vecina suya, pues ella considera que lo necesita y tiene el deseo de ayudarla y no puede, pero con el crédito podrá hacerlo, pues ella es alguien que cree mucho en Dios y le gusta ayudar al prójimo cuando está a su alcance.

María sueña con que sus hijos sean personas de bien, confía en que les dará el estudio y la educación adecuada, y que les dejara un lugar donde puedan vivir con sus familias.
texts.en:
María is a 43 year old widow who has 3 children. She did not have the opportunity to study due to the economic situation of her family. Also her parents said that there was no use in study, one had to work to eat, She knows how to sign her name and can count well.

She takes care of the housework by herself and only one of her three children study. A nephew also lives with them who she has raised since he was young. She needs the loan to lend to a neighbor as she considers her in need and she wants to help her but can't. But with a loan she could help her. She is someone who believes a lot in God and wants to help her fellow human beings when possible. María dreams that her children become good people. She trusts that she can give them their studies and a good education and that she can leave them a place to live with their families.

loans.use: to lend it to a neighbor who she considers in need and she wants to help her.

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.en:
“I am a student at the Methodist University College, Accra, Ghana reading Business Administration, with an accounting option. The loan is to help pay for my fees and help me go higher on the educational ladder. This facility would help me actualize my dreams and help my community to develop. A friend of mine inspires me to work harder towards my goals through his ideas and maturity in the way he does things. 

My dream is to operate a microfinance company in a few years to come since I have some basic techniques in microfinance and my chosen course would give me the needed skills in that regard.

Without the support of Kiva, I would have deferred my course or sought help elsewhere.

We are hospitable and have so many places of interest. I want investors to keep doing the good job of helping needy students reach their goals”.

loans.use: to pay school fees and rent

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock of fish for sale

loans.name: Hugo Moises

texts.es: Hugo tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de tres años de edad. Hugo trabaja como ayudante de albañil desde hace mucho tiempo en su comunidad. Él es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia quien con mucho esfuerzo va sacando adelante a su familia. Hogo desea terminar de construir un cuarto dormitorio y también ha tomado la decisión de construir un pozo para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, etc. Espera poder contar con el financiamiento y así poder comenzar la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Hugo is 32 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his life partner and three-year-old daughter. Hugo has been working as a building labourer in his community for a long time. He is very hard-working. Dedicated to his family, with a lot of effort Hugo is helping his family to prosper. Hugo wants to finish building a bedroom and has also decided to build a well. To do this he needs materials such as cement, sand, bricks, iron bars and more. Hugo hopes to count on this loan and to start building work as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and more in order to build a well and finish building a bedroom.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 37 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Rosanna has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rosanna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Daisylen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Daisylen works hard to support her family.

Daisylen has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from food vending. Daisylen is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle used for her transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested additional loan to further build her business.

Daisylen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a buy-and sell-vegetables business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy vegetables to sell through her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell through her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a variety of items for making clothing including lace, buttons, pearls, zippers, artificial flowers and other accessories.

loans.name: Jose De La Paz

texts.es:
José, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, tales como maíz, frijol y maicillo, con los que asegura una alimentación adecuada para su familia y obtiene ingresos con los que cubre los gastos de su hogar, el oficio lo aprendió de su papá, con el tiempo ha incluido la crianza de aves de corral esta actividad le genera ingresos extras. José es casado, vive con su esposa y ambos disfrutan de la compañía de su pequeña hija de un año.
Como ya se acerca la época indicada para sembrar necesita tener insumos agrícolas a su disposición para preparar el terreno, proteger el cultivo de plagas y mejorar la productividad, se comprara abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla, fertilizantes y herbicidas.
Su visión es ir poco a poco diversificar sus cultivos para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
José works growing basic staple crops, such as beans and various types of corn. With this, he ensures adequate nutrition for his family and also obtains income which he uses to cover his household expenses. He learned this profession from his father, and over time he also started raising poultry, which generates extra income for him. José is married and lives with his wife, and they both enjoy the company of their little one-year-old daughter. 

Since the planting season is approaching, he needs to have agricultural supplies ready in order to prepare the land, protect his crops from pests and improve productivity. He will buy compost, insecticides, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. 

His vision for the future is to gradually diversify his crops in order to have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Javier Adonais

texts.es:
Javier de 28 años de edad, es una persona que depende de una familia trabajadora, humilde y muy responsable, estudió bachillerato, está casado y por el momento no tiene hijos pero su esposa está embarazada y con ellos también vive la abuela de Javier. 

Él presta sus servicios desde hace 2 años en la Policía Nacional Civil y anteriormente trabajó con una ONG, desempeñando el cargo de promotor comunitario. 

El crédito lo necesita para terminar de construir su casa, pues solo ha hecho la paredes, le puso el techo pero le faltaron las puertas, el piso y para hacer el baño.

Sus sueños a futuro son que su familia este en buenas condiciones en cuanto al hogar, piensa que cuando tenga sus hijos los educará, los pondrá a la escuela para que sean profesionales de provecho para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Javier, 28 years old,  is someone who relies on a hard-working family.  He is a modest and responsible man, who has completed a high school degree. Javier is married and right now doesn't have children, but his wife is pregnant.  Javier's grandmother also lives with them.
 
For two years, Javier has been serving in the National Civil Police, and before that worked with an NGO as a community developer.

He needs the loan to finish building his house, since he has only put up the walls and built the roof.  The house lacks doors, a floor, and a bathroom.

His dreams for the future are that his family will live in a comfortable home.  He thinks that when he has children he will educate them, sending them to school so they can be professionals and useful members of society.

loans.use: to finish building his house by adding doors, the floor, and a bathroom

loans.name: Marlyn Oneida

texts.es: Marlyn, tiene 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 5 hijos, y reside en Roatán, Islas de la Bahía. Ella se dedicaba a vender ropa de segunda mano por varios años y hace un año y medio que decidió poner la venta de frutas y verduras como ser tomates, chiles, repollo, cebolla, bananos, melón, vende maíz, frijoles y carnes también, y otras frutas de temporada. Este negocio lo tiene en un puesto del mercado local. ha obtenido cuatro ciclos de préstamo anteriores para mantener sus actividades de negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 25,000 lempiras para surtir el negocio con productos como carnes, granos básicos, frutas y verduras frescas para vender. Tiene planes de seguir creciendo día a día para obtener mejores ingresos y ayudar a que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en: Marlyn is 41 years old and is in a common law marriage.  She has five children and lives in Roatan; islands in the bay.  She sells second hand clothing and has been doing so for several years.  She decided to begin selling fruits and vegetables a year and a half ago.  She sells things like tomatoes, peppers, cabbage, onions, bananas, melons, corn, beans, and also meats and seasonal fruits.  She has this business in a local market stall.  She has had loans on four previous cycles to keep up her business.  She is asking for another 25,000 Lempiras to stock her business with products such as meats, basic grains, and fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.  She plans to continue growing daily to obtain better income so that her children can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, meats, and grains.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es estilista y la respaldan 10 años de experiencia en el tema. Trabaja en un salón de belleza de manera independiente realizando trabajos de corte, cepillado, manicura, pedicura y tintes. Es una mujer sensible y con gran sentido del humor, cualidades que hacen de su trabajo algo entretenido y ameno para sus clientes.
Ella desea ofrecer un mejor servicio, de mejor calidad y más eficiente, por eso solicita un préstamo para comprar algunas herramientas para trabajar tales como una máquina de motilar, un secador, esmaltes, tintes, entre otros.
El crédito le dará un impulso bastante grande en su trabajo ya que con este podrá mejorar su prestación de servicio y podrá seguir embelleciendo a las mujeres y hombres de la región.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a stylist with ten years experience. She works independently in a beauty salon, where she offers haircuts, hair dyes, manicure, pedicures and more. Beatriz is a sensitive woman with a great sense of humour. These characteristics make her work more entertaining and pleasant for her customers.

Beatriz wants to offer the best service - of highest quality and very efficient - and, as a result, is applying for a loan in order to buy tools for her work. She will buy work materials and supplies for carrying out manicures and pedicures.

This loan will give the business a big push as Beatriz will be able to offer better service and continue to make the region's men and women beautiful.

loans.use: to buy work materials and supplies for carrying out manicures and pedicures.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “San Judas Tadeo” está conformado por 08 socios emprendedores y trabajadores. Este es el caso de Domitila de 49 años casada con 01 hijo dependiente. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a la venta de salchipapas. Con dicho negocio a podido brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Así  mismo como actividad secundaria se dedica al alquiler de cuartos. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de pintura, brocha, y limpia vidrio. El deseo de Domitila es de terminar de ambientar su vivienda. El grupo “San Judas Tadeo” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Domitila está ubicada en la parte frontal es la quinta del lado izquierdo y viste chaleco plomo.
texts.en: This is the “San Judas Tadeo” group, which is made up of 8 enterprising and hard-working members. This is true of Domitila, who is 49 years old and married, with one dependent child. For more than 10 years, she has dedicated herself to selling salchipapas [sausages and potatoes]. With this business, she has been able to provide her children with a better quality of life. As a secondary activity, she also rents rooms. She will use the funds from the current loan to buy paint and paintbrushes and for glass cleaning. Domitila's desire is to put the finishing touches on her home. The “San Judas Tadeo” group is grateful to the people who are making this loan possible. Domitila is shown in the front row; she is the fifth from the left wearing a gray sweater.

loans.use: to buy paint and paintbrushes and to clean glass.

loans.name: Teliman Group

texts.fr:
Mariées équitablement dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques, les six (06) membres du groupe Teliman ont en moyenne 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé /cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, légumes (aubergines, tomates et choux), miels, produits cosmétiques et friperies. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise à l’extrême  gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de légumes (aubergines, tomates et choux). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs d’aubergines, 2 corbeilles de tomates et 3 sacs de choux en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The six members of the Teliman group are married women and living in monogamous as well as polygamous households. ON the average, they are 30 years old with four children.  They all live in Kanadjiguila, in the township of Mandé, district of Kati, and know each other as neighbors as well as through their work at the market of  Kanadjiguila. The group members sell vegetables (eggplant/aubergines, tomatoes and cabbage), honey, cosmetic products and used clothing.

With the intention of replenish their stocks for cash, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their  first solidarity cycle. Mrs. Fatoumata (the one seated on the far left in the photo) is a well-known vendor of vegetables eggplant/aubergines, tomatoes and cabbage). She plans to use her loan to buy two bags of eggplant, two baskets of tomatoes and three bags of cabbage in Médine.
She sells retail in Kanadjiguila, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 45,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and cover some minor household needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Agustina

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 48 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de Guadalupe junto a sus padres y su hija.
Desde hace más de 1 año tiene un puesto en el mercado y se dedica principalmente a la venta de frutas y verduras. Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora alegre, amable y porque ofrece facilidades de pago a sus clientes y ellos están muy contentos por ello.
Rosa está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para surtir el negocio y así pueda obtener mayores ganancias que podrá utilizarlo para remodelar su vivienda y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She is 48 years old and lives in the district of Guadalupe with her parents and her daughter.  For more than a year she has had a stall in the market and mainly works at selling fruits and vegetables.  Things are going well for her because she is a hard-working person, cheerful and kind and she offers credit to her customers, which makes them very happy. 

 Rosa is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help she can buy more merchandise to stock her business and thus earn more money  to remodel her home and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fruits and vegetables) for her business

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Riza works hard to support her family.

Riza has a retail charcoal sales business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming and selling flowers. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, so she has requested additional loan to further build her business.

Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford sending her children to college .

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell beauty products. Marilou is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business, like meat, vegetables, and canned goods.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, like meat, vegetables, and canned goods.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 33 years old and married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like soap, coffee, eggs, milk, and spices.

Jennifer has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like soap, coffee, eggs, milk, and spices.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a hardworking married Ugandan man. He used the previous loan to buy some of a local brew to sell. He lives in Kagadi where he deals in alcohol sales as well as farming to earn money to support his family. 

Moses hopes to expand his business to the city and educate his children, despite the difficulty of price fluctuations. Moses is requesting a loan to buy more jerrycans of a local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of a local brew to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 54 years old, married, and has six children.  

Agnes and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Agnes is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Agnes has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Agnes can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Gomora

texts.en:
Gomora works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Gomora will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home, also save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, solicita más capital para invertirlo en la venta de tortillas y la tienda, comprara maíz, leña, bebidas, harina, boquitas, dulces, pan, aceite, frijoles y arroz. Sera de mucha utilidad para seguir prosperando económicamente.
Con el préstamo anterior ha mantenido sus actividades económicas fortalecidas con los insumos necesarios, sus clientes han aumentado, las nuevas ganancias le permiten mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
José is applying for more capital to invest in his business selling tortilla, and his shop. José will buy corn, firewood, drinks, flour, snacks, sweets, bread, oil, beans and rice. This loan will be very helpful to continue prospering financially.

With his previous loan, José's business has strengthened with necessary farming supplies. José also has more customers; his increased profits alow him to improve his family's lifestyle and pay off his debt.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, drinks, flour, snacks, sweets, bread, oil, beans and rice.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalinda, se dedica a la venta de comida, siembra de granos básicos y crianza de ganado, para realizar estas actividades cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y una empleada, sus labores inician a las seis de la mañana y finalizan a las tres de la tarde, ya tiene 23 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio nace por iniciativa propia y poco a poco ha ido evolucionando. Rosalinda es casada, vive con su esposo y una empleada, sus hijos ya son independientes.
Utilizará el capital para comprar verduras, aceite, gas propano, bebidas, sal, azúcar, condimentos, pollo, embutidos, etc.,  para preparar la comida, el resto le invertirá en la compra de abono, herbicida, plaguicidas, insecticidas y semilla. Le permitirá a la Sra.: Rosalinda mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio y cancelar sin problemas su deuda.
Su sueño es mantenerse trabajando para tener ingresos que le aseguren un estilo de vida con mejor alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Rosalinda makes a living selling meals, growing basic grains, and raising cattle. In order to do this work Rosalinda has help from her husband and an employee. Rosalinda starts work at 6am and finishes at 3pm. She has 23 years of experience with this business. Rosalinda started this business with her own initiative and, little by little, it has evolved. Rosalinda is married and lives with her husband and employee; the couple's children are already independent.

Rosalinda will use this loan in order to buy vegetables, oil, propane gas, drinks, salt, sugar, condiments, chicken, cold meats and more, as well as manure, weed-killer, anti-disease treatments, pest control and seeds. These items will allow Rosalinda to improve profitability at her business and to pay off her debt without any problems.

Rosalinda's dream is to continue to work in order to earn the income to be able to eat better and have better health.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, oil, propane gas, drinks, salt, sugar, condiments, chicken, cold meats and more, as well as manure, weed-killer, anti-disease treatments, pest control and seeds.

loans.name: Jorge Alejandro

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven muy juicioso y emprendedor, tiene grandes planes para su vida y su negocio.
El se dedica a la confección de ropa en contrato con terceros, inicio con este negocio hace un tiempo con la ilusión de salir adelante y tener recursos para terminar con sus estudios. Empezó con dos maquinas que compro muy económicas y hasta el día de hoy ha tenido buenos resultados producto de su labor.
El solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento a sus maquinas y comprar algunos insumos como tela e hilos.
El crédito le dará la posibilidad de mejorar su producción y por ende aumentar sus ingresos, con estos es que ayuda económicamente a su abuela a quien manifiesta mucho agradecimiento.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very enterprising and sensible man; he has big plans for his life and business. He sews clothing under contract with third parties.  He started this business a while ago with hopes of getting ahead and having the resources to complete his education.  He started out with two sewing machines he bought at a low price and until now has had good results from his work.  

He is asking for a loan to maintain the sewing machines and buy materials such as fabric and thread.  The loan will allow him to improve his work and thus increase his income.  This is how he provides financial help to his grandmother, to whom he shows much gratitude.

loans.use: to maintain his sewing machines and buy  materials for sewing

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marina, es una jefe de hogar que ha enfrentado la dificultad de ser madre soltera, con sacrificios ha dado a sus hijos lo necesario para subsistir, vive junto a dos de sus hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, también tiene bajo su cuidado a dos nietos. Se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y la crianza de ganado, de esta manera tiene  ingresos que utiliza para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Su ventaja es la zona que le permite desarrollar estas actividades sin problemas.
Invertirá en la compra de insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas, abono, semilla y pago de mano de obra, podrá darle un mejor trato a sus cultivos y lograr mejores cosechas, contara con afrecho suficiente para alimentar su ganado.
Su visión es ir poco a poco aumentando el ganado y diversificando sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marina is a head of family who has found difficulties in being a single mother. With sacrifice she has given her children what they needed to survive. She lives together with two of her children, aged 9 and 11, who both attend school. She also has two grandchildren under her care.

She grows basic grains and raises livestock. In this way she has revenues that she uses to cover the expenses of her family. The area in which she lives allows her the advantage of doing these activities without problem.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, fertilizer, seeds and pay for labor. Then she can give better care to her plants and reap a better harvest. She has enough grain husks to feed her cattle. Her plan is to little by little increase the number of cattle and diversify her crops to obtain better revenues.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, fertilizer, seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her crops and pay for labor.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 32 years old and married with two children.

Catherine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like noodles, soap, and canned goods.

Catherine has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like noodles, soap, and canned goods.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 56 years old and single with four children, one of whom is in school. Genara works very hard to provide for them.

Genara's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Genara has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Genara has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Genara is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Flora's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Flora has restarted her business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Flora has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Flora is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Josephene

texts.en:
Josephene is 27 years old and has two children.  

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Josephene is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Josephene has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover by raising pigs.

With your help, Josephene can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. 

In future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is 48 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Clementina works very hard to provide for them.

Clementina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like noodles, bread, sugar, coffee, canned goods, and soft-drinks to sell.

Clementina has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

Clementina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 41-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Avelina has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Avelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Avelina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is 49 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Bonifacia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Bonifacia has been farming rice for 34 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 54 years old and married with three children. 

Cristina is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cristina has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Daisy has been in this business for 1 year. Daisy earns more income from a general store.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fish vending business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 56 years old, married and the mother of four children. She works in agriculture, raising and fattening pigs in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Anecita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed twenty previous loans from our organization to grow and sustain her business. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alaidia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Alaidia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Alaidia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Alaidia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Edhel Marie

texts.en:
Edhel Marie is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Edhel Marie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, seasonings, and fish for her food production business.

Edhel Marie has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Edhel Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy generator and an air conditioner.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Elena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like slippers, bags, pants, and blouses to sell for her buy and sell dry goods business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net for her fishing business.

Emy has been in this business for 10 years. Emy earns more income from food vending.

Emy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is an enterprising young man who operates a business in the outskirts of Mbarara, an upcoming big town in the western region of Uganda. Peter operates a stationery shop but has always had a passion for computers and enlightening young people. He is overwhelmed by the large numbers of youths that are still computer illiterate and has rented a small room in which he wants to begin computer training. He will use the loan to buy two computers that will help him to kick start his dream business. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy two computers

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Eva is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell for her frozen foods vending business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is 53 years old and married with four children. 

Feliza is in the agricultural business, farming corn and vegetables in the Philippines. Feliza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Feliza has been farming corn and vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Feliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Roselin

texts.en:
Roselin is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Roselin is 30 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Roselin has a buy-and-sell beauty products business in the Philippines. Roselin requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of beauty products to sell to her customers.

Roselin has been in this business for five years. In the future, Roselin would like to save enough money to expand her business.
