loans.use: to purchase more stock of beauty products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell in her fruit stand.

Isidra has been in this business for seven years; she earns more income from raising pigs.

Isidra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, beer, etc. to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, beer, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Juanita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Juanita has been in this business for two years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Annabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a rootcrops and bananas vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and food vending. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase more root vegetables and bananas to sell.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more root vegetables and bananas to sell

loans.name: Lalina

texts.en:
Lalina is 60 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Lalina is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lalina has been in pig fattening for 15 years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly is 44 years old and has eight children. She is married, and has three children who are currently in school.

Gerly is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for a year now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Gerly requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Gerly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 27 years now.

Grace requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luz Myriam

texts.es:
Luz es una madre soltera y hace hasta lo imposible para que su hijo de 4 años tenga las mejores oportunidades de vida y tenga una educación de calidad.
Ella vive en El Carmen De Viboral, desde allí satisface los deseos de sus clientes ofreciéndoles ropa de buena calidad a precios muy bajos.
Ella es dueña de un almacén de ropa y accesorio que atiende todos los días de 10:00 Am hasta las 8:00 Pm, es una mujer dedicada y de grandes esfuerzos.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo abastecer sus exhibidores con ropa nueva y marcas variadas.
Este préstamo le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de ventas y por ente un aumento en sus ingresos.
Mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en: Luz is a single mother and does everything possible so that her four-year-old son can have the best opportunities in life and get a good education. She lives in El Carmen De Viboral where she satisfies her customers' demands with good quality clothing at a very low price. She runs a shop selling clothing and accessories which is open every day from 10 am until 8 pm. She is a dedicated woman who always gives it her all. A loan will help her to buy a wider range of merchandise and stock her shelves with new clothes and a range of brands. This loan will help her to increase her level of sales and so increase her income and improve both her and her son's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a range of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and clean cooking energy using Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Eusébio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane tem 35 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 2 filhos menores de idade não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É agricultor há bastante tempo, explora uma área de 5 hectare. Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume da sua produção adquirindo insumos agrícolas. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku, sendo que os últimos foram aplicados na mesma actividade.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos para revenda. O seu maior desafio é a falta de viatura  para transportar dos seus produtos.
texts.en:
Eusébio was born in Inhambane, is 35 years old, lives with his wife and 2 children (who are minors) and is not responsible for anyone else.

He has been a farmer for quite some time and farms a 5 hectare piece of land. With this loan he plans to increase the volume of his crops by buying raw materials for farming. This is his 3rd loan with Hluvuku and the previous ones were for the same purpose.

In future he plans to finish building his house and start a business rearing chickens for selling on. His biggest challenge is not having a vehicle to transport his produce.

loans.use: buy raw materials for farming

loans.name: Anastancia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Beira Província de Sofala tem 41 anos de idade é casada oficialmente, mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 1 é que frequenta escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus netos que vivem em sua casa.
É polícia a mais de 10 anos e aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com este empréstimo pretende concluir a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como, área e cimento.
Futuramente pretende concluir com o ensino superior e ser uma Empresária. 
O seu maior desafio é criar um projecto no sentido de empregar e ajudar os necessitados.
texts.en:
Anastancia was born in Beira, a province of Sofala and is 41 years old. She's officially married, the mother of 3 children - 1 of whom goes to school - and she is also responsible for her grandchildren who live in her home.

She has been a policewoman for more than 10 years and she spends her salary on household expenses. With this loan she plans to finish the building work on her home by buying construction materials such as sand and cement.

In future she plans to finish her higher education and to become a businesswoman.

Her biggest challenge is to create a project where she can employ and help the needy.

loans.use: construction materials such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical appliances and personal products to improve his sales and to set up a store to enjoy his years without so much physical effort

loans.name: Gloria Yaneth

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer humilde de campo y con gran experiencia en la realización de actividades agropecuarias y manejo de animales.
Hoy en día está dedicada en pleno a la cría y levante de pollos, actividad que le brinda ingresos para sostener a sus tres hijos. Esta actividad la aprendió desde muy pequeña en la finca de sus padres y hoy en día la ejerce con orgullo y satisfacción por todo lo que ha podido lograr hasta ahora.
Ella pide un auxilio para comprar gallinas ponedoras, pollos de engorde y alimento para alimentar a los mismos.
El préstamo le cambiara la percepción del negocio pues de este modo tendrá un poco mas de capital para trabajar y continuar cumpliendo cada una de sus metas.
texts.en:
Gloria is a humble country woman.  She has a lot of experience doing farming work and managing animals.  She now devotes herself completely to raising chickens.  This business activity provides her with income to support her three children.  She learned this business activity on her parents' farm when she was very little.  She now does the work proudly and with satisfaction for everything she has been able to achieve so far.

She is asking for help to buy laying hens, chickens to fatten, and feed for the animals.  The loan will change the perception of the business.  This way she will have a little more capital in order to work and to continue fulfilling each one of her goals.

loans.use: to buy laying hens, chickens to fatten, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 64 years old and married with two children.

Corazon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like seasonings, noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, salt, etc., to sell.

Corazon has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Corazon aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like seasonings, noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Las Semillitas Group

texts.es: Raúl de 51 años de edad es separado con 01  hijo independiente. El grupo “Las Semillitas” está conformada por 06 socios optimistas y dinámicos. Hace más de 20 años que Raúl cuenta  con un taller de mecánica, la cual brinda servicio de reparación de vehículos. Gracias a  lo  que percibe   puede seguir apoyando a su familia. El deseo de Raúl es de seguir creciendo en su negocio. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de martillo, alicate y gata herramienta. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Semillitas” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.  Raúl se encuentra sentado en la parte frontal  es el segundo del lado izquierdo y viste casaca negra con polo blanco.
texts.en:
Raul is 51 years old and is separated, with 1 independent child. The Las Semillitas (Little Seeds) group is made up of 6 optimistic and dynamic members. For more than 20 years Raul has had a mechanic shop which provides vehicle repair services. Thanks to what he earns he is able to continue supporting his family.

Raul's wish is to continue growing at his business. That is why he requested a loan to purchase a hammer, pliers, and a jack. 

The Las Semillitas communal bank thanks the people who made this loan possible.

Raul can be found seated in the front. He is the second from the left and is wearing a black jacket with a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy a hammer, pliers, and a jack.

loans.name: Maks Joel

texts.es:
Maks es un joven emprendedor, tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive en Lurin junto a su familia.
Desde hace casi 2 años trabaja en una Financiera de la zona donde vive como Analista de créditos, le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora, dedicada a su trabajo y muy amable. Su familia es su mayor motivación en la vida, es por ello que día a dí lucha para poder brindarle un futuro mejor.
Maks está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un terreno para que empiece a construir su casa y pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maks, age 21, is an enterprising young man.  He is single, and he lives with his family in Lurin.  He has worked as an analyst for a financial business in his area for almost two years.  It is going very well for him because he is a responsible and hard-working person.  He is dedicated to his work, and he is very friendly.  

His family is his greatest motivation.  That is why he struggles day to day in order to be able to provide them with a better future.

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  With the help they have granted him, he will be able to buy a piece of land in order to start building his house.  He will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to build his house.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José, necesita capital para aumentar los productos que ofrece en la tienda, pues actualmente la demanda de sus clientes ha crecido, lo invertirá en la compra de crema, quesos, cuajada, quesillo, requesón, golosinas, pan, bebidas, granos básicos, etc., seguirá teniendo productos frescos a la venta.
El financiamiento anterior le ha permitido tener su negocio funcionando e incluir la venta de productos lácteos, tener más clientes satisfechos y ofrecer un estilo de vida más confortable a su familia.
texts.en:
José needs capital in order to increase the products he offers in his store. The current demand from his customers has grown, so he will invest in the purchase of cream, cheese, curds, soft cheese, cottage cheese, snack foods, bread, beverages, basic grains, and other items. As a result, he can continue selling fresh products.

His previous loan allowed him to have a functioning business that included the sale of dairy products. He has more satisfied customers and is able to provide a more comfortable lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: to buy cream, cheese, curds, soft cheese, cottage cheese, snack foods, bread, beverages, basic grains, and other products.

loans.name: Rudy Lisandro

texts.es:
Rudy, se siente satisfecho por los beneficios que tiene al hacer uso de los créditos para fortalecer su tienda y por la facilidad de pago que le da la institución le brinda, en está ocasión solicita  un nuevo préstamo para comprar cereales, jugos, sodas, boquitas, dulces, pan, huevos, aceite y granos básicos.
Con el préstamo anterior mejorar el inventario de su negocio, ha cancelado sus deudas, cuenta con nuevos clientes satisfechos y su estilo de vida es mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Rudy is pleased with the profits that he has gotten upon using the loans to strengthen his store.  He is also pleased with the ease of payment that the institution offers him.

This time he is requesting a new loan to buy cereal, juice, soda, snacks, candy, bread, eggs, cooking oil, and basic grains.

With the previous loan he improved the inventory in his business, repaid his debts, has new satisfied customers, and greatly improved his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cereal, juice, soda, snacks, candy, bread, eggs, cooking oil, and basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Amway brand products to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Feliza

texts.es: Carmen es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 2, 7 y 9 años, vive con su madre en una casa por la que pagan arriendo, Carmen se dedica a vender verduras y a esta actividad se dedica 12 años, ella también se dedica a trabajar en la cuadrilla para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de verduras para incrementar su negocio y aspira que mediante su negocio les pueda seguir dando por lo menos lo más necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a single mother with three children (ages 2, 7, and 9). She lives with her mother in a house where they pay rent.

Carmen sells vegetables and has been in this line of work for 12 years. She is also part of a work crew, which allows her to cover her children’s expenses since two of them are studying. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of vegetables so that she can increase her business. Through her business, she aspires to provide her children with at least the most basic needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct-selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of personal collection products to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from fish vending and buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of personal collection products to sell

loans.name: Donozio

texts.en:
Donozio is a married, hard-working Ugandan man, living in Kagadi, where he has been selling produce. He has a retail shop and does farming to generate extra income. He hopes to grow his business, even if poor roads affect his service delivery. 

Donozio intends to use a loan to buy maize, beans, and cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Polycarp

texts.en: Polycarp is a 55-year-old hardworking man living in Kagadi-Uganda. He deals in tea-growing along with market tendering to generate income. He hopes to educate his children to the university level despite the challenge of unreliable rainfall. Polycarp is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labour on his tea plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labour on his tea plantation.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: Karim is a 29-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi-Uganda with two children aged six and two years. He deals in a decoration shop along with farming to generate additional income. He hopes to grow his business despite the difficulty of price fluctuations. Karim intends to use the loan to buy more decorating materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy more decorating materials to sell.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en: Matia is a 44-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi-Uganda with seven children aged between 21 to 6 years. Six of them attend school. He has been operating a retail shop since 1990 together with farming to cater for his family. He hopes to educate his children despite the hardships of price fluctuations of agricultural products. Matia is asking for a loan to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Norma Estela

texts.es:
Norma, es reconocida por ser una persona emprendedora, tiene una familia que está integrada por su esposo y una niña de cuatro años de edad; sus actividades económicas son la venta de aves de corral y productos lácteos, ya cuenta con ocho años de tener dicho negocio, trabaja de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., el oficio se lo enseño se mamá, ya tiene muchos clientes que prefieren sus productos.
Le ayudara a comprar pollos de engorde y concentrado para alimentarlos, con esta compra será fácil surtir la demanda de sus clientes, espera tener una mejor situación económica que le permita cancelar la deuda.
Su sueño es ir fortaleciendo su negocio para seguir apoyando en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Norma is recognized as an entrepreneurial person.  She has a family that is made up of her husband and a four year old child.  Her work involves selling poultry and milk products.  She has eight years of experience in this business and she works from 6am to 5pm.  She learned the business from her mother.  She has many customers who prefer her products.  

The loan will help her to buy chickens and fatten them as well as to buy concentrate for feed.  With these purchases it will be easy to meet the demands of her customers, and she hopes to have a better economic situation that will allow her to cancel her debt.  Her dream is to strengthen her business in order to continue supporting her household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to fatten and concentrate for feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy readers, memory devices, cables, cassettes, controls, consoles, etc.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothes like blouses, t-shirts, kids wear, etc. to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for two years. Letecia earns extra income from a general store and by raising pigs.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothes like blouses, t-shirts, kids-wear, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Melina Jaquelina

texts.es:
Melina, le ha gustado la atención que PADECOMSM le brinda y como desea seguir prosperando se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz, aceite, quesillo, loroco, gas propano, aderezos, bebidas, telas, zippers, botones, encajes, hilos, etc., seguirá trabajando en la venta de pupusas y la sastrería.
El préstamo anterior le ha ayudado mucho para tener su negocio activo y tener ingresos extras con los que cancela sus deudas y optimiza el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Melina has enjoyed the attention that PADECOMSM provides to her and as she wishes to continue prospering, she decided to take out a new loan to purchase corn, oil, quesillo cheese, loroco, propane gas, seasonings, drinks, cloth, zippers, buttons, lace, thread, etc. She will continue working in the sale of pupusas and the tailor shop.

The previous loan has greatly helped her to have her business active and to have an extra income with which she pays her debts and optimizes the style of her family life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, oil, quesillo cheese, loroco, propane gas, seasoning, drinks, cloth, zippers, buttons, lace, thread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries, a generator, a freezer and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Normelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Normelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Normelita has been sustaining her business activities with her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 46 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Lolita has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Lovely is 39 years old and married with eight children. With four children currently in school, Lovely works very hard to provide for them.

Lovely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like sanitary pads, cooking oil, shampoo, snack foods, hair conditioner and other groceries to sell.

Lovely has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as sanitary pads, cooking oil, shampoo, snack foods, hair conditioner and other groceries. 

Lovely would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like sanitary pads, cooking oil, shampoo, snack foods, hair conditioner and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Pasita

texts.en:
Maria Pasita is 62 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Maria Pasita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Pasita has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marivic has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marivic has been in this business for ten years now.

Marivic would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 46 years old and has eleven children. Petronila is married and has six children, who are currently in school.

Petronila is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Petronila has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Petronila has been farming rice for 25 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Petronila would like to save enough money so she that can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Potenciana

texts.en:
Potenciana is 61 years old and married with four children. Potenciana works very hard to provide for them.

Potenciana runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like coffee, chocolate drinks, milk, bread and noodles, etc. to sell.

Potenciana has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, chocolate drinks, milk, bread and noodles, etc. 

Potenciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like coffee, chocolate drinks, milk, bread and noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 27 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rachel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rachel has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Reabesa

texts.en:
Reabesa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Reabesa is 38 years old and has six children who are in school.

Reabesa has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Reabesa has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Reabesa has been in this business for four years. In the future, Reabesa would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is a hard-working entrepreneur, who sells Avon products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy extra stock of Avon products to sell to her customers for her Avon direct-selling business.

Rogelia has been in this business for three years. Rogelia earns extra income from a general store.

Rogelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy extra stock of Avon products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rosario is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosario has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roweliza

texts.en:
Roweliza is 42 years old and married with two children.

Roweliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Roweliza has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF already. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Roweliza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Susan has a general store business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Susan has been in this business for five years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 45 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children, who are currently in school.

Tessie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Tessie has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Tessie has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers in her business of selling bananas.

Antonia has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from pig fattening and farming rice and corn.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chares Mae

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Chares Mae works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo stick business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Chares Mae is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like bamboo for her business.

Chares Mae has been sustaining her business activities with her previous, three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like bamboo for her business.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a 51-year-old honest married lady living in Kagadi-Uganda. She has been operating a bar, a pool table, and farming to earn a living. She hopes for prosperity and good health for her family despite being challenged by the lack of enough capital. Teopista is requesting a loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 41-year-old, single, hard-working woman living in Kagadi-Uganda. She has been operating a boutique, rental houses and farming business to earn a living. She dreams of having a well stocked boutique that can attract more customers and increase on her sales despite the difficulty of competitions and high license fees. 

Margret is asking for a loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a Ugandan married hardworking man living in Kagadi with four children aged between 10 years and 1 year old. He has been selling produce and farming to generate income for the family. He hopes to educate his children and eradicate poverty although he meets a difficulty of price fluctuations. 

Edward is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota, tiene mayor demanda de sus productos de loza, por lo que es necesario tener un inventario bien surtido para continuar trabajando, el capital que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de barro, arcilla, nacazcol, leña, pago de mano de obra y transporte de mercadería.
El crédito anterior le ha servido de respaldo para seguir trabajando, ha logrado aumentar el número de piezas de barro, tiene más clientes, su familia mantiene un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Carlota has a large demand for her pottery products, for which it is necessary to have a well-supplied inventory to continue working. She will invest the capital that she is requesting in the purchase of mud, clay, nacazcol (a black dye), firewood, labor costs, and the transportation of merchandise.

The previous loan has served as backup to continue working. She has been able to increase the number of clay pieces, she has more customers, and her family is maintaining a more dignified lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase of mud, clay, nacazcol (a black dye), firewood, labor costs, and the transportation of merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used furniture to resell.

loans.name: Abudara

texts.en:
Abudara is a married, hard-working man living in Kagadi-Uganda. He has been operating a retail and wholesale shop together with farming to earn income for his family's sustainability. 

His dream is to grow his business despite the challenges of poor roads and price fluctuations. 

Abudara is requesting a loan to buy salt, sugar, sodas and beers to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John es un hombre creativo e inteligente, además de ser muy inquieto también tiene un gran sentido de pertenencia con el planeta y el medio ambiente.
El es artesano por vocación y recoge diferentes materiales reciclables para crear obras de arte que salen de su propia inspiración y creatividad.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar herramientas de corte de llantas ya que este es uno de los principales elementos que utiliza en sus obras.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de soñar con un futuro donde pueda realizar obras a gran escala y que las personas las valoren por su sentido cultural y ambientalista.
texts.en:
John is creative and intelligent. As well as being very active, he feels very close to the planet and to the environment.

John is a craftsman; he collects various recyclable materials in order to create his own art.

John is applying for a loan in order to buy tools for cutting tyres, on of the main items he uses in his work.

This loan will give John the opportunity to dream of a future where he can produce large art projects that will be valued by everybody, through their love for the environment and culture.

loans.use: to buy an industrial saw.

loans.name: Nictor

texts.en:
Nictor is a Ugandan, married, hard-working man aged 27 with one child aged two years old. He lives in Kagadi where he has been dealing in bicycle spare parts to generate income. He hopes to expand his business into new market areas despite poor roads and high transport costs.

Nictor is requesting a loan to buy spare bicycle parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare bicycle parts to sell.

loans.name: Ronald Edgardo

texts.es: Ronal tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa, su hija de 3 años de edad y su hijo de 9 años de edad. Ronal  se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y francés desde hace dos años. Ronal desea mejorar sus condiciones habticionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda y para construir una pared para dividir un cuarto. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, arena, ladrillo, cemento, etc.
texts.en:
Ronal is 32 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife, their 3 year old daughter and their 9 year old son. Ronal has worked selling french bread and sweet bread for the last two years. 

Ronal wishes to improve his living conditions, so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof of his house, and to build a wall to divide a room.  With the amount requested, he will buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, sand, bricks, cement, etc.

loans.use: to buy: galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, sand, bricks, cement, etc.

loans.name: Candelaria De Jesus

texts.es:
Candelaria, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, anteriormente vendía tortillas, por el momento solo posee la tienda, ya que por falta de capital de trabajo no puede mantener las dos actividades funcionando. Candelaria es casada, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo, todos colaboran para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
El financiamiento lo utilizara para surtir la tienda con la mercadería que sus clientes buscan y hacer la apertura nuevamente de la venta de tortillas; comprara maíz, leña, aceite, arroz, frijoles, jugos, boquitas, dulces, pan, bolsas, pastas entre otros productos, espera recuperar sus clientes, tener ingresos extras con los que cancelara las cuotas de su deuda.
Su sueño es aumentar la rentabilidad del negocio para comprar un terreno y construir su casa propia brindando así una vida más confortable a su familia.
texts.en:
Candelaria runs a convenience store. Previously, she sold tortillas. For the moment, she only has the store since, due to a lack of work capital, she cannot keep the two activities going. Candelaria is married. She lives with her husband and a child. They all collaborate to cover home expenses.

She will use the loan to supply the store with the merchandise that her customers look for and to open the tortilla-selling business once again. She will purchase corn, firewood, oil, rice, beans, juices, snacks, sweets, bread, bags, and pastas, among other products. She hopes to recuperate her customers and to have extra income with which she will make the payments of her loan.

Her dream is to increase the profitability of the business to purchase land and construct her own home, thus providing a more comfortable life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, oil, rice, beans, juices, snacks, sweets, bread, bags, and pastas, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an over sewing machine, fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, over sewing machine, table and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for affordable and thermally efficient energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an over sewing machine, fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Na Tau 1 Group

texts.en:
Tien, 52, is team leader of Na Tau 1 group, which has nine Thai women as members. She lives with her husband and four children in an old small Thai traditional house in a remote village far from the center of town. One of her sons and one of her daughters work as officers in commune while her two other children are unemployed. Tien's husband is a teacher in a school in the village and although he has worked at this position for many years, his salary is very low. For that reason, Tien and her husband, despite their age, are working very hard at agriculture, including cultivating rice, planting vegetables and raising pigs, chickens, ducks and buffalo. Tien intends to build a new house for her family and buy some new furniture. To do this, she needs to expand her business. 

According to Tien, this is her first loan from the Anh Chi Em Program, which she decided to join right after hearing about it. She will use the loan to buy piglets and achieve her goals. She also knows that she will receive training and direct support through a home visit of an agriculture worker from Anh Chi Em, so she believes her project will succeed thanks to this help.

Her goal is to significantly increase family's income and provide an abundant life for her children. In the picture, Tien stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fabric and yarn for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He is a father for one son and one daughter. Mohammad has a stall for selling traditional sweets in the city. It is a very good business and the demand is high. He would like to improve his business.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a cart to roam the city and sell his sweets. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to reach more neighbors and sell his sweets to the children.

Mohammad appears in the photo in his stall.

loans.use: to buy a cart to roam the city and sell his sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for the sheep she has.

loans.name: Poderosas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Poderosas está formado por 7 socias quienes viven por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico guarda la historia de la ciudad, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999. Su gente es amble, carismática y de gran corazón, es cordial con quienes los visitan, aun guardan su cultura y tradiciones, su gente es trabajadora como las socias que luchan a diario para mejorar su estabilidad económica y sacar adelante a sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carmen, tiene 26 años de edad, viven en unión libre y ha concebido una hija de un año y seis meses, está muy contenta porque está embarazada de su segundo hijo, su esposo se dedica al comercio ambulante, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña Carmen se dedica a la venta ambulante de carteras y bolsos, en este negocio se encuentra desde hace 2 años y labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de carteras y bolsos para continuar con el negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Poderosas (powerful women) loan group is made up of seven members who live in the city of Cuenca. The city is surrounded by four rivers, its historical center maintains the history of the city and it has been known for its cultural heritage of humanity since December of 1999. The people are friendly and charismatic, with big hearts. They are cordial with those they visit and its culture and traditions are still maintained. The people are hard-working, like the members who fight daily to improve financial stability and to support their families.

One of the members of this group is Carmen, who is 26 years old, lives with her partner and has a daughter who is a year and a half. She is very happy because she is pregnant with her second child. Her husband works as a street vendor, and they rent where they live because they do not have their own house.

Carmen works as a street vendor selling wallets and purses. She has been doing this job for two years and she works every day of the week with an irregular schedule. The money from her loan will be spent on purchasing wallets and purses to continue with the business. Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy wallets and purses.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 51-year-old married woman from Jericho city. She is a mother for three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a worker with a low and unstable income. Three years ago, Najah opened her own business to help her husband with part of the family expenses. She started making pickles and selling them to the local traders.
 
Najah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more vegetables for her pickles business. By taking this loan, Najah will be able to increase her productivity and also her income.
 
Najah appears in the photo while she was working

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her pickles business.

loans.name: Iber

texts.es: El señor Iber es un joven trabajador de estado civil soltero y no tiene hijos,  actualmente solicita el presente crédito para construir su vivienda, y así de esa forma vivir en mejores condiciones; ya que con mucho esfuerzo pudo construir una parte de su casa, pero le falto dinero para poder concluirla, la actividad que desarrolla es el transporte publico interprovincial, los viajes que realiza son de Tarija- Bermejo, Bermejo - Tarija, e indica que este trabajo lo realiza día por medio, actividad que representa hoy su única fuente laboral. Se puede apreciar que el señor es de condición humilde pero muy responsable a la hora de administrar sus bienes, producto de ello son los activos con los que el cliente cuenta.
texts.en:
Iber is a hardworking young man.  He is unmarried and doesn’t have any children.  He is asking for this current loan to build a home, and in this way, to have better living conditions.  With a lot of hard work he managed to build part of his home, but he lacked the money to finish it.

He works in the inter-province public transportation sector.  The routes he covers are from Tarija to Bermejo and from Bermejo to Tarija.  He says that he works on alternate days; it is his only source of work.  One can see that this man comes from humble conditions but is very responsible when it comes to caring for his property, the result of which are the assets that he has.

loans.use: to build his home

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean works hard to support her family. Jean is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jean has been in this business for years now.

In the future, Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Neva Jane

texts.en:
Neva Jane is 32 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Neva Jane's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Neva Jane is taking out a bridge loan to restart her direct selling Avon products business.

Neva Jane has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her direct selling Avon products business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Neva Jane is committed to rebuild, and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell coconut, dried meat, and banana business. Rowena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Levita

texts.en:
Levita is 46 years old and has five children. Levita is married and has one child in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Levita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Levita has been in the pig fattening business for 2 years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Levita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She raises pigs in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Teresita is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to  purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pig business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Natividad has been in this business for 5 years. Natividad earns additional income from a general store and from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: As the married parent of seven children, Gemma works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling fresh fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by buying and selling dried fish.  She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Gemma has sustained her business with help from six prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en:
Junelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell through her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Junelyn has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from pig-fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos, los cuales le colaboran diariamente en su negocio, son una familia muy unida, su negocio consiste en la siembra de granos básicos, crianza de ganado y cerdos, lo cual practica de muy joven, así genera los recursos económicos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de la familia.
Con el préstamo comprara una vaca, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y abono, la inversión le ayudara a aumentar el ganado y tener los insumos agrícolas para preparar el terreno, proteger sus cultivos de plagas y lograr mejores cosechas.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio que genere más ingresos económicos para dar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud, así como también cancelar la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Isabel lives with his wife and four children, who help him on a daily basis with his business. They are a very unified family and his business consists of sowing basic grains and raising cattle and pigs. He has done this job since he was very young, and this is how he earns enough to cover the family's basic needs.

With the loan he will buy a cow, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and manure. This investment will help increase his herd of cows and have agricultural supplies to prepare the ground, protect the crops from pests and achieve a better harvest. His dream is to have a business that will generate more money so he can provide his family with better food, better clothing and good health, and also to be able to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy small fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Mirna tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 13 años y 6 años de edad. Mirna tiene un negocio de tienda desde hace 6 años y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento su hogar y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su familia. Mirna desea terminar de construir el corredor de su vivienda y comprar un portón por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina, tela metálica, cemento  y un portón.
texts.en:
Mirna, age 32, lives in her own home, together with her husband and two children, ages 6 and 13.  Mirna has had a business as a shopkeeper for six years.  This is how she earns her living and takes care of her household.  Together with her husband, she covers the finances of her family.  

Mirna wants to buy a gate and finish building a corridor for her home.  Because of this, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of metal sheeting, wire mesh, cement, and a gate.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wire mesh, cement, and a gate to finish the corridor of her home.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo. Vecente trabaja como albañil desde hace tres años y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Vicente es un hombre trabajador quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para llevar el sustento a su familia. Vicente desea construir un baño sanitario lavable y además desea pintar las paredes de la  vivienda. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, pintura y además pagará la mano obra necesaria de la construcción.
texts.en:
Vicente is 49 and lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked as a builder for three years, and this is how he earns a living and maintains the household. Vicente is a hard-working man who does everything he can turn his hand to in order to support his family. He wants to build a sanitary bathroom that he can keep clean and he also wants to paint the walls of his house.

This is why he is asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in buying cement, sand, bricks and paint and to pay for the construction labourers that are needed.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and paint to build a sanitary bathroom that he can keep clean.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 44 years old and married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Rebecca has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell nipa roofing business for 15 years and also earns an income from a general store and raising pigs.

Rebecca aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 63 years old and widowed, with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, and noodles.

Erma has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from operating a rice mill and raising pigs.

Erma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, and noodles.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 49 years old and married. She has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Dinah has been raising pigs for three years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Dinah is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy efficient energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas to sell to customers in her community

loans.name: Angel Manuel

texts.es:
Ángel Manuel es un señor de 43 años, vive junto a su esposa y cinco hijos en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad caracterizada por su comercio y por ser una zona muy productiva. Ciudad conocida en el país también por ser un puerto terrestre ya que se une la sierra con la costa y existe mucho intercambio de productos.
Ángel es muy unido a su familia, al llegar a su casa se siente un ambiente muy agradable, todos se apoyan; viven en un hogar muy humilde, una casa de madera. Todos viven ahí, cuentan con un pequeño galpón de pollos y criadero de chanchos, con este negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, también sabe de albañilería y muchas veces lo llaman para que realice construcciones.
Ángel con este crédito comprará más pollos para incrementar su negocio, además para comenzar a construir su casa ahora de cemento para que sea más segura. Se siente muy agradecido con la institución y con Kiva por que con este crédito podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, además porque le permitirá crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ángel Manuel is a 43-year-old man, who lives with his wife and five children in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados. It is a city known for business and for being an for production. The city is also known throughout the country for being a land port since it connects the mountains with the coast and there is a lot of goods trading.

Ángel is very close with his family. When they arrive home, they notice a pleasant feeling, because everyone supports each other. They live in a very modest home, which is made of wood. They all live there, and they have a small shed with chickens and a pig breeding center. This business has allowed him to support his family. He is also skilled as a builder and oftentimes he will get calls to do construction. With this loan, Ángel will buy more chickens to grow his business, as well as start building his current house out of cement so it is more secure. He is very grateful for the field partner and for Kiva, because this loan will be able to improve the quality of life for him and his family, and because it will allow him to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy chickens to grow his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee and tea for his cafe

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from fishing.

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase additional fish, to make into dried fish for selling.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, to make into dried fish

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell

loans.name: Angilyn

texts.en:
Angilyn is 30 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Angilyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of veterinary products to sell.

Angilyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 23 years old and has two children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, sugar, milk, etc.

Ritchel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a serger, fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Flordeliza works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to  purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell through her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de cuatro años de edad. Juan se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y francés desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar  y mantiene la economía de su familia. Juan solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea pavimentar el piso de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: arena , cemento y grava.
texts.en:
Juan is 24 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion and four year old son.   Juan has been working at selling French bread and sweet bread for a long time.  This is how he provides support to his household and maintains the family's finances. 

Juan is asking for this loan from FUSAI because he wants to pave the floor of their home and needs materials like sand, cement and gravel.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and gravel to pave the floor of the home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his ice cream store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 33 years old and has four children who are in school.

Erlinda has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a internet cafe business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF to pay for internet and electric bills.  She has been in this business for one year now.

Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for internet and electric bills

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
After he finished the repayment of the the first and the second loans, Ammar applied for a third loan from Kiva lenders. He plans to use the loan in order to purchase food ingredients and other materials for the restaurant. Ammar is warmly thankful to Kiva lenders for their first and second loans. They helped him very much, in improving his business and the condition of his family.

Ammar has decided to open a section inside the restaurant for selling Sambusa and other traditional foods, in the holy month (Ramathan). These foods will be very profitable for him, because in the holy month, most of the people go to sell these foods and the others make these foods inside their house. As a result, Ammar applied for a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB. He will use this amount in order to purchase food ingredients such as flour and sugar, and tongs and other tools, as well as many cooking pots, in order to make the traditional foods.

Ammar hopes to get this third loan from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, cooking pots and other tools, for making the traditional foods.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yaneth es una mujer trabajadora y muy luchadora, madre soltera de 6 hijos por los cuales ha tenido que guerrear duramente para sostenerlos
Es una mujer muy emprendedora y responsable. Tiene experiencia de 20 años en el manejo de las actividades agropecuarias.
Tiene un cultivo de yuca y de plátano que diariamente atiende para obtener unas buenas cosechas y posteriormente venderlas en el mercado y fincas cercanas.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, abonos y riegos que le permitirán mantener su tierra libre de plagas y bien nutrida.
Ella sueña con ver a su hijos convertidos en profesionales y por eso trabaja duramente para ofrecerles un excelente calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a hardworking and determined woman, a single mother of 6 children, who she has had to fight hard to sustain. She is a very enterprising and responsible woman. She has 20 years experience in managing farming activities. She has cassava and plantain plots which she looks after daily to get good harvests to sell in the markets and nearby farms.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, manure and irrigation which will help keep her land free from pests and well nourished. 

Her dream  is to see her children grown into professionals and that is why she works hard to offer them an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase children's toys.

loans.name: Natividad Vicente

texts.es: Natividad es una persona de 36 años de edad, unido, viven en el departamento de Sololá, tiene un hijo de cuatro meses de edad, su padre le ha enseñado a cultivar principalmente hortalizas de ciclo corto y es donde se ha especializado, actualmente siembra cebolla, papa, zanahoria), actividad que ha demostrado manejar bien con el pasar de los años y donde obtiene la mayoría de sus ingresos para ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia,  está solicitando la cantidad de Q3,000 el cual utilizara para la compra de insumos agrícolas (semillas, fertilizante orgánico) y así poder expandir su producción, uno de sus sueños es poder construir su vivienda debido que actualmente vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
Natividad is 36 years old, is married, and lives in Sololá.  He has one son, who is four month old.  His father taught him to harvest short-cycle crops, and he has become a specialist in this type of agriculture.  He currently grows onions, potatoes and carrots.  This work has gone well over the past years and it is where he earns the majority of his income.  He applies this income towards the sustenance of his family.  

He is requesting a loan of 3,000 quetzales, which he will use to buy agricultural supplies, including seeds and fertilizer.  This will allow him to expand his production.  One of his greatest dreams is to be able to build his own home, since he currently lives with his parents.

loans.use: to buy materials for his onion and potato crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more of goods and products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build other rooms beside the first ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials and renovate his workplace .

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a serger, fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a 54-year-old married woman from a small village near the city of Jenin. She has a son and a daughter. Her son has a construction supply store in the village. It is a good business but needs a lot of improvements.

Khetam requests $ 2,000 USD  from FATEN. This loan will help her son to buy more products and items for the construction store. By taking this loan, Khetam's son will be able improve his store and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy more products and items for the construction store to resell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 22-year-old single man from Attell, a small village near the city of Tulkarm. 

He has worked in his own studio for several years. He is a photographer and provides general services for school and university students.

Omar requests 1,500 USD from FATEN to buy new cameras and a printer for his photography store. Omar will be able to improve the quality of his work and attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy new cameras and a printer for his photography store.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 49 years old and married with seven children. With one child currently in school, Feliciana works very hard to provide for them.

Feliciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like rice, feed, noodles, shampoo, coffee, toothpaste, cereals and other groceries to sell.

Feliciana has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feed, noodles, shampoo, coffee, toothpaste, cereals and other groceries. 

Feliciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like rice, feed, noodles, shampoo, coffee, toothpaste, and cereals

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette is 54 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Georgette has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from room rentals.

Georgette aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gregoria works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling slippers. Gregoria is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Gregoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, and biscuits

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. Judith is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Judith requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Judith has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 43 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc., to sell.

She has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Pacita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with nine children. She is 48 years old and five of her children are currently in school. 

She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for one year. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Barid

texts.en:
After he finished repaying the installment of the first loan, Barid applied for a second  youth loan of 75,000 YER from Kiva lenders.  He wants to purchase another motorbike. The first loan improved the conditions of Barid's family. 

Barid is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their first loan and he hopes to take another loan to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old, married, and has five children, one currently is school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Luz has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Luz requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, noodles, and spices for her business.

Luz has been in this business for six years. Luz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, noodles, and spices for her food-vending business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Susan has been in this business for five years now.

Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 48 years old and single. She earns a living with a business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Alice is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alice has been pig fattening for 10 years and earns additional income from a general store and fishing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 37 years old, married, and has five children who all are in school.

Eufemia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Eufemia has been in pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an iron and a table.

loans.name: Na Tau 2 Group

texts.en:
Nhung, 25, lives in a small new Thai traditional house with her husband and her 4-year-old child. They moved out of their parents' house 5 years ago and started an independent life, but they have plenty of difficulties.  They  lack capital. Currently, they earn an income cultivating rice, growing vegetables, and breeding poultry and pigs. They also have a grocery store for additional earnings. 

This is the first loan Nhung has taken from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy more chickens and ducks to expand her business. She heard about Anh Chi Em's services.  These services  include loans and training sessions about agriculture, business, and social issues.  These topics are of interest and use to her. She hopes that by joining in Anh Chi Em's activities, she can increase her income and also understand farming, breeding techniques, and gain other knowledge.

Nhung dreams that her child will have an excellent education which will result in a successful career.  She wants him to grow up, escape poverty, and have a better life.
