In the picture, Nhung wears a Thai traditional costume with white shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new oven  to  enable his wife to make delicious cakes and breads.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian es de la ciudad de Ybycui, está terminando su nivelación en enfermería, ya que es obstetra t después podrá tener el titulo de enfermería.
Mirian es una persona muy sacrificada y siempre se esfuerza para poder crecer y ser una gran profesional. Su aspiración es poder tener un trabajo mejor y tener una casa propia.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma cubrir ese gasto que tiene, para poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Mirian is from the city of Ybycui.  She is finishing her  academic program in nursing as she is an obstetrical nurse and will be able to have the title of nurse. She is a very self-sacrificing person and always does her best to be able to grow and be a fine professional. Her ambition is to have a better job and have her own home. 

She is requesting this loan so she can cover her graduation course expenses and thereby be able to cover that expense and continue with her studies.

loans.use: To pay for graduation course expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for her land.

loans.name: Adda

texts.es:
Adda hoy se encuentra cursando el último año de la carrera de Derecho, a la vez que está trabajando en el Poder Judicial.
Quiere ser abogada, y comenta que su meta es la de recibirse este año lo cual le ayudará a  ascender en su puesto de trabajo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder estar más cerca de poder cumplir su meta por la que está luchando.
texts.en:
Adda is in her final year of her law degree, while working for the judiciary. She wants to be a lawyer, and states that her goal is to graduate this year, which will help her move up in her job.

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her university fees, which will bring her closer to achieving her goal that she is working hard towards.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Cecilia Marysol

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer de 36 años d edad, vive con su pareja y juntos tiene 3 niños, ella se dedica a la peluquería actividad que viene realizando desde q era adolescente. La necesidad de ayudar a su familia la hizo trabajar desde muy joven, comenzó arreglando las uñas de sus clientes como manicure y pedicura,  poco a poco fue aprendiendo sobre la técnica cuando tubo al edad suficiente accedió a cursos de peluquería y consiguió profesionalizarse.
Cecilia vive con su pareja y tres hijos, su pareja trabaja en el servicio de transporte público, los hijos mayores estudian en la escuela y su hijo menor lo acompaña toda la jornada en su peluquería, a medio día los niños retornan de la escuela  y hacen tareas en una habitación dentro de la peluquería, papa llega muy de noche y se va muy temprano por la mañana , ambos trabajan largas jornadas de lunes a sábado; “ casi no veo a mi pareja, se que vive con nosotros porque lleva su ropa diario en el baño….”.
Cecilia encontró en la peluquería una forma de ser independiente, todo depende de ella la limpieza del salón, el mantenimiento de las maquinas, etc.
Ahora Cecilia necesita crecer y renovarse; “ ya van mas de 10 años trabajando con los mismos materiales y equipos, en el mercado creció y necesito renovarme sino la competencia me dejara atrás.
 Es por todo lo anterior que Cecilia solicita un préstamo para la compra de secadoras de pie y material de peluquería.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 36-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and they have three children. She has worked as a hairdresser since she was a teenager. She started to work when she was very young, because she had to help her family. She started with taking care of the nails of the customers, like manicure and pedicure, and bit by bit she learnt more about the techniques. When she was old enough, she took up a vocational course and became a professional hairdresser.

Cecilia lives with her partner and the three children. Her partner works in public transportation, the older children are at school and she takes the small son with her to the salon every day. At noon, the two children return from school and do their homework in a separate room in the salon. Their father returns late at night and leaves very early in the morning. Both parents work long hours from Monday through Saturday. "I hardly see my partner, I know he lives with us because he leaves his clothes in the bathroom," she says.

With the salon, Cecilia found a way of working independently. Everything depends on her: the cleanliness, the maintenance of the machines, etc. Cecilia now wants to grow her business and renovate the salon: "I have worked for more than 10 years with the same equipment and materials, the market has grown and I have to renovate or the competitors will leave me behind," she says. Because of this, Cecilia asks for a loan to buy hood dryers and hairdressing equipment.

loans.use: to buy hood dryers and hairdressing equipment.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Yeredèmè sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati; elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes), habits et jus. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mama  (femme  assise à l’extrême droite  sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes); elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 620 paires de chaussures plastiques de tous les âges  à Bamako en gros; la revente se fait à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame  Mama  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the Yeredèmè are married, and the majority are in polygamous households. They are on average 40 years old and have on average 8 children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the commune of Mandé / Kati circle. They met each other through neighborhood connections and their businesses at the Kanadjiguila market. The group members sell plastic shoes (men’s and women’s), clothes, and juices. In the goal of replenishing their funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan. 

Mrs. Mama (sitting to the far right in the photo) has a grand reputation in selling plastic shoes (men’s and women’s). She plans to use her loan to buy 620 pairs of plastic shoes for all ages at Bamako in bulk; she will resell them in Kanadjiguila to a clientele composed mostly of women. Mrs. Mama hopes to earn with this loan an average monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest into her business and to take care of the needs and health of her children

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 50-year-old married woman with ten children; 4 attend school. 

She has a native mats weaving business in the Philippines and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is a 37-year-old married woman with three children who attend school.

Genalyn raises pigs and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Genalyn has raised pigs for 2 years and has previously borrowed 2 times to sustain her business.

In the future, Genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamin for her pigs.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a 49-year-old married woman with six children, two currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Felicidad has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Felicidad requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish stall.

Felicidad has been in this business for 37 years. In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 28 years old and married with five children, four currently in school. Gina works very hard to provide for her family.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like bread, snack foods, juice, soft drinks, biscuits, and beer to sell.

Gina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like bread, snack foods, juice, soft drinks, biscuits, and beer to sell.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria works hard to support her family. Gleceria is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Gleceria requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Gleceria has been in this business for three years now.

Gleceria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Glesir

texts.en:
Glesir is 27 years old and single.  

Glesir is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Glesir requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Glesir has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Glesir would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a maried woman with six children.  Marcelina is 57 years old and has two children attending school.

Marcelina raises pigs and requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her pigs.

Marcelina has been in this business for 9 years. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her pig.

loans.name: Nemelyn

texts.en:
Nemelyn is 34 years old and married with two children. Nemelyn works very hard to provide for her 2 school-aged children.

Nemelyn runs a general store and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, noodles, and cooking oil to sell.

Nemelyn has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Nemelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, noodles, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Silveria is 51 years old and has four children who are in school.

Silveria has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Silveria has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mission Basnere Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARCELINE est responsable du groupe  MISSION BASNERE. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a plus de 30ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Mme fait de l’agro pastoral depuis  plus de 20ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son village. 
Elle veut s’acheter  02 moutons, 02 chèvres et 01 porc pour engrosser et revendre.	
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Mme  ambitionne agrandir son activité et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. MARCELINE is the head of the MISSION BASNERE group. She is a married mother of seven. The eldest is 30 and the youngest is 9. Four of the children attend school. She is responsible for five people. 

Mrs. MARCELINE has been pastoral farming for more than 20 years. She stocks up at the market in her village. She wants to buy 2 sheep, 2 goats, and 1 pig to sire and sell. She wants to use her profits to strengthen her business. Mrs. MARCELINE hopes to grow her business and better take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 sheep, 2 goats, and a pig to sire and sell

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo es un sr de 45 años, soltero, tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad que tienen su propia familia. Él vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, ciudad que forma parte de la costa, con un clima cálido húmedo. Gustavo hace 13 años tiene una sastrería ubicada en la parte central de la ciudad, aprendió esta profesión estudiando en la noche en un instituto, poco a poco se compró unas máquinas y empezó con su negocio, donde le va muy bien.  Anteriormente también vendía ropa en otra ciudad pero hace unos 10 años le robaron su mercadería asaltando su local  y lo dejó desfinanciado por lo que tuvo que cerrar, pero su sastrería le ayudó a recuperarse poco a poco. Conoció a FA hace tres años porque escuchó por la radio un anuncio, ahora ya son cuatros créditos y se siente muy agradecido ya que poco a poco ha podido comprar más máquinas y así se le ha ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida. Ahora con este crédito va a comprar telas, hilos, cierres y demás ya que se acerca la temporada de fiesta de la ciudad y necesita para la confección de uniformes de bandas de guerra.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a 45 year-old man.  He is unmarried and has two children who are already grown-up with their own families.  He lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a costal city with a hot, humid climate.  For thirteen years, Gustavo has had a tailoring shop located in the central part of the city.  He learned this profession by studying at an institute at night.  Little by little, he bought some machines and began his business.   It is going very well for him.  

Previously, he also used to sell clothing in another city but ten years ago his merchandise was stolen and his shop vandalized, leaving him without funds.  He had to close his store, but his tailoring shop helped him to recuperate little by little.  

He came to know FA three years ago because he heard an advertisement on the radio.  At this point he has had four loans and he is very grateful because he has been able to gradually buy more machines.  This has helped him to improve his quality of life.  With this loan, he is now going to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and other supplies because the city’s festival is approaching and he needs these to make uniforms for the military bands.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and zippers for making outfits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and bricks to make a quick renovation to his house.

loans.name: Lazos Unidos Y Rumbos Distintos Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAZOS UNIDOS Y RUMBOS DISTINTOS” es un grupo conformado por socios puntuales y responsables en sus cuotas de grupo. Janet tiene 40 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos educando y uno independiente. Ella se dedica al cultivo de frutas para luego expenderlos al por mayor y menor. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de su cosecha. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Janet  es la segunda del lado derecho viste chaleco marrón
texts.en:
The group “LAZOS UNIDOS Y RUMBOS DISTINTOS” (United Ties and Different Paths) is a group formed by members who are punctual and responsible with their loans. Janet is 40 years old and married with 2 children in school and one who is independent. She grows fruit to later sell at whole sale and retail. 

Janet will invest the loan to purchase fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops. The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan offered. Janet is the second on the right, dressed in a brown sweater.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her degree.

loans.name: Qoriccoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICCOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Pilar ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de cabina de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Qoriccoyllor" communal bank, located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, in the department of Cusco.

Señora María Pilar is single and has five children.  She is 48 years old and works in her own small grocery store.  She also works selling trout.  She sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has been running this business for one year and it is going very well for her.  

Her dream is to expand her grocery store.  She is asking for this loan to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.  She is grateful to the people who are part of her dream through this medium and is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

The other members work in restaurant sales, animal sales, an internet café, and a convenience store.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has operated a food vending business for 16 years.

She requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase frozen foods including tempura, fish balls, and squid rolls to sell.

Rosalina  would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase quantities of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 19 years old and is the eldest of the four children in the family. Her mother, Rosalina, is a member of NWTF and supports the family through her general store business.

Ana Marie is working on a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting and is currently in the 2nd year of this 4-year course.

Ana Marie requests 8,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees of the 1st semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

Ana Marie plans to graduate and be successfully employed.

loans.use: to pay  tuition fees.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Shenie is 19 years old and is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Elementary Education. She is currently in her last year of this 4-year course.

Shenie needs 7,500 PHP to pay tuition fees for the 1st semester of 2014-2015 school year.

Shenie plans to graduate and be successfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 47 years old and has seven children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Veronica is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 13,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been in pig-fattening for ten years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Bwikara Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Sadam is a 40-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda with seven children between 16 and 3 years old and all attend school. He has been operating a butcher shop alongside farming since 2001 to generate income and educate his children. He hopes to build a commercial house in spite of the challenges of inadequate capital. Sadam intends to use the loan to buy more cattle to sell. He is a member of Bwikara Tweimukye Group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Sinia Sonia

texts.es:
Sinia, opta por un nuevo crédito por los efectos positivos que estos le generan, le servirá para comprar camarones, cangrejos, conchas, variedad de pescado entre otros mariscos, cada vez que necesite abastecer el negocio para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y seguir progresando.
Con el capital anterior mejoro la calidad del producto, ofreció mariscos frescos a sus clientes, pues hoy los conserva de mejor manera con el freezer que compro, sus ventas e ingresos son mejores, su familia se mantiene apoyándola para juntos subsistir de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Sinia decided to request a new loan because of the positive effects it generates. This loan will help her to purchase shrimp, crab, conch, and a variety of fish among them other shellfish, each time she needs to stock her business to meet the needs of her customers and keep improving.

With the previous loan she improved the quality of product, offering fresh shellfish to her customers. Now she maintains her products better with a freezer that she purchased. Her sales and profits are better. Her family continues to support her so together they can survive in the best way.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp, crab, conch, and a variety of fish.

loans.name: Iris Brenis

texts.es:
Iris, es parte de una familia integrada por su esposo y dos hijos, comparte con su esposo la responsabilidad de buscar el  bienestar de su familia, ella genera ingresos atendiendo un chalet en el que vende hamburguesas, hot dogs, bebidas, golosinas, pan, galletas, etc., y además tiene un su vivienda una tienda de insumos básicos para el hogar, trabaja en el chalet de siete de la mañana a dos de la tarde, luego se dedica a atender la tienda, es apoyada por su familia.
El financiamiento será de utilidad para comprar embutidos, pan, jugos, gaseosas, boquitas, dulces, tomates, repollo, aderezos, aceite, servilletas, huevos, gas propano, etc., tanto para elaborar la venta del chalet como para surtir la tienda, el resto lo invertirá en dar mantenimiento y pintar el coche en donde prepara su venta, con lo cual espera tener mejores ingresos para mejorar el estilo de vida de su núcleo familiar y cancelar sus cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
Su sueño es mantenerse trabajando para continuar apoyando a su familia y dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar en la Universidad.
texts.en:
Iris’s family is comprised of her husband and 2 children. She and her husband share the responsibility of keeping their family’s wellbeing.  She earns an income as a server in a food stall selling hamburgers, hot dogs, beverages, sweets, bread, cookies etc... In addition she has a shop with basic household supplies in her house. She works in the food stall from 6 am until 2 pm, later she works in the shop supported by her family.

The loan will be useful to purchase deli meats, bread, juices, soft drinks, snacks, sweets, tomatoes, cabbage, seasoning, oil, serviettes, eggs, propane gas etc... both to make sales in the food stall as well as to stock her shop. The rest of the money she will invest in the maintenance and painting of her car where she does her sales. She hopes to have better profits to improve her lifestyle for her immediate family and to pay off her debts.

Her dream is to continue working, to be able to support her family and give her children the opportunity to study at university.

loans.use: to purchase deli meats, bread, juices, soft drinks, snacks, sweets, tomatoes, cabbages, seasoning, oil, serviettes, eggs, propane gas etc...

loans.name: Aracelly

texts.es: Aracelly una mujer emprendedora que a pesar de su separación siempre forjo su vida cociéndola poco a poco se desempeña como confeccionista principalmente confección a terceros con la ayuda de sus hijos y una empleada que le colabora permanentemente, en su afán de progresar Aracelly se ha empelado en crear su propia línea de ropa solicita un crédito para la compra de telas y adornos decorativos para empezar su línea de ropa que le supondrá mejores ingresos pues a sus 67 años de edad solo le queda trabajar y mejorar su empresa puntada por puntada.
texts.en:
Aracelly is an enterprising woman who despite her separation always shapes her life building it slowly. She works as a dressmaker mainly for third parties with the help of her children and a permanent employee. In her quest to improve, Aracelly has been creating her own line of clothing. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase fabric and embellishments to start her line of clothing which will increase her income. Because at 67 years old she can only work and enhance her company stitch by stitch.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as fabrics and embellishments to start her line of clothing.

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.es:
Maria tiene 19 años y aunque es un chica joven tiene la responsabilidad más grande y es su hija de 1 año por la cual ha decidido luchar incansablemente para ofrecerle un buen futuro.
Ella ha opto por buscar ingresos a través de la venta de mercancía al por menor como ropa, accesorios, entre otros y de este modo conseguir un buen capital para trabajar y mantener a su hija.
Solicita recursos para comprar un inventario de productos mucho más amplio y de este modo tener mercancía disponible para vender a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son vecinos, familiares y amigos.
Su principal desafío es la falta de capital para trabajar, pero tiene la esperanza de algún día tener un almacén de ropa y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old. Although she is a young woman, she bears a lot of responsibility. She is responsible for her 1-year-old daughter, for whom she works tirelessly in order to be able to offer her a better future. 

She has chosen to earn her money by selling merchandise to private customers, like clothing, accessories, and other things. By this she earns some money to continue her business and to provide for her daughter.

She needs funds to enlarge her inventory of products, and by this to have merchandise on stock to sell to her clients, who are mainly neighbors, family, and friends. 

Her main obstacle is the lack of working capital, but she hopes that one day she will have her on clothes shop and to have employees.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of clothing and accessories for selling.

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta primer año de bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos Jorge ha procreado 2 hijos los cuales solo uno de ellos está en la escuela, solo su pareja e hijos dependen de él.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años, no pudo continuar con sus estudios y fue entonces que el abuelo le enseñó el trabajo, el lugar de trabajo le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos y se va a pie, lo ejerce en un horario de 6:00 AM a 1:00 PM.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para cancelar cuatro sacos de abono que le prestaron para que regara la milpa el préstamo le ayudará de mucho ya que el cultivo crecerá mejor y le dará más ganancias para mantener el hogar.

Sus sueños son que a su familia no le falte nada y poder seguir cultivando la tierra para que sus hijos tengan los alimentos y los ingresos suficientes para que ellos sigan estudiando y sean profesionales
texts.en:
Jorge is 30 years old. He has studied until the first year of high school and has a partner who takes care of the household chores. Jorge has 2 children, only one of them goes to school. Only his partner and his children depend on him.

Jorge has worked in farming for eight years. He could not continue school and then his grandfather showed him the work in the field. The place where he works is 15 minutes from his home and he goes there on foot. He works from 6:00 a. m. to 1:00 p. m. every day.

The loan he needs to pay for four bags of fertilizer which he borrowed to use on his corn filed. The loan will help him a lot, because his crop will grow better and will give him more income for his household.

His dreams are that his family lacks nothing, and that he can continue to work in the field, so that his children have enough food and enough income to be able to continue their education and become professionals.

loans.use: to pay for four sacks of fertilizer which he borrowed to use on his corn field.

loans.name: Elsa Enriqueta

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una ciudad de la región costa conocida en el país por ser una zona muy productiva y comercial. Justamente en este punto existe mucho intercambio comercial por ser el puerto terrestre que une la sierra y la costa. Aquí vive Elsa, una señora de 61 años, separada, tiene un hijo pero ya es mayor de edad.
Elsa es una señora muy trabajadora, por las mañanas ella brinda el servicio de limpieza en oficinas, es muy dedicada en su trabajo, y en las tardes ella sale a recorrer a vender frutas, que es su fuerte. Elsa además en sus tiempos libres hace manualidades, las mismas que la vende a vecinos.
Elsa ha trabajado con Fundación Alternativa, ahora nuevamente necesita un crédito para la compra de frutas y además para terminar de construir un cuarto para arriendo en el segundo piso. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo de estos años Elsa poco a poco ha ido mejorando su casa y se siente muy agradecida porque gracias a los créditos de Fundación Alternativa ella ha podido crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados is a city in the costal region known throughout the country for being a very productive and commercial area.  A lot of trade exists in precisely that area thanks to being a land port uniting the sierra and the coast.  Elsa lives here.  She is 61 years old and separated.  She has a child, but her child is already an adult.

She is a very hardworking woman.  During the mornings, she works as a cleaning woman in some offices.  She is very dedicated to her work.  In the afternoons, she goes out to tour around selling fruits, which is her strength.  Elsa also makes handicrafts in her free time, which she sells to neighbors.

She has worked before with Fundación Alternativa.  Currently she needs a new loan to buy fruit and also to finish building a room on the second floor to rent out.

Thanks to her hard work and efforts, Elsa has gone on improving her house.  She is very grateful because thanks to her loans from Fundación Alternativa, she has been able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fruit and to finish building a room in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to use in her gift shop.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 1, 2 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the Fuente Para el Desarrollo (Font for Development) 1, 2 & 8. They are micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisan crafts, etc. They are in the city of Samana, a tourist town in development. Their town is still rural but is a great natural escape, and these borrowers use this to sell their products to people visiting their town.

Juana is a single woman. She lives with her family in her simple and rural home structure. Juana is very excited to be receiving her 10th loan from Esperanza International. She has successfully paid off her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She started her business almost six years ago. She will invest her new loan in purchasing miscellaneous products like cosmetic and beauty products. She will use her earnings to re-invest in the business while she saves to have a successful and sustainable business. Juana thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn Thiện Na, Vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Mr. Liệu works in agriculture raising poultry. He is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

Liệu is 44 years old and married with three children. He is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 01 Thôn Thiện Na, Vạn Hòa solidarity group. 

In 2011, he joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his business. Liệu has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that he faces in his business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Liệu hopes for his business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 49 years old and married, with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Lilia has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nineta

texts.en:
Nineta is 56 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school, Nineta works very hard to provide for them.

Nineta's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nineta has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Nineta has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Nineta is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married parent, Estelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice and running a general store.  Estelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like cream, coffee, sugar, milk and canned goods.

Jocelyn has been in this business for nine years. She successfully paid back her previous loan, so she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like cream, coffee, sugar, milk and canned goods

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of spices and dried fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Cristina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell for her buy and sell of spices and dried fish business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 47 years old and married. She works very hard to help her husband. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell such as canned goods, egg, milk, chips, and coffee. Norma has been in this business for six years.

In the future Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, and coffee.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 39 years old and married with 10 children, five of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, cream, etc.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns an income from her buy and sell of dry goods business.

She aspires to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, and cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, iron, electric materials, and plumbing materials in order to complete the building of his house.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Cụm 18 Thôn Tân Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a retail business, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell. Hoa is 41 years old and she is married, with three children.

Hoa is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Cụm 18 Thôn Tân Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives with one dependent and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hoa joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid three loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn Thái Sơn Ii Công Chính Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 43 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the Nhóm 02 thôn Thái Sơn II Công Chính solidarity group. This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Hoa works in agriculture raising poultry . She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nhóm 8 Thôn 6 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuấn works in agriculture rasing poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Tuấn is 32 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 8 Thôn 6 Quảng Hải solidarity group. Tuấn lives with three dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Tuấn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuấn has been involved in this business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Tuấn hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo está trabajando en un establecimiento ganadero, y a la vez está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agropecuaria.
En el futuro quiere tener su propio establecimiento agropecuario y ejercer su profesión, ayudar a su familia y obtener un mejor nivel de vida.
Arnaldo es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, y es eso lo que lo destaca. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad y de esa forma seguir con sus sueños
texts.en:
Arnaldo works on a cattle ranch and at the same time is studying agricultural engineering. In the future he wishes to have his own farm and put his training into practice. In this way he will help his family and obtain a better standard of living.

Arnaldo stands out because of his commitment to his studies. He is asking for a loan so he can pay for university courses and continue to realise his dreams.

loans.use: Pay university fees

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
Americo es un hombre trabajador, tiene 31 años de edad y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a sus padres.
Desde hace más de 3 años tiene su puesto afuera del mercado y vende anticuchos, rachi, tripita, de muy buena calidad y a un precio económico. Es una persona muy responsable que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha sacado adelante a sus 4 hijos.
Americo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá hacer la base de su casa para que más adelante empiece a construirla y así pueda tener un mejor lugar para vivir y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Americo is a hard-working man.  He is 31-years old and lives in San Juan de Lurigancho with his parents. 
For more than three years, he has had a stall outside the market, where he sales high-quality and affordable kebabs, "rachi" (a local dish made from cows' belly), and tripe.  Americo is a very responsible person who, with a lot of hard work and dedication, has been able to get his four children ahead. 
Americo is grateful for the Kiva lenders because, with their help, he will be able to build his house's foundation so that later on, he can start to build the house.  He will then have a better place to live and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to build his house's foundation.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell dried fish. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as noodles, water, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer and cigarettes. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, water, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer and cigarettes

loans.name: Octavia

texts.en:
Octavia is taking a loan of USD 600 to improve her business. She is running a second-hand clothing business that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as trousers, shorts, long-sleeved shirts, short-sleeved shirts, and bags. She opened her second-hand clothing business a year ago with her own working capital of USD 200. 

Octavia is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, long-sleeved shirts, short-sleeved shirts, and bags.

loans.name: Agrifina

texts.en: A $1,000 loan is offered to Agrifina to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like electronic equipment. She is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To purchase electronic equipment

loans.name: Nuevo Renacimiento 3, 4, 5 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Judith is one of the members of the group, Nuevo Renacimiento (New Renaissance) 3, 4, 5 & 7, located in the city of Samana, a city in one of the rural areas surrounded by the waters of the Atlantic ocean. Many of the group members sell goods, such as bread, clothing, shoes or cosmetics. Others sell seafood, or run fried food stalls or other businesses.

Judith is a single mother with two children. She runs a beauty salon. She started her business around two and a half years ago, with her own savings. She wants to invest her part of this loan to buy hair and beauty products, beauty salon supplies and instruments. This is her sixth loan. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business, and she wants to have a successful beauty salon, her own house and a great education for her children.

She will use this loan to invest in her beauty salon. She is hoping to make her dreams come true: to have a prosperous life and a good business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy hair and beauty products

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yiriwa est composé uniquement de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 41ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, draps de meilleures qualités et pagnes wax. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des draps. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 draps en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame  Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Yiriwa group is made up solely of monogamous women. They are on average 41 years old and have on average 3 children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the commune of Mandé / Kati circle. They met each other through neighborhood connections. The group members sell sheets of the highest quality, and pagnes wax (high-quality, traditional wraps). In the goal of replenishing their funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan. 

Mrs. Mariam (sitting to the far right in the photo) has a grand reputation in selling sheets. She plans to use her loan to buy 30 sheets in bulk at the grand market. She will resell them at retail in Kanadjiguila and door to door to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Mariam hopes to earn with this loan an average monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest into her business. She has the goal of buying a lot to live on in this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy sheets of the best quality

loans.name: Cecilia Guadalupe

texts.es: Cecilia de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para Cecilia es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos, ella ha decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y por consecuencia seguir trabajando por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 57 years old. She lives in her own house with her two daughters. She is known for being an honest, hardworking, and enterprising woman. Several years ago she was able to open a little store at her home. Thanks to God and to her hard work and dedication the business is well recognized in the area, and it has many customers.

For Cecilia it is very important to keep this business active because it is her main source of income. She has made the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of goods for the store, such as, eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread, and other items that attract customers. She hopes to reach her dream of keeping her business active and keep working for a better future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread, and other items.

loans.name: Uluvalu

texts.en:
Uluvalu is 37 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for thee years. 

Uluvalu has requested a loan to buy a new frying pan, bags of flour, oil, yeast, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Uluvalu will extend her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, yeast, oil, a fry pan, etc.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Thôn Thạch Tiến Quảng Thạch Group

texts.en:
Hoài is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

She has a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 Thôn Thạch Tiến Quảng Thạch solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

With her business profit, Hoài hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Cụm 03 Thôn Thắng Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mau is 46 years old and she is married with three children. She lives with one dependent in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has a retail business selling fish. She has been involved in this business for six years.The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. 

In 2009, Mau joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 cụm 03 Thôn Thắng Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Mau hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Christian Mauricio

texts.es:
Christian es un joven de 26 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos.
Le gusta mucho jugar futbol y siempre fue el capitan de su equipo en la secundaria, ahora ya no tiene mucho tiempo para jugar pues el trabajo más el estudio sólo le dejan tiempo para dormir. Los fines de semana lo dedica al aseo general y personal y también se dá un tiempito para salir a comer ó pasear con su mamá.
Christian piensa fomar una familia, algún día quiere casarse con su novia y tener muchos hijos, primero sueña con terminar su carrera y ser un exelente profesional, tiene el mundo por delante muhos sueños y fantasias. Actualmente se encuentta estudiando en la universidad una carrera técnica y trabaja realizando el mantenimiento técnico a computadoras, él paga sus estudios y su alimentación con su trabajo, en este momento le hace mucha falta herramientas para su pequeño taller.
Christian confía mucho en las personas es por eso que solicita un prestamo para la compra de materiales de estudio y algunas  herramientas para sus clases practicas para practicar el arreglo de computadoras y asi mejorar su taller y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Christian is a young man of 26 years. He is single and has no children.

He likes soccer very much and always was the capitan of his team in high school. Today, he does not have much time to play soccer, because his work and his studies only leave him time to sleep. He does general and personal tasks at the weekends, and sometimes spends a little bit of time eating out or going for a walk with his mother.

Christian wants to have a family. One day he wants to marry his girlfriend and have many children. First, he wants to finish his career and become an excellent professional. He has the world before him and many dreams and fantasies. At the moment, he studies a technical career at university and he works providing technical maintenance for computers. His work provides the money for his courses and his food, but at the moment he lacks the money to buy tools for his small workshop.

Christian has much faith in people, and therefore he asks for a loan to buy study materials and some tools for his practical lessons, to be able to practice the repair of computers and by this to improve his workshop and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy study materials and some tools for his practical lessons.

loans.name: 21 Hưng Bắc Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Xuân is 40 years old and married with three children. She is the group leader of the 21 Hưng Bắc Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2013, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Xuân hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: 01 Hưng Bắc Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hường has a retail business selling cakes. She has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to make cakes to sell.

Hường is 52 years old and married with three children. She is the group leader of the 01 Hưng Bắc Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2013, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hường has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Hường hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to make cakes to sell.

loans.name: Oygul

texts.ru: Ойгул с детства всегда мечтала организовать свой бизнес и достичь успеха. Она родилась в 1993 году. Ойгул не замужем и живет с родителями. Она умеет шить национальные женские платья. Ойгул недавно участвовала в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она получила сертификат. Ойгул составила свой бизнес план. Теперь она нуждается финансовой поддержке. Ойгул запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Oygul was born in 1993.  She has yet to marry and lives with her parents.  Ever since she was a child, Oygul has dreamed of starting her own business and being a successful entrepreneur.  She recently took part in a course titled "Achieve Success" organized by an association for businesswomen, received a certificate upon completion, and has come up with a plan to set up her own business; she knows how to sew Tajikistani women's clothing, but is in need of financial support to get started.  She is seeking a loan of 2000 somoni to buy a sewing machine, and is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine to set up a new business

loans.name: 03 Tân Hưng, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing to resell.

Hồng is 38 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 03 Tân Hưng, Hưng Lộc  solidarity group. 

In 2013, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hồng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell

loans.name: Lyrece

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lyrece works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a boarding house, food vending and raising livestock.  Lyrece is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

Lyrece has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 47 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from making nipa roofing and raising livestock.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF to purchase fish to make dried fish for her business.

Melanie has been in this business for 15 years. Melanie earns more income from food vending and pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Mernita

texts.en:
Mernita is 38 years old and married. She works very hard to help her husband.

She runs a buy and sell bamboo business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bamboo to sell.

Mernita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Mernita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bamboo to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 48 years old and widowed with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Thelma has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Thelma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 42 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Susana has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Susana is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ray Estela

texts.es: Ray se dedica a la venta de mercancia y especialmente productos de tocado y para el hogar desde hace 4 años, atendiedo la tradicion de comerciantes que existe en su familia. Con su madre aprendió todo lo relacionado con negocios y de su mano aun sigue trabajando, vendiendo a crédito desde los lunes a sabados iniciando su labor a las 8 dela mañana y terminandola a las 7 de la noche comprando de contado a mayoristas para obtener los mejores precios y hacer una oferta que le permita competir en le mercado de sus principales clientes que son sus propios vecinos y referídos por estos. Su meta mas adelante es tener un amplio almacen, En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  articulos para el hogar y de tocador, aprovechando así que la temporada del segundo semestre del año es mucho mas generosa en  ventas y Ray debe estar muy bien preparado para ella.
texts.en:
Ray earns his living selling merchandise. He has specialized in toiletries and products for the home for the past four years, and thus following in his parents' footsteps as they are also merchants. His mother taught him all about running a business and still continues to help him. He sells his goods on credit from Monday to Saturday, starting work at 8 am and finishing at 7pm. He buys the merchandise for cash from wholesalers to obtain the best prices and then offers his customers competitive prices. His customers are neighbours and people who have been referred to him.

Ray's future goal is to have a well-stocked store. He is now applying for a loan from Kiva, his first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy products for the home and toiletries, and in this way benefit from the coming season when sales pick up. He wishes to be prepared for that time.

loans.use: Buy products for the home and toiletries

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 35 years old and married with one child.

Analiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as biscuits, snack foods, juice, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, etc. 

Analiza has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Analiza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as biscuits, snack foods, juice, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Wilmer Alfredo

texts.es:
Wilmer es un joven trabajador de 25 años, vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija en el Recinto La Alegría, un pueblito de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas muy conocido por ser un sector muy productivo, el fuerte es la producción de plátano y cacao y además de animales como ganado, chanchos y pollos.
Wilmer vive en una pequeña casita heredada por su madre, ahí cuenta con unas chancheras donde cría sus animales, tiene chanchos, los mismos que vende una vez engordados. Este negocio ya lo lleva 8 años, desde joven aprendió de sus padres. Gracias a ello él ha podido sacar a su pequeña familia adelante, pero ahora necesita hacer un mejoramiento en su casa ya que es un lugar muy pequeño y desea adecuarlo; para ello necesita el crédito y además para la compra de lechones y comida, para criarlos y venderlos.
Wilmer  manifiesta jamás haber recibido créditos por la falta de experiencia crediticia, pero agradece enormemente a la Fundación y A Kiva por haber confiado en él y darle la oportunidad de crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a young worker who is 25 years old. He lives with his wife and his young daughter in Recinto La Alegría, a small town in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, widely known as a production area. The main production is of bananas and cocoa as well as animals like cattle, pigs and chickens.

Wilmer lives in a small house handed down from his mother, and there they have some pens where they raise the animals. He has pigs, that he sells once they are large enough. He has had this business for eight years, and he learned the business from his parents when he was a child. 

Thanks to that, he has been able to support his small family. Now he needs to make an improvement to his house since it is a very small place and he wants to adjust it. This is why he needs the loan and also to buy pigs and food to raise and sell them.

Wilmer states that he has never received loans for lack of a credit score, but he greatly appreciates the field partner and Kiva for believing in him and for giving him the opportunity to grow and to get out ahead.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food to raise them.

loans.name: Maaka

texts.en:
Maaka is 30 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes, cooked noodles and pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Maaka has requested a loan to buy a new pot, a frying pan, a wheelbarrow and other similar items. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maaka will use her profit to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a new pot, wheelbarrow and frying pan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay a tuition fee and buy more books for her oldest child

loans.name: Nhóm 9 Thôn 6 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Hòa is 38 years old and married with three children. She lives with her three dependents in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 9 thôn 6 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In the future, Hòa hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new pot, a fry pan, yeast, bags of flour, etc.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is 62 years old, a widow, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Pilar is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she is applying for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Pilar continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Medardo Elias

texts.es:
Medardo es un joven emprendedor, tiene 33 años de edad y vive en Lima junto a su familia.
desde hace varios años se dedica a brindar servicios como albañil y ofrece remodelaciones, acabados, entre otros a los domicilios o locales que puedan requerir algún tipo de arreglo, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo porque realiza excelentes trabajas.
Medardo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar su casa como tarrajear y pintar las paredes de su domicilio, arreglar el piso y la seguridad de toda la casa para que de esta manera su familia pueda sentir mayor comodidad y puedan vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Medardo is a young entrepreneur.  He is 33 years old and lives with his family in Lima.

He has been working as a mason for several years and does remodeling, finishing and other things in homes and businesses.  Things are going well for him because he is a very responsible and hardworking person and above all because he does excellent work.

Medardo is very grateful of the Kiva lenders because their help has allowed him to remodel his home by refinishing and painting the walls and repairing the floor.  In this way his family can feel safer, more comfortable, and be able to live better.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene 25 años de edad y vive en Nazca junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos.
Desde hace más de 3 años trabaja en una Tienda Comercial y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, amable, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.
Percy está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un juego de dormitorio para que pueda tener más comodidad y pueda descansar mejor, de esta manera irá a trabajar con mucha energía para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Percy is a very enterprising 25-year-old who lives in Nazca with his wife and two children. 

For over 3 years, he has worked in a commercial shop. He is doing very well because he is very responsible, kind, hardworking, and eager to get ahead for his family. 

Percy is grateful to Kiva lenders because through their support, he can buy a bedroom set so he can have more comfort and rest better. This way, he can work with a lot of energy to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a bedroom set.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. Analyn is married and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Analyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell such as flashlights, belts, sunglasses, watches, etc.

Analyn has been in this business for 14 years now. In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell such as flashlights, belts, sunglasses, watches, etc.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a native bags weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Monina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by running a general store business in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, chips, etc.

Virginia has been in the general store business for 20 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, chips, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, propane gas, seasoning, fresh cheese, pork rind, tomatoes, bags, and lime among others.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, requiere de capital para pagar el mantenimiento del vehículo de trabajo, con esta inversión garantiza la seguridad de sus clientes y buenos ingresos para cubrir los compromisos económicos.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior ha mantenido en perfectas condiciones su vehículo, permitiéndole mantenerse trabajando por mucho tiempo, con los nuevos ingresos ha cancelado su deuda y apoyado a su hija en los estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Carlos needs capital to do maintenance on his work vehicle.  This will make his customers safer and improve his income to pay his obligations.  He was able to maintain his vehicle in perfect condition with the previous loan, allowing him to continue working for a long time.  He paid the debt with his income and also supported his daughter in university.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es:
El polvo proveniente de la gran pila de bloques se siente en el aire, indica que nos encontramos cerca del negocio de José de Jesús, quien a sus 51 años continúa con su trabajo que comenzó hace diez años, el de la construcción. Comenzó en el campo como albañil, y al observar los diferentes trabajos que realizaba y la necesidad de sus clientes, incursiono en la venta de bloques. Está casado y tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos son su principal apoyo en el negocio.
José de Jesús solicita el crédito para comprar la materia prima de su negocio requiere comprar bloques, cemento y arena. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que al tener más productos generará mayores ganancias y de esta manera alcanzar sus objetivos, los cuales son la expansión de su negocio y la especialización en venta de productos de alta demanda. Es un hombre con metas bien establecidas, cuya prioridad es el bienestar y la salud de su familia, razón por la que día a día seguirá luchando.
texts.en:
Dust rising from the large pile of blocks is felt in the air; it indicates that we are near José de Jesús’ business. At 51 years of age, he continues with the construction business he started ten years ago. He began in the sector as a mason and upon observing the different tasks being performed and the needs of customers, he ventured into selling blocks. He is married and has four children, two of whom assist him in his business.

Josr de Jesús is requesting a loan to purchase basic supplies for his business. He needs to buy blocks, cement and sand. He is putting his faith in financing since when he has more products, he will generate higher profits and in this way achieve his objectives of expanding his business and specializing in high demand products. He is a man with well formulated goals, whose priority is the health and well-being of his family. His family is the reason he will continue to struggle, day after day.

loans.use: to purchase blocks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Edgar Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Edgar es un experimentado carpintero el cual a sus 15 años aprendió su oficio gracias a sus tíos y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual gracias a dios y a pesar de las adversidades ha logrado salir junto con su familia.
Su mayor orgullo es haber construido su propia casa de madera donde vive actualmente con su esposa y tres hijos, construyo los muebles y casi todo lo encontrado en su humilde hogar es fabricado por el mismo.
 Solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina Ruteadora y madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por ellos, su principal sueño es enfocado en sus hijos puesto que vive en una zona donde la educación es casi que un mito donde las personas que progresan es por que adquirieron conocimientos empíricamente y salen adelante pro trabajar largas jornadas laborales y muchas veces solo por el pan diario, Edgar quiere que sus hijos vayan a una universidad y en un futuro no muy lejano vuelvan a su hogar como todos unos profesionales con altos cargos ejecutivos
texts.en:
Edgar is an experienced carpenter who learned this trade at the age of 15, thanks to his uncles.  Over time he became independent and started up his own workshop with which, thanks to God and in spite of adversity, he has managed to get ahead with his family.

His greatest pride is his house that he built with wood.  This is where he currently lives with his wife and three children.  He built the furniture and almost everything else in his unassuming home.  

Edgar is requesting a loan to buy a router machine and wood so that he can make more furniture and derive a good profit from his work.  His main dream is focused on his children. Because he lives in an area where education is almost a myth, where the people who get ahead do so by acquiring knowledge hands-on and support themselves by working long days (often earning just enough to put food on the table), Edgar wants his children to go to a university and return home one day in the not-so-distant future as professionals with upper management positions.

loans.use: to buy a router machine and wood for making tables, chairs, beds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an inventary of clothes of new brands.
