loans.name: Leidy Vanesa

texts.es:
Leidy, de 19 años, junto con su hermana han optado por montar un negocio de comidas rápidas cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de Medellín.
Leidy trabaja todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, es una joven muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada.
Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos.
Ella pide un aliento económico para surtir su negocio de gaseosas y cervezas, adicionalmente invertir parte del dinero en publicidad para aumentar la presencia del negocio.
El crédito impactara su vida de un modo favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de bebidas para ofrecer junto con sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Leidy is 19 years old and she and her sister have decided to start a fast food business near their home in Medellin.

Leidy works every day from 9:00 am to 8:00 pm.  She is a very responsible, judicious and focused young woman.

Her dreams include being able to have a restaurant where she can offer different types of food.

She is asking for a loan to stock her business with soft drinks and beers.  She also wants to use some of the money for advertising.

The loan will impact her life favorably and she will be able to achieve her dream of having a greater variety of soft drinks to offer along with her foods.

loans.use: to stock her business with beverages.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es:
María tiene 77 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que en la época de antes tenían que trabajar desde muy pequeños, se separó del esposo cuando el ultimo hijo tenía un año de edad, tiene 9 hijos las cuales uno de ellos ya falleció y los demás están en hogares apartes, con María solo vive un nieto por lo tanto solo él dependen de ella 

María se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 25 años de edad, actualmente ella trabaja solo con un nieto ya que es poco lo que cultivan, solo hacen media hectárea de terreno ya que solo son para los gastos de ellos dos y lo demás que sacan del cultivo lo venden para pagar los préstamos, el trabajo le queda cerca de su casa y lo realizan de 6:00 a 10:00 AM.

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar un saco de abono y le pagará a una persona para que le ayude.
Sus sueños son que Dios le de vida para seguir trabajando, y que a su nieto no le falte nada.
texts.en:
María is 77 years old. She did not have the opportunity to got to school, because in earlier times the children had to start work when they were very small. She separated from her husband when her last son was grown up. She has 9 children, of whom one has already passed away, and the others have their own households. Only one grandson lives with María, therefore only he depends on her.

María has worked in farming since she was 25 years old. At the moment, she works only with her grandson, therefore they plant only little: they only have half a hectare of land, because the harvest only has to cover their own expenses, and any surplus they have they sell to pay back the loans. She spends time away from home for her work from 6:00 a. m. until 10:00 a. m.

She asks for a loan from Credicampo because she needs it to buy a sack of fertilizer, and she will pay one person to help her with the work. It is her dream that God gives her a long life so she can continue to work, so that her grandson lacks nothing.

loans.use: to buy one sack of fertilizer and to pay for hired help.

loans.name: Dalis Yulieth

texts.es:
Dalis una joven de 23 años de edad con sueños y aspiraciones y un gran espíritu de protección hacia sus dos hijos y por los cuales busca alternativas para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida ya que su esposo al ser un humilde trabajador no puede ofrecerles todas las comodidades que quisiera.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de pollos y cerdos y realiza una capacitación que brinda una entidad del gobierno a familias microempresarias para en un futuro volverlas exitosas y competitivas. 
Dalis gracias a los conocimientos adquiridos identifico falencias en su negocio y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para la compra de gallinas y cerdos para maximizar su negocio y aplicar conceptos vistos en clase lo que le supondría una notoria mejora en sus ventas para sacar su hijos, su familia, su vida adelante.
texts.en:
Dalis is a 23-year-old with dreams and aspirations, and with a great spirit of protection towards her two children. She seeks alternatives to provide a better quality of life as her husband, despite being a humble worker, cannot offer all the comforts as he would like. 

She currently works selling chickens and pigs, and for a government entity performing personnel training to micro-entrepreneurial families to help make them successful and competitive in the future. 

Thanks to her background knowledge, she has identified weaknesses in her business. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy chickens and pigs to maximize her business and apply concepts she has learned to show marked improvements in sales and move her children, family, and life forward.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs to get her humble family ahead, leaving behind a past of poverty and opening up new avenues of progress.

loans.name: Guerreros Para Cristo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Martha is the coordinator of her group, Guerrero para Cristo 1, 2, & 3 (Warrior for Christ). This group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. She is mother of two and she lives together with her children and her long-term partner. To earn a living, she operates a food stall where she sells chicken, meat, rice, beans and other fruits and vegetables. She says that her most difficult challenge is  when her children get sick. In the meantime, she plans to continue studying to become professional.

Martha is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza. She has been saving her profits because, through this business, she wants to make one of her dreams come true: to have a successful business, with which she can be able to have a safer home and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, meat and charcoal

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Juliana is one of the members of the group Luz y Esperanza 1, 2, & 3, which is comprised of fifteen micro-businesspeople who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, and other items. They are located in the city of Samana, a developing tourist town that lies on the Atlantic coast and is rich in natural resources. Juliana lives with her long-term partner and their 5 children.

Juliana runs a clothing sales business. She started this business with her savings. She is very excited to be receiving her 4th Esperanza Internacional loan. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and has taken steps to expand her business. Juliana is requesting a loan to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothes. She will reinvest the profit from her loan into her business and provide for her family. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Santi Pala Group

texts.en:
Wayan, as the head of the Santi Pala group, feels very proud. The group he heads succeeded in maintaining their businesses and made their payments on time. During the loan period, the farming businesses they pursued made maximum results. It's all because of the hard work and the weather that supported them. Now they can set aside the income for savings.

Wayan has cacao plants. He earned a satisfactory result. And after he deducted all the costs, he was very grateful. Wayan and the Santi Pala group said thank you to lenders, Kiva and MUK for the loan support. And they hope for a new loan to continue their farming businesses.

Now the dry season has arrived and the Santi Pala members changed their way of planting their garden. Now they only plant long beans, nuts, cassava, and other crops that need less water. They are using the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Wayan also uses his loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. The group and Wayan expect a maximum result at the end and they will manage their land wisely and work hard to maintain the crops to prevent insects and diseases.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: 13 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Thu  is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

She  has a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she  faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

In 2009, Thu  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She  has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She  is the group leader of the 13 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

With her business profit, Thu  hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Aura Mireya

texts.es: Doña Aura es una persona trabajadora, Comerciante de ropa usada, ella se moviliza dos días a la semana a las comarcas aledañas a ofertar ropa a sus clientes, su mayor dificultad es en tiempo de lluvia que los ríos no dan pasada en esta temporada sus ventas tienden a bajar, también vende en su casa de habitación cuando no sale a vender ropa hace comidas rápidas como enchiladas, repochetas y así ella va poco a poco incrementando sus ingresos para sus gastos.  Sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. Doña Aura  Necesita crédito para comprar una paca de ropa americana que ya la tiene encargada, ya que la ropita que oferta por el momento es de muy mala calidad y no obtiene mucha ganancia por lo que necesita mejorar su inventario.  Desea continuar incrementando sus ventas y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Aura is a hardworking person. She is a merchant who sells used clothing and mobilizes two days a week to sell clothing to her customers in neighboring regions .  Her greatest difficulty is during the rainy season when the rivers are impassible and her sales tend to plummet.  She also sells clothing in her home.

When she does not go out to sell clothing, she makes fast food, such as enchiladas and repochetas (a type of quesadilla/taco), and thus gradually augments her income to meet her expenses. Her children are all self-supporting adults.

Doña Aura needs a loan to purchase a bundle of American clothing, which she has already commissioned. The clothing she is currently offering is of very bad quality and she does not earn much of a profit. Consequently she needs to improve her inventory. She wants to continue increasing her sales and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new computer for her oldest son

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
At the age of 56, Rosie stays at home and manages her sari-sari store. She is married to Expedito, who is a tricycle driver. The couple usually earns PHP 6,000 a month, which is only enough for their daily household expenses. 

With that, Rosie is asking for a PHP 200,000 loan from Kiva lenders to pay the tuition fee of her child. Expero Sien is 16 years of age and will be attending college. Being the only child, Expero Sien wants to finish college for she is the only one who will support her parents when they get old and can no longer work. Aside from that she is very optimistic that through her diploma she can alleviate her family's poverty. With that Expero Sien hopes that lenders will grant her mother’s requested loan amount.

loans.use: To pay her child's tuition fee

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en el Distrito de Pachacamac junto a su familia.
Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Administración en un Instituto de la zona donde reside.
Desde hace 2 años tiene su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, teniendo mucha aceptación por parte de los clientes porque ofrece buenos productos, y porque es una persona muy amable y respetuosa.
Luz está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para hacer crecer el negocio y generar más ingresos para más adelante cumplir su gran sueño: "Ampliar su negocio y convertirse en una gran empresaria"
texts.en:
Liz is a young entrepreneur.  She is 21 years old, single, and lives in the Pachacamac district with her family.

She is studying for a management career at a local area institution and has had her own business for two years, selling groceries and personal products.  She is very well accepted by her customers because she offers good products and is friendly and respectful.

Luz is grateful to the Kiva lenders because their support has allowed her to buy merchandise with which to grow her business and generate more income so that she can complete her dream in the future, “Expand her business and become a great entrepreneur.”

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 46 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Vivian is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Vivian has been buying and selling livestock for 15 years and earns additional income from food vending and buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is 52 years old and married, with eight children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Conception is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

Conception has been in pig-fattening for ten years and also earns additional income from vegetable-vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Vilma De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Vilma, con ayuda del crédito anterior mejoro la productividad de su cultivo, los ingresos y calidad de vida de su familia.
Vilma se decidió por un nuevo crédito; porque  ve en ellos la oportunidad de tener los insumos agrícolas de manera inmediata para iniciar su próxima siembra; lo invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, semilla, plaguicidas, insecticidas y pagara mano de obra para realizar los diferentes trabajos, sembrar frijol y maíz.
texts.en:
Vilma improved the productivity of her crop with the help of the previous loan. It also improved the income, and quality of life of her family.

Vilma decided to get a new loan because she sees in them the opportunity to get the farming supplies to start her next sowing season; she’ll invest it in the purchase of compost, fertilizers, seeds, pest-control substances, insecticides, and she’ll pay for the labor to do the different jobs cultivating beans and corn.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, pest-control substances, insecticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es:
Noemy de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, ya que no pudo seguir porque sus padres no la mandaron a la escuela, para dedicarla a oficios domésticos, esta acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, ellos trabajan en el campo y no estudian.


Noemy, tiene 30 años de estar dedicándose al cuido de animales propios desde niña trabaja con su papá en esta actividad , luego él murió de un infarto y ella lucho sola por sobrevivir, cuando se acompaño empezó a trabajar con su compañero en el cuido de animales.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 2 vacas lecheras, con la venta de leche podrá comprar otros alimentos para su grupo familiar y crecerá con su hato de animales.


Noemy, sueña con terminar su vivienda y ponerla muy bonita para que su familia pueda tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Noemy, 61, has a first grade education, because she was not able to continue in school; her parents did not send her so that she could work on the household chores.  She has a partner and 3 children who work in the fields and do not go to school.

Noemy has been working caring for animals for 30 years.  She worked in this activity with her father when she was a child.  Later, he died of a heart attack and she struggled to survive.  When she got a partner she started working with him caring for animals.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO will be used to buy 2 dairy cows.  With the sale of their milk, she will be able to buy other food for her family and expand her herd of animals.  

Noemy dreams of finishing her home and making it very nice so that her family can have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy 2 dairy cows

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.  With her $1,000 loan she will buy items such as onions, garlic and tomatoes to sell. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.  

Running a business has made Luisa independent because she can be responsible for herself, and she is also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy onions, garlic, and tomatoes

loans.name: Los Leones De Quillabamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS LEONES DE QUILLABAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quillabamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina ella es conviviente y tiene 43 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de pasamanería, la socia vende artículos de limpieza, plásticos entre otros, la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender los artículos de limpieza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar artículos de limpieza y plásticos.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: These members belong to the "LOS LEONES DE QUILLABAMBA" communal bank.  This bank is located in the Santa Ana district, which belongs to the province of Quillabamba in the department of Cusco.  One of the members is Agripina, who is 43 years old, lives with her life partner and has 3 children.  She has a business selling cleaning products and plastic items, among other things.  She works as a mobile vendor from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has been doing this work for 6 years and it is going well.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her cleaning products.  She is requesting this loan to buy cleaning products and plastic items.  The other members work selling food, selling clothing, operating a grocery store and operating a restaurant.  The member is grateful to those who are helping with this dream, and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products and plastic items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy educational equipment for her son

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.en: In the year 2010, Mamerto learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. As a farmer in Dolipos, Oroquieta, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his corn production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Mamerto feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. Recently, he took a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Mamerto wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en: Silvana has switched from selling snacks to selling "longganisa" (processed meat). Her business is doing well after she doubled her time perfecting her own longganisa recipe. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits. She keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. The reason  she availed another loan from PMPC is to buy more kilos of meat for her longganisa business. Today, Silvana is able to help others sell her longganisa and they earn money for their own families as well.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of meat to make longganisa

loans.name: Jojo

texts.en: This is Jojo, a married man with three children, and he is 33 years old. Jojo is asking for a loan amounting to Php 35,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds. Jojo is a hardworking person. Every morning he wakes up early to check his crops. Jojo hopes that his farming business will go well so that he can sustain the needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and vitamins for her business.

Helen has been in this business for 25 years. She earns more income from her general store.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Jeneian

texts.en:
Jeneian is 37 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Jeneian works very hard to provide for them.

Jeneian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Jeneian has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, beer, snack foods, etc. 

Jeneian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción de 50 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer grado, ya que sus padres no la mandaron a la escuela, esta casada y vive con una hija y 3 nietos, su hija vende tortillas, actividad con la cual se gana la vida y para mandar a estudiar a los niños.


Concepción, tiene 5 años de haber iniciado su pequeña tienda, antes vendía verduras ambulante, pero por su avanzada edad dejo de trabajar en ello, el trabajo de la tienda lo aprendió por la misma necesidad de conseguir ingresos para subsistir.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar arroz, frijoles, maíz, galletas, verduras, detergentes, articulos del cuidado personal, etc  para surtir su tienda, y poder cumplir las necesidades de sus clientes, esto ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos para darle continuidad a su negocio.


Concepción, sueña con tener una minisuper, para ello esta trabajando muy duro y atendiendo muy bien a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Concepción, 50 years old, only went to school until the third grade because her parents did not send her to school. She is married and lives with a daughter and three grandchildren. Her daughter sells tortillas, a business that enables her to support herself and send her children to school.

Five years ago, Concepción opened a small store; before that she was a street vendor selling vegetables. However due to her advanced age, she stopped doing that work. She learned how to run a store due to her need to earn an income to subsist.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase rice, beans, corn, cookies, vegetables, detergent, personal care items, etc. to stock her store and meet the demands of her customers. This will help her to improve her income and insure the continuity of her business.

Concepción dreams of having a mini-super market. To achieve this, she is working very hard and providing very good service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, corn, cookies, vegetables, detergent and personal care items, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de empresas, ella comenta que es huérfana de padre, y que vive con su mama. Y sus tres hermanos.
Ella quiere terminar sus estudios para poder volverse una buena profesional, y en el futuro poder tener su propia empresa.
Celia pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y también poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir sus estudios.
texts.en:
Celia is from the city of Caaguazu. She is a student in the business administration career track. She says that she is orphaned of her father and lives with her mother and her three siblings. She wants to finish her studies to be able to become a good professional and, in the future, to be able to have her own company.

Celia requests this loan in order to be able to invest it in paying her university fees and also to be able to cover her living expenses. 

She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees and cover living expenses.

loans.name: Behelia

texts.en:
Behelia has mastered her hog raising business in Aloran. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to get credit to fully support her business. 

Just as she takes care her hog raising business, she intends to take care of her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always ask for any financing needs. Now, the loan of Php 12,000 will help her build a concrete pig pen that will support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is an old client with the organization who is securing a loan of 30,000 PHP. He is married and takes care of his family. He deals in crop growing as his major source of income.

He joined ASKI to get financial assistance to expand his business and make more profits from farming after he has fertilized his plantation. His dream is to expand his business and hopes that with this loan from ASKI, his profits will increase. 

He is thankful to Kiva and ASKI for the financial assistance granted to him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for his farming business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Analyn has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, Analyn availed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Analyn wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer, 49 years old, is married with two adult-aged children. He is a very responsible father and husband. He loves to serve his community. He is known in their area for being a hardworking person. 

Elmer is borrowing money from Kiva to have additional capital for his business so that he can give or sustain the needs of his children, most especially in their school needs. His wish for his life, is to see his children finish their studies. He doesn't want them to repeat what happened to him because he is only an elementary school graduate.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for his framing business

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia found the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC to Rogelia came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. 

Now, she has availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount to pay for land and seedbed preparation.  Rogelia perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals so as to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: To pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Elizar

texts.en: Elizar makes a living through his retailing business. He runs a lumberyard in Aloran and earns a promising income to support his family. He has signed up his membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. He wants to increase his inventory. Now, he availed a loan to purchase more lumber to sell. Elizar hopes to sustain his business and dreams of sending all his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
Albino lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He earns income through selling used shoes in the market to support the needs of his three children. He has been doing this for ten years. He gets a good income from this business. For a 68-year old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy, except to see his children's success.

Without hesitation, Albino is borrowing a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional used shoes to resell. He joined GDMPC recently. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional used shoes to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Jennifer

texts.en:
Ma. Jennifer is 40 years old and married with one child.

Ma. Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Jennifer has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

Ma. Jennifer aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marialyn works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marialyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 34 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 32 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been farming sugarcane for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 35 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 2 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Antonina is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Josue Otoniel

texts.es:
Josue de 30 años de edad,  su esposa le ayuda en las labores de los cultivos y cuido del ganado.


Josue, tiene 10 años de estar dedicado a la siembra de maíz, pipían y otras hortalizas, este oficio lo aprendió con el abuelo, y por hoy es la única fuente de ingresos para subsistir con su familia.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla de maíz y pipian, herbicidas y pesticidas y cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados y una novilla de repasto, esto ayudara a obtener alguna ganancia para pagar el crédito y su alimentación.


Josue, sueña en comprar un sistema de riego por aspersión, para hacer sus sembradíos durante todo el año, así mejorara su situación económica y la de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Josue is 30 years old, and his wife helps him in his work growing crops and raising cattle.  For ten years Josue has been growing corn, squash, and other vegetables.  This is work that he learned from his grandfather, and  today it is the sole source of income for his family. The loan that he is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy corn and squash seeds, herbicides and pesticides, in order to plant 7,000 square meters and to feed a heifer.  This will help him to earn income to repay the loan and to buy food.  Josue dreams of buying an irrigation system, in order to be able to grow crops all year longh.  In this way he will improve his family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy corn and squash seeds, herbicides and pesticides, in order to plant 7,000 square meters and to feed a heifer.  This will help him to earn income to repay the loan and to buy food.

loans.name: Sinar Rejeki Group

texts.en:
The Sinar Rejeki group made their payment of 7,500,000 IDR to MUK on time. They tell the MUK's staff that there was increased profit earned during the loan period of six months. The pigs grew fat and healthy. They could sell the pigs for a high price because there is lots of demand from the market. The situations stimulate their spirit to run the business. 

The group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva and the client continue smoothly and last a long time. The Sinar Rejeki group received a new loan, again for 7,500,000 IDR. The loan will be used for increasing the number of piglets, renovating the barns and purchasing superior feed. The group still needs a loan until they have enough capital to run the business by themselves. Now they already have savings and use it for capital.

Dewa Ayu and the members feel happy receiving the support all this time from Lenders, Kiva and MUK. She’s using the loan to purchase 2 superior piglets and feed. She hopes she can have enough savings soon and continue the business by herself.
.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: San Bartolome Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “SAN BARTOLOME” están dedicados a diversas actividades del comercio minorista y a prestar servicios. Mónica tiene 52 años de edad es casada con un nieto a quien apoya. Ella cuenta con puesto de trabajo en cual expende menú y desayuno hace un año. Ella aprendió dicha actividad con su madre con la cual trabajo 30 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios nuevos  arroz azúcar al por mayor. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Mónica es la primera persona del lado derecho. Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Abel en la parte superior derecho  que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Members of the San Bartolome group work in a variety of jobs in the retail and service industries.  

Mónica is 52 years old.  She is married, with a grandchild that she supports.  She has had a job selling breakfasts and meal packages for a year.  She learned this line of work from her mother, with whom she worked for thirty years.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of new utensils, rice, and sugar in bulk.  

The group is grateful to Kiva investors for the loan.  Mónica is the first person from the right.  The photo that is attached in the upper right is of Abel, who couldn’t be present at the meeting due to his work.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, rice, and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably with a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 49,900. She will purchase iron bars and roof sheets. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that Merlyn was given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she was thankful for when all her financing needs for her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase iron bars and roof sheets.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора молодая и трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 18 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Нигора научилась у портнихи шитью женской одежды. Она теперь хочет организовать свой собственный бизнес. Нигора участвовала с такой целью на курсе «Добейся успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она нуждается в швейной машинке. Нигора запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Будущим она планирует открыть свое ателье. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nigora is a young, hardworking girl.  She is 18, unmarried and lives with her parents.  She learned how to make women's clothing from a professional seamstress, and would like to start her own sewing business in turn.  With that goal in mind, she enrolled in a course titled "Achieve Success" organized by an association for businesswomen and received a certificate upon completion.  She is currently in need of a sewing machine to get started, and is seeking a loan of 1500 somoni to buy one.  She hopes to eventually open her own dressmaking shop, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine to start a new business

loans.name: Lenying

texts.en:
Lenying is married to Jessie, who is working as a security guard. They are gifted with four children. The eldest is 16 years of age, and the youngest is 6. All of them are studying. 

As parents, they do want their children to finish a college education. However, they do not have enough money to sustain their education, especially the college one. Because of that, they are requesting a PHP 200,000 loan from Kiva lenders through ASKI for the full tuition fee for their eldest child, Kyna. 

As the eldest child, Kyna is determined to have a college diploma, for it will be her pass to have a profitable job someday. She promises her parents that she will help them support the educational needs of her youngest siblings. 

Kyna is a very hardworking student; she sees to it that she is deserving of her parents’ perseverance and love.

loans.use: to pay her eldest child's tuition fee.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 38 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Clarita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Clarita has been raising livestock for 20 years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Dolores Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito La Mano De Dios.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y una de 9  años la cual estudian en escuela, todos sus hijos aun vive con ellos. El marido es jubilado. Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Dolores tiene en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella también tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad en la cual vende bisutería y  prendas que ella elabora, en este lugar le ayuda una hija con las ventas ya que ella tiene que dedicarse a sus trabajos de costura. Lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual les dieron una buena educación sus hijos.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar bisutería, telas y otros materiales para la costura. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son mejorar cada día más.
texts.en: In an area of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the La Mano de Dios credit group meet every two weeks.  In this city lives Dolores, who is 52 years old and lives in a common-law relationship from which she has four children.  Three of her children are adults, and one is 9 years old and attending school.  All of her children still live with her.  Her husband is retired.  Several years ago she learned how to sew at a local academy.  Dolores has a small sewing business in her home, and makes all kinds of clothing for women, men and children.  She also has a business in the center of the city where she sells jewelry and clothing that she makes.  Her daughter helps her with sales at this location, because she needs to devote herself to her sewing work.  She has been doing this work for more than 20 years, and with it she has provided a good education to her children.  This new loan will be used to buy jewelry, fabric and other sewing supplies.  She has been with the credit group since its beginning, and she likes it because the loans always help her very much.  Her dream is to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, fabric and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Luis Marcial

texts.es:
Luis es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el distrito de Quilmana junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 1 años trabaja brindado seguridad a una empresa prestigiosa en la ciudad donde reside.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre dedicado a su labor.
Luis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar las paredes de su casa, así como también reparará el piso y comprará una cama y un colchón, de esta manera poco a poco podrá construir su cuarto para tener mayor comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis is an enterprising 20-year-old man.  He is single and lives in the Quilmana district with his family.  For more than a year he has been working providing security at a prestigious business in the city where he lives.  He is a person with a great desire to get ahead, and is always dedicated to his work.  Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because with their support he has been able to remodel the walls of his house, repair the floor, and buy a bed and a mattress.  In this way he is building his room, little by little, in order to be more comfortable and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair the walls and floor of his house and to buy a bed and a mattress.

loans.name: Emalin

texts.en: Emalin has been helping her husband work on their own farm to make a living. She earns well from this business, and she successfully repaid her previous loan used for her farm. She always finds ways to improve their living situation. With her revenue, she was able to cultivate the vacant farm for improvement. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. She is hopeful to gain more returns from the farm. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Christine Joy

texts.en: Christine is managing her eatery business in Aloran. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This business has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering for added income. Recently, she took a loan to purchase more meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support for her family. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of fixing the pig pens with concrete, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Clarita runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 6 years, selling a variety of items. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, like detergent soap, coffee, soft-drinks, shampoo, noodles, etc. Clarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like detergent soap, coffee, soft-drinks, shampoo, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and has five children. Lourdes is married and one of her children is still in school.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lourdes has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 44 years old and has six children. Marivic is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marivic is requesting a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Marivic has been raising livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Solidad has been in this business for 13 years. Solidad earns more income from fish and shell vending.

Solidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es:
Todos los días tras tomar un cafecito caliente, Josefa ya está lista para abrir su pequeña pulpería. Una sonrisa cálida recibe la clientela, lo que asegura su regreso. Ella  tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, ambos mayores e independientes. Inició su negocio hace seis años, puesto que no podía seguir laborando en otras áreas  por motivos de edad. Sin embargo, ha logrado salir adelante con el apoyo de su familia. Empezó vendiendo sólo golosinas y con esmero y dedicación logró estar donde está ahora. 
Josefa solicita el crédito para aumentar  la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos, tales como arroz y frijoles; también aceite, condimentos, pan, gaseosa, productos de aseo personal, entre otros. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que  anhela invertir más y obtener buenas ganancias. Es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, uno de sus planes futuros es establecer una miscelánea con el objetivo de generar más ingresos, para  asegurar un futuro pacífico y seguro.
texts.en:
Every day after drinking a hot cup of coffee, Josefa is ready to open her small grocery store.  Her customers get a warm smile which makes sure they will return.  She is 58 years old, married, and has two sons, both adult and independent.  Josefa began her business six years ago, since she could no longer work in other areas because of her age.  Nevertheless, she has succeeded in getting ahead with her family's support.  She began by selling just candies and with hard work and dedication has succeeded in getting as far as she has. 

Josefa is asking for the loan to increase her capital stock.  She needs to buy basic grains,such as rice and beans, and also oil, condiments, bread, soft drinks, and personal care products among other things.  She relies on this financing, since she wants to invest more and have better earnings. She is a fighting, entrepreneurial woman.  One of her plans for the future is to start a general store to earn more income and thus be sure of a peaceful, secure future.

loans.use: to stock her store with basic grains, such as rice and  beans, also oil, condiments, bread, soft drinks and personal care products

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria earns a living from selling fruits in her retail store. She has had this business for many years and earns well from it. She has also been able to buy some items like appliances to improve her home. She had competitors in the village, but she never worried, for she had her loyal customers who visited her store to purchase their fruits. To add inventory, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy more variety of fruits in volume. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of sustaining their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fruits in volume

loans.name: Hipatia Viviana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito La Mano De Dios.
En este lugar vive la señora Hipatia, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no tiene hijos. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Hipatia es una  mujer que le gusta trabajar para así forjarse un mejor futuro para ella y para cuando lleguen sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio informal, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, carteras y varios productos más que le dan ganancias para seguir adelante, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a realizar sus recorridos en las horas que sabe que puede encontrar a sus clientes ya sea en la mañana o en las noches, deja a crédito esta mercadería y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva más de 5 años dedicada esta actividad con la cual se gana lo propio para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar carteras, zapatos y ropa. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un bebé.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the credit group La Mano de Dios credit group meet  in an area of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi,  known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.   Hipatia, 27 years old, lives here.  She is in a common-law relationship and does not have children yet. Her husband is a salesman. 

Hipatia is a woman who likes working to build a future for herself and for the time when her children have been born.  She works at informal sales, selling every kind of clothing, shoes, wallets and other products which provide her earnings to get ahead.  Her means of sale is door to door.  She makes her rounds at the times when she knows she will find her customers, be that in the morning or at night. She sells her merchandise on credit and collects every eight or fifteen days.  Hipatia has worked at this trade for more than five years, earning something to help her husband with household costs.

This loan is to buy wallets, shoes and clothing.  Hipatia has been a member of the credit groups since it was founded and likes getting ahead through its loans.  Her dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: to buy, wallets, shoes and clothing

loans.name: Santos Sr.

texts.en:
Santos is 38 years old. He is the father of five children who all go to school. 

He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase rice production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed and support labor costs for his business.

loans.name: Almarie

texts.en:
Almarie believes there is money in trash. Any scraps or junk that can be salvaged would mean income for the family. She has the skills of buying and selling. 

For her junk shop, Almarie borrowed an amount to purchase a weighing scale. This will be used when she roams the town for her buy-and-sell business. 

She hopes to build a decent house with enough savings in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a weighing scale for her buying and selling of junk.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Aside from earning income with her grocery store, Olga has a farm as their main source of income. She has successfully repaid her previous loans used for her business. 

To improve her farm, she took a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase organic fertilizer. 

She was determined enough to improve her business as well as her farm to offer a better living to the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ennis María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito La Mano De Dios.
En este lugar vive la señora Ennis, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es abogado.
Doña Ennis es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar lo suyo con su trabajo, ella se dedica a varias actividades, es enfermera de profesión y realiza trabajos de este tipo, también es fotógrafa y muchas personas le buscan para que capture los mejores momentos en fiestas o compromisos sociales, también es comerciante,  vende ropa, zapatos por catálogos así como también productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días y sus otras actividades cuando los clientes le busquen, lleva más de 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, zapatos y ropa. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "La Mano De Dios" (The hand of G-d) communal bank meets every two weeks in the municipal housing block of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  The area has been known for many years as the city of the true tamarind.
This is where señora Ennis lives.  She is 59-years old, married and with her husband has four grown children.  One of her children still lives with her.  Her husband is a lawyer. 
Doña Ennis is a woman who likes to be self-sufficient and earn what she has through her work.  She earns her living with various activities.  Professionally, she is a nurse and does nursing work.  She is also a photographer and many people seek her out to capture the finest moments at their parties and social engagements.  In addition, señora Ennis is a business woman.  She sells clothing, catalog shoes and also Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories.)  She works three days a week, three hours a day on her sales.  She sells her products on credit and collects payments every week.  She works in her other businesses when her customers need her.  She has been in this line of work for more than sixteen years, and it has been going very well for her. 	
This loan will be used for the purchase of perfumes, lotions, shoes and clothing.  Señora Ennis has been in her communal bank since its inception and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her hope is to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Simita

texts.en:
Simita is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows kava to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Simita has requested a loan to buy a rake, a spade, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, etc. 

She has been a member of SBPD since this 2014. With her profits, Simita hopes to support her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a rake, a spade, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, etc

loans.name: Mataua

texts.en: Mataua is 42 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling taro chips and banana chips in her community and has been doing this for four years. Mataua has requested a loan to buy a frying pan, containers, oil, plastic bags etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mataua will save to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, a frying pan, a pot, plastic bags, and bananas

loans.name: Katiarina Brenda

texts.es:
Katiarina es una joven emprendedora, tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Nazca junto a su familia.
Tiene un hijo por quien lucha constantemente para poder sacarlo adelante, El ser madre soltera no fue impedimento para que ella sobresaliera.
Estudió la carrera de Enfermería y desde hace 2 años ejerce su carrera en una Posta Médica. Le va muy bien porque es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y porque es muy trabajadora.
También es dueña de un pequeño terreno y se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de naranja, ofreciendo productos de excelente calidad y a un buen precio
Katiarina está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes y pesticidas para poder hacer el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de naranja, con esto ella mejorará la producción y tendrá más ingresos y más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Construir su propia casa y dedicarse a su propio negocio para darle una buena educación a su hija".
texts.en:
Katiarina is a young entrepreneur. She is 27 years old. She is single and lives in Nazca with her family.

She has a child whom she struggles constantly to raise. Being a single mother was not an impediment to her excelling. She studied in a program in nursing, and for two years she has been practicing her career at a health post. It is going very well for her because she is a person with a great will to advance and because she is very hard-working.

She is also the owner of a small plot of land, and she raises and sells oranges, offering products of excellent quality at a good price.

Katiarina is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have offered her she will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides to be able to maintain her orange grove. With this she will improve production and have more income, and in the future she will be able to accomplish her greatest dream: to build her own house and work in her own business to be able to give her daughter a good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her orange grove

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon, who is 50, has a stable home with his wife and two children. He lives in his own home in the village of Delfin Albano, which is a rural area in Isabela. 

Ramon works in agriculture, growing crops in their area. 

He has applied to Kiva for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy plant sanitation products and fertilizer, and to pay workers. 

As a result, his productively and this will lead to a higher yield, a better quality product, and he will therefore have no problem selling his produce.

loans.use: to buy plant sanitation products and fertilizer, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Heisler Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Heisler es un mecánico de motos y carros muy experimentado. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.
Adicional a su labor como mecánico también tiene un pequeño almacén de venta de repuestos automotrices en el cual ofrece distintos tipos de repuestos en diferentes marcas.
Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.
El solicita un préstamo para surtir su almacén con gran cantidad de repuestos, de este modo podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Heisler is a very experienced auto and motorcycle mechanic. He has acquired many skills through his brief studies at various schools, and the rest he has learned empirically.

In addition to his work as a mechanic, he also has a small shop for automotive spare parts, where he offers different types of spare parts of different brands.

He is a very hard-working and honest man who knows the significance that cars have for their owners, and it is for this reason that he always tries to offer excellent service of good quality in an efficient manner.

He is applying for a loan to stock his store with a large quantity of parts. In this way he will be able to have the products ready for his customers.

loans.use: to buy stock for his repair shop

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock.  Elma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Santos De Jesús

texts.es:
Santos de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, esta casado, su esposa realiza los oficios domésticos del hogar y trabaja 15 días en una venta de ropa, es padre de un hijo de 4 años de edad.

Santos inicio a trabajar a los 13 años como ayudante de albañilería y también aprendió la agricultura por su padre, hoy en día continua laborando en estas dos actividades, el área que siembra es de 7,000 metros de cultivo de maíz.


El crédito que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, semilla y pago de mano de obra, para cultivar  7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz.

El sueño de Santos es comprar un terrenito para  construir una vivienda digna para su grupo familiar. También sueña en comprar animales para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 26 years old, went to school through ninth grade. He is married. His wife does the domestic work of the household and works 15 days selling clothing. He is the father of a four-year-old son.

Santos began to work at the age of 13 as an assistant to a mason, and he also learned agriculture through his father. Now he continues working in these two activities. The area that he plants is 7000 square meters of corn.

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, and seeds and pay for labor to cultivate 7000 square meters of corn.

Santos' dream is to buy a little plot of land to construct a worthy residence for his family group. He also dreams of buying animals to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, and seeds and pay for labor to cultivate 7000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo de 68 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, esta casado, su esposa se dedica a oficios domésticos y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya están casados y poseen su propio hogar.

Domingo, ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura, hoy trabaja un área de 17,500 metros de cultivos de maíz, también todos los días sale a vender pan por todo el cantón donde vive, en agricultura trabaja junto a su hijo, quien le ayuda en todo tiempo.
.
El crédito que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas y pesticidas para cultivar  17,500 metros cuadrados de maíz.

El sueño de Domingo es tener mas animales, tener su propio terreno y construir una casita para darles una mejor vivienda a su familia.
texts.en:
Domingo is 68 years old; he studied up to the first grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the house. They have two children who are married and have their own homes.

Domingo has worked his entire life in agriculture. Currently, he cultivates an area of 17,500 meters of corn. As well, he goes to sell bread all over his town every day. In agriculture he works with his son who helps him all the time. 

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide to cultivate 17,500 meters squares of corn. 

Domingo’s dream is to have more animals, to have his own land and to build a small house in order to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide to cultivate 17,500 meters squares of corn.

loans.name: Ana Yanira

texts.es:
Ana de 34 años de edad,  estudio hasta educación básica, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian.


Ana aprendió el oficio de cosmetologia, aunque aun no tiene ingresos para abrir su propio negocio. Ana tiene una tienda y todas las tardes elabora pupusas para vender, de esta forma obtiene ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.


El crédito que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar pan, arroz, sal, azúcar, embutidos, jabón, detergentes, golosinas, etc. para surtir el negocio de la tienda que posee.

El sueño de Ana, es tener una sala de belleza, ver crecer a sus hijos y darles lo que necesitan, darles estudio para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 34 years old, has a basic education. She is a single mother and has two children who are in school.

Ana learned the cosmetology trade, although she doesn't have the income to open her own business. She has a store, and every afternoon she makes pupusas [a typical dish of El Salvador] to sell. In this way she obtains income to cover the household expenses.

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy bread, rice, salt, sugar, processed meats, soap, detergents, candies, etc., to stock her store.

Ana's dream is to have a beauty salon, to see her children grow up and to give them what they need, and to give them an education so that they can be good people.

loans.use: to buy bread, rice, salt, sugar, processed meats, soap, detergents, candy, etc. to stock her store

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en: Fifty-three-year-old Clemente lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has worked in agriculture, planting rice for 25 years. He markets his products in the outskirts of the area, which is how he makes his sales, and he has been able to pay off some household expenses. Oscar is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. and to improve his land, which is shown in the photo. With this, he will be able to continue with his work to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. and to improve his land, which is shown in the photo.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is a 58-year-old married woman. She settled in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines to earn a living together with her three children. Over the past seven years, Sherly was able to put up a retail store that absolutely met the market's primary demands in their village. Until now, the business is still doing well and is giving better cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. 

Sherly joined GDMPC in 2012 to have an easy access to financial services. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery goods to sell. Sherly expects an increase in sales to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Amparo Concepción

texts.es:
Amparo de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta la educación básica, es madre de 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando.

Amparo tiene 10 años de trabajar en un taller de costureria, esta es una de las fuentes de ingresos que tiene, y la otra es de agricultura siembra de maíz, la cual con ayuda de su madre y sus tres hijos logran realizar los trabajos de esta actividad.


El crédito que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra  y para mejorar su vivienda.


El sueño de Amparo es esforzarse mucho para darles lo mejor a sus hijos, pues sabe que estudiando podrán tener mejores oportunidades en la vida. También, sueña en tener un taller propio de costureria, para obtener mejores ingresos y poder dar una mejor alimentación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amparo is 34-years old.  She finished primary school and is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school.  

Amparo has been working in a seamstress's workshop for ten years.  That is one of her sources of income; the other is agriculture.  Amparo plants corn.  She carries out the farm work with the help of her mother and her three children. 

The loan that Amparo is requesting from CREDICAMPO is for the purchase of corn seed, compost, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides and to pay for labor to make some improvements to her home. 

Amparo's dream is to put forth a great effort to give her children the best.  She knows that by going to school they will have the best opportunities in life.  In addition she hope to have her own seamstress's workshop to earn a better income and give her children a better diet.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, compost, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides and to pay for labor to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Mayerlin Maidol

texts.es:
Mayerlin es una joven estudiante, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Nuevo Imperial junto a su familia.
Actualmente estudia la carrera profesional de Computación y desde hace 1 años trabaja en los campos agrícolas de la zona donde reside.
Mayerlin está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá hacer remodelaciones a su domicilio como tarrajear y pintar las paredes, así como comprar un juego de comedor para que su familia pueda sentirse más cómoda y mejorar su calidad de vida, con esto ella seguirá luchando para conseguir su gran sueño: "Terminar su carrera de Computación y ser una gran Profesional".
texts.en:
Mayerlin is a young student, she is 21 years old. She is single and lives in Nuevo Imperial with her family.

She is currently studying the professional career of computers and over one year ago she has been working in the agricultural fields where she resides.

Mayerlin is very thankful with Kiva lenders because with their help she will be able to make renovations to her house like plastering and painting the walls as well as buying a dining room set so that her family can be more comfortable and improve their quality of life. With this she will continue striving towards achieving her biggest dream: “Completing her career in computers and becoming a great professional.”

loans.use: Renovations to her house (plastering and painting the walls, buying a dining room set)

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años de edad , no asistió  a la escuela, sus padres decian que era mejor trabajar, que del estudio nadie comía, es viuda, su esposo murió hace 10 años. Es madre de 8 hijos, pero con ella solo viven dos y dos nietos.


Rosa toda su vida se a dedicado a la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres manifiesta, que a trabajado muy pesado para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella ya no trabaja en la agricultura pero sus hijos si. Manifiesta que su vida a sido muy dura trabando en algodoneras 10 horas diarias y después tenia que atender  su casa, pero hoy se siente contenta con Dios por haber sacado adelante todos sus hijos. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 700 ladrillos, 5 quintales de hierro, una camionada de piedra y otra de arena y cemento. Para construir la habitación de su hijo menor.


Rosa sueña en que su hijo menor se gradué en la universidad, ya que ella no tuvo esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 53 years old, did not go to school. Her parents said that it was better to work, that nobody could eat from going to school. She is a widow. Her husband died 10 years ago. She is the mother of 8 children, but only two of them and two grandchildren live with her.

Rosa has worked all her life in agriculture, work that she learned from her parents. She declares that she worked very hard to raise her children and now she does not work in agriculture, but her children do. She declares that her life has been very hard, working in the cotton industry 10 hours a day and afterwards having to take care of her house, but today she feels happy with God for having raised all her children.

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy 7000 bricks, 5 hundredweights of iron, a truckload of stone and another of sand and cement to construct a room for her younger son.

Rosa's dream is that her younger son will graduate from the university, since she did not have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy 700 bricks, 5 quintales of iron, a truckload of stone and another of sand and cement to build a room for her younger son

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru:
Сафармо жительница района Бохтар. Она профессиональная швея, а также заботливая мать и жена. Ей 43 года. Сафармо имеет четверых детей. Муж уехал работать в Россию, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Сама Сафармо вместе с дочерью занимается пошивом женской одежды на протяжении 6 лет.   
По причине нехватки финансов уже несколько лет Сафармо не делала ремонт в доме. Она отложила немного денег и чтобы провести этот долгожданный ремонт в доме, она еще просит кредит. Сафармо хочет улучшить условия быта и жить в нормальных условиях. Сафармо нуждается в вашей поддержке. Кредит она обещает погашать за счет своей швейной деятельности.
texts.en: Safarmo is a resident of the Bohtar region of Tajikistan.  She is a professional seamstress, as well as a caring mother and wife; she is 43 and has four children.  Her husband helps support the family as a migrant worker in Russia, while Safarmo and her daughter make women's clothing together and have been doing so for 6 years.  Safarmo's house has been in need of repairs for some time, but she's continually put them off for financial reasons.  She's managed to set aside some money for home repairs, and is requesting a loan as well to be able to start repairing her home at long last.  She wants to improve her quality of life and be able to live in a normal home, and needs your help to do so.  Through the money she earns as a seamstress, she guarantees that she'll be able to pay her loan back in full.

loans.use: improve her quality of life by renovating her home
